I was very excited to see that he had a new book out for my Kindle and I gobbled this one up in just a couple of days.Part of what makes this book special and excites me is that fact that it is book one!  This feels like an incredibly personal journey into Mr. Kusy's journey to self-actualization. He speaks fondly of his mother and grandfather and it is obvious that their excellent examples were part of his journey. He was slow to take off, taking the time to observe the world around him but what shines through is a man who takes great care and compassion with those around him. As a person with relatives in an aging home, I found it particularly heart warming that this man went there to work and came out with enlightenment for himself and for those he touched. There is a robust character Mr. Sinai who I particularly adored.You won't go wrong with this book, or frankly any book by Mr. Kusy. This may be my favorite, but it doesn't take away from all the others- it just enriches his total opera omnia.

Rarely do I receive a product for my child that I am thoroughly impressed with. This truck set is impressive on every level. They are brightly colored, interactive, and made so well. The kids love how chunky they are and that they have moving parts. A couple of them have buttons on top and the mixers spin. The best part of them is that they move on their own with friction and they go fast and far!!  Completely thrilled with how happy these trucks have made my babies.

these are the best portable dog bowls that I have seen. What makes them so much nicer is that the silicone is thick yet flexible enough to easily collapse. The bright colors are fun too!The bowls are excellent quality have a very very handy corner attachment for easy hanging, transport, and use.I wouldn't hesitate to buy these if I were you.

As soon as I saw this toy had suction cups I was prepared to be annoyed by it and to constantly be protecting my baby's head when he was near it in the tub. I am THRILLED to say that these suction cups are the first that I've encountered that actually stay attached to the tub. I have zero concerns about it falling because it's affixed so well and remains so.The toy itself is super fun and requires no batteries. It keeps my boy happy in the tub while I take care of the business of washing him. The frog is bright and very happy looking, his little tongue just kills me. The gears and pouring are great for fine motor skills.When my son gets tired of standing, he just chills in the tub playing with the little cups that come with this toy. I'm very impressed with it.*I was offered a sample for the purpose of providing a fair and honest review. The fact that I received this free of charge does not affect my opinion or testimony regarding the quality of this product.

What beautiful blankets!As moms we all know that muslin swaddles work for every single thing we might need.  Spit ups, swaddling, stroller covers, car seat covers, nursing shields, boogers wipers, hand cleaners, and snuggle buddies. The life of a blanket when given to a child is epic. So of course we want these blankets to be nice!This product exceeds expectations on every level. The packaging is beautiful and out of the box the blankets are soft, smell great, and are ready to use. The designs are adorable too so my kid baby is instantly attracted to them.I have washed the set once and they come out of the wash/dry perfect. No shrinking, fading, fraying, or other issues.*I was offered a sample for the purpose of providing a fair and honest review. The fact that I received this free of charge does not affect my opinion or testimony regarding the quality of this product.

I've been using this daily for a couple of weeks and I am really starting to see a difference. I'm not sure my skin looks whiter, because I'm pretty pale as it is, but it definitely looks brighter and feels very soft and smooth. What I'm seeing is a evening out of my skin tones and blending everything together nicer. It's really a nice effect!  The bottle is pretty and easy to use and it really only takes a small amount to see results. Very nice product!  I was given a sample free for review.

I was so excited about the arrival of this exciting product that I've been checking the tracking like it was my job. Lo and behold she arrived today and it was all I could do to not hug the UPS man!  I opened the box with wonder and awe and boy was I not disappointed. There she was... surrounded by a lovely yellow satin, more beautifully packaged than I could have even imagined. This would make a stunning gift for anyone!  I carefully removed her from the box and decided to have a go at it.First I lit some candles to set the mood. Then I popped on my favorite episode of Sons of Anarchy. It didn't take long for me to be totally feeling it, if you know what I mean. I started on level 3 and wowza Minnelli this baby packs a punch!  I had to quick turn it down to level 1 if I was going to make it to the good Jax scene!  My new best friend performed flawlessly and afterwards I just plugged her into the USB port (how convenient!) to charge. What a great morning!I was provided this vibrator free of charge in exchange for my honest review and I can honestly tell you, I need a nap!

I have been using this product for knee pain and have noticed a vast improvement. I consulted with my doctor about exactly where to place the electrodes which I think is a smart idea for everyone because there are all sorts of warnings about where NOT to put them.  I just felt safer having my doctor instruct me as to where would benefit me most. I have found that a 3 or a 4 setting works best for me although that might be a bit too much of a sting for some. I have a fairly high pain tolerance and I could probably go even a bit higher than that but for now that works great. I leave the electrodes on for 5 minutes at a time and do it three times per day.The machine itself is lightweight, easy to operate, and extremely portable. The pictures and buttons are pretty self explanatory and I found it very user friendly. This is a great little machine and at this price point you really can't go wrong. I was given a free sample for review purposes and I am very thankful to have it!

This mug is awesome! It's the perfect size for a drink that you want to stay cold and the handle is very cool and feels good in my hand.  I love the texture of the copper and the fact that it's not lined. Before I got this my favorite thing do drink cold liquids from was a tin cup but now it's definitely this mug. It keeps my drink icy cold and makes me feel a bit like a Viking when I use it! :)  I was given a free sample for review and I love it!

One of my favorite things about this lip balm is that I can look at the list of ingredients and recognize them all.  It contains all organic ingredients and to me that's very important. I like to know what I'm putting on my body, especially on my lips and face. The balm itself is smooth and went on well. It was firm enough to have some substance but not so thick that my lips felt waxy. I think the consistency is spot on. The peppermint was a bit strong for me at first and if you have a low tolerance for mint oils, you might find it almost a bit too much, but it evened out pretty quickly and simply felt refreshing. If you're a fan of peppermint, you will love this balm. I received a free sample tube in exchange for an honest review and I'm looking forward to seeing more from this company.

These are delicious!I am completely impressed with every bar in this variety pack. I was offered samples for review and am thrilled to have experienced these bars. I have a child who has many allergies and he was able to eat every one of these bars. It was interesting to give a child a bar marked energy and to be able to see that they actually are energy bars!  The taste, consistency, and overall quality of these products is exceptional. The price point is also affordable and makes these a no brainer for my family to have as on the go healthy snacks. It's important to note these are dairy free and vegan products.

This may be marketed as a young adult (YA) book but it is widely appealing. I think it shouldn't be stuck in that genre even though it does appeal to young adults. Any lover of fantasy, alternate realities, or other world fascinations will love this book. It starts a little slow and focuses some on character development which I appreciate in the start of a series. It quickly picks up though and I found myself reading it through in two sittings.Pat is a sweet little girl and I immediately identified with her and her world of annoyances and put upons. She finds a link between two worlds during her annoyance and uses that to escape and to entertain us!  There is a lot of room for D.J. Clarke to expand this world and heroes, to show us how the break happened, and to teach us more about the characters. I am very excited about the books to come.If you love fantasy fiction you are going to love this book. If your heart belongs to children and to cats, you are in for a real treat like I was!  This is a very fun and interesting trip around the imagination of this author. I highly recommend you give it a try.

This is a powerful little charging port! It is marketed for travel but I'm using it in my home for the million different devices that need a daily charge. I am able to charge my iPad, iPhone, Kindle, and phone case all at once. Normally products like this have an issue charging iPads because they use more power but this is truly 36W. I can charge all of these items overnight or for quick charges I just plug in one or two at a time. For example, my iPad goes from zero to fully charged in about 2 hours. If I catch it before it's in the red then it takes just over an hour to charge fully.I have been using this for about a week and do not notice any heat, there is no blackening of the wall plug that it is in, and no shortened battery life from my products. This does the job and does it well.

This is an incredibly strong first novel for author E. Squires!  I was delighted to find it to be such a well developed Dystopian novel with exceptional world building and character development. Heidi as the main character is brilliant, she is complex, brave, smart, and determined in her endeavors. It amused me to see that 17 year old girls in the future behave just like 17 year old girls now. They want to get away, forge their own path, and make their lives better.Newland is our dystopia in this story and it is comprised of a caste system or hierarchy- Masters, Advisers, and Laborers-  Taking this journey with Heidi was exciting, she is a determined and very strong female lead- who is thought to be a boy for much of the adventure!  I really loved the gender play in the book and how characteristics that we are so accustomed to assigning to one gender or another were handled. Something Squires did so well as break those barriers and show us that we are all just people.Excellent first book!  My only issue with the book is the editing, which could use a fair amount of work but didn't take away from the story enough to make me rate it lower than a 5.

This is an outstanding book. It is a third in a series and this is the only of the three that I have had an opportunity to read. It stands on it's own and it's not at all necessary to read them in order, but I certainly will read the others now. Richard Taylor is a talented writer who is able to show us a heart warming story of love with a backdrop that is something many of us are unfamiliar with. I know little to nothing about war but being able to see the experience through the eyes of Izzy was very special. This is a romance, but one that has a very solid foundation and an interesting setting.I related a lot to Izzy and this is decades removed from the times of her experiences. The fact that this author can convey emotions in a timeless fashion is a unique talent. The characters Izzy and Abe find unlikely love and even more they find a love that they must fight for. The worth in their connection is tested in their journey and is enough to give everyone some hope as they read the book.

This book is incredibly refreshing. Catalina Sanchez (Vega) does a grand job bringing us a children's book that actually builds up the self esteem of young girls in a way that is not interdependent upon a prince or some other type of male figure.The premise of the story is heart warming and the very compelling to young readers. If they can read themselves they will love it, but it is an excellent book to read to a child. I love the seed swallowing premise as much as I loved Jack and the Beanstalk as a child. This is a modern day story that will relate to all young girls and the people who love them.

Dameon Cox has brought us a very complex and moving story in Book 2 of the Zenith Series. I love so much that he includes maps with a lot of detail at the start of the book because the many scenarios and realms in this type of series are many.This is a book firmly in the fantasy genre and is epic, it reminds me of a very complex RPG Table story. I think Cox does a great job with his character development and his story line. There are no missing pieces of loose ends. What is great as well is that you can pick up book 2 before you've had the opportunity to read book 1 and not be lost at all. The maps are a great help!If you are a fantasy fan I highly recommend this book. It is clear that Mr. Cox has an incredible imagination and a gift for writing that allows him to share it with us all.

This book was certainly a shocker!  I have no idea why the title didn't warn me but I was drawn in by the cover art, which as I write this and look at it should have been a clue!  Nonetheless, I'm thrilled to have read this collection of short stories that are steamy steamy!  Never could I have imagined a collection of stories that center around horticulture but focus on the erotic. It is a brilliant concept and I loved it.I love how the lovers in the book have a big range, it's different characters cast in these roles so we get to explore an entire range of erotic pleasure and experiences. This is twelve stories that are really well done and can be very quickly read. I read a couple a day very much enjoyed them all.This book is really well written and well edited, even if you think this is not something you'd enjoy, I'd challenge you to read it and NOT enjoy it.

I loved this book!.  Mott does a great job exploring some hard topics. As I read I felt especially encouraged by the portrayal of Bianca. She was raised as a privileged girl who was given a lot in life. What she was given, however, that can't be seen in the comforts of her life was the ethic to be a hard worker and a goal oriented person.Bianca and her dreamy husband Tevin experience what is a nightmare by not being able to conceive. Bianca and Tevin soon learn that hard work and privileged can not guarantee them everything in life. The bounds of their marriage, their sanity, and their faith are tested in this great book.This is just an excellent and fast book that will entertain and keep you engrossed from start to finish.

This is one of those rare books where the characters actually carry the story and what happens in their environment or the world they live in almost becomes anecdotal. This is a love story through and through and shows us that love, when it is real, is timeless.Mikayla is a complex and interesting character, she explores love and her options in a way that is very much things we can see in ourselves., Christy has done such a great job developing her character. Love interest, Mitch- is my favorite because he struggles with memory, yet operates following her instinct and his heart. It is truly a great romance and I loved reading about them.Try this book, I know that you'll enjoy it as much as I did. Especially if you love a great love story and really love Sci-Fi or Apocalyptic stories.

This is an excellent water bottle for children. My six month old is starting to transition to drinking water with meals and he picked right up on the straw sucking. I figured I'd skip the sippy cup if possible and this water bottle helps. I'm able to close it when not in use so that it doesn't leak at all and can open it for him when I want him to drink. The straw is soft and pulls the water up great. Cleaning the bottle is simple as well. All the parts are easy to remove, clean, replace.

Put five people in a stagecoach and see what happens!  This book contains laughter, romance, intrigue, lust, and suspense. I absolutely loved it and the fact that it has a western setting. I think that Marilyn Brown did a great job developing her characters.This book has all the things you love about the old west, including Doc Holiday and Wyatt Earp. Who happen to be my favorite characters of all time. I was delighted when they arrived.  In the midst of our old favorites we haveI really fell in love with Libby and her bravery. She is a young girl willingly headed into dangerous territory. I even adore her unlikely pairing with Cotter, the preacher in Tombstone. Libby really comes into herself and I found her as a character to be robust.This is a really good book and even better if you love an historical romance or thriller.

Imagine coming home and finding your husband dead, how shocking and horrible that would be. Now imagine that the next thing that happens is the police tell you that everything you thought you knew was a lie.  That is what Anne Brooke is delivering to us and it's exceptionally well done.Elise Walker is left to spend her time trying to fragment her life backwards in an attempt to pick up the pieces from the death and the shocking truth. The way that Brooke develops the character of Elise was so well done that I could see Elise in so many of the women that I know.I absolutely loved this book because it was engrossing, fast, and very realistic for a piece of fiction. It is the kind of book that you can put down and think to yourself .. "Ok, who do I know that is leading a double life".

I have let this collection of poetry settle with me for a few days before writing this review because it is extremely an emotional collection.As a new mother I thought that I would be happy happy happy and everything would be simple like everyone else makes it seem. I quickly discovered that nothing is simple and nothing is easy and most especially nothing looks like it looks for my friends!  There is so much no one talks about or admit regarding motherhood, that it seems almost a crime what Vought has done by writing it all down. What I do know is that it's not a crime- it's a truth that if more people knew, would help.Vought bravely pulls us into a world where she understands the reality of motherhood and she is able to show us with her excellent poetry the love, the struggle, the heartbreak, the worry, and the fun. It was brave of her to write this and even braver to share her poetry with the world.  I'm glad she did.If you're a mom or love one, you need to read this. I'm glad I did, I feel less alone in this journey.

This is a an excellent book. S.R. Mallery is an obvious talent who can write in a way that transports a reader into another time. I loved the cover of this book because it just looked like it hid some stories and secrets that I wanted to know about.I am an history lover and this book is written in such a unique way that we see stories and times told with great charm. They all carry a thread that creates a quilt in the end. These stories made my heart happy, make me want to learn more about certain times, and helped me appreciate some people in my life even more than I did before.I highly recommend this book for anyone who uses literature and prose to ignite themselves. I learned a lot from this book and took away stories of redemption, love, victory, and an appreciate for all that came before me.

This book starts with a very fun cover and just takes off from there!  E.J. Ehlers has brought us a very fun vampire tale. The characters are so memorable and likable that I just want to read more about them.  If you take anything at all from this cover let it be the erotic part because WOW .. It sure is a steamy little book. The sex scenes are never gratuitous, however, they are well placed and mesh nicely with the story line. In a lot of books you see that they are making a story just to mask the erotica, but this book is different, there is a real and excellent story attached.I was so excited by the entrance of Count Dracula and I actually yipped a little while reading. He is the perfect lover for Emily Malone and just icing on this already wonderful book for me.

What a fun book!  We don't see much humor in paranormal fiction but Haase does a great job showing us that even the paranormal world is not so serious all of the time.This is a young adult read so don't be worried about 14+ reading and don't hesitate to read yourself as an adult, I was fully engrossed and enjoyed the story very much. This book doesn't disappoint or pander to the younger age group. Often when we read young adult novels they seem almost condescending or like they are trying too hard. Haase doesn't do any of that, he just writes in a straightforward way which is very appealing.Now if you'd like to read about Ryan, his curse, and his path in his world as a savior then read this book and enjoy this world! I think that this novel and characters could easily be transformed into a role-play adventure for a gaming table. It's very well done.

Boy Boy love at it's absolute finest. This story is delivered with such care and affection that you can't help but absolutely love it. I found myself so invested in the lives of Jamar and Trenton.The prodigal sons of two influential men who just happen to be mortal enemies. Trenton is a bit of a ruffian and an unlikely match for Jamar- but the heart wants what the heart wants. I expected at the start that Jamar and Trenton would have a few hot romps and move on, but it was brilliant watching the love story emerge.There are many parallels to Shakespearean love stories and I like to see the symbolism from great literature roll over into modern stories about love and lust. Mahabeer works hard in this story to bring these characters to life through brilliant character development. The way the relationships are explored is very well done.This is an 18 + novel and well worth the wait if you're 17 (Just get it anyway) .. I highly recommend

As a 22 year old who spent the majority of my life with music pounding into my skull I have a slightly perceptible hearing loss. I know that sounds insane and I'm too young, but it's real and I'm certain it's from years spent with unregulated headphones.I've been reluctant to allow my son to use headphones or even listen to music loudly because his ears are so precious and studio grade protection for children is insanely expensive. MEElectronics offers an excellent middle ground with these lightweight headphones. I was struck immediately by their excellent construction and fun color. The have an excellent adjustment range that will honestly fit a child from 18 months to age 7 or so. They also deliver excellent sound quality which is important to me. I want to protect my son, but I also want him to experience how music feels running through his body.All aspects of these headphones are exceptional, even the quality of the jack output, I have no hesitation using these with a small child as there do not appear to me to be any choking hazards or anything that will harm him. As with all things like this,  you would of course be supervising your child anyway.

Oh boy ...  well this is steamy and full of beautiful men. Our main character Luke finds himself graduated with honors for high achievement. He is thrilled to be invited to join a secret fraternity .. the unknown, the secrets, the intrigue draws him in and his passion for long time crush Malik plants him in place. What the book is fully of steamy passion, but is actually so much more. As you read (and blush and look over your shoulder to make sure no one sees you) you will realize that the sub text of this book is about more than love- it is about acceptance and brotherhood. A man embarking on his life post education and finding a place where he can so beautifully be himself and explore passion, love, and the types of human bonds that last a lifetime.This book is certainly 18+ and shouldn't be pigeonholed into a masculine gay genre. As a hetero female I found it extremely engaging and thrilling.

I was hooked right from the beginning of this book!  It is classified as a young adult novel and I fit in that category! I would, however, recommend it to my mum or my sixteen year old sister and fully expect them to love it like I did.In some ways this book is a cautionary tale told in this world of social media, instant gratification, and file sharing that goes viral. However, the book is much more than that. It is a foray into relationships, love, family loyalty, and the bonds that make us who we are.Our main characters Bea and Luke are extremely likable and remind us what love is like when first experienced. Bea is someone I especially loved because her life has been a challenge faced with loss and grief. Teson handled her story so well and was able to show us the full facet of this character with ease.The title of the book is not in any way misleading and maybe more of a caution!  Prepare to be twisted and turned as you go from page to page of this fast paced mystery/thriller/romance book. I'm always fascinated by crime stories and most wanted scenarios so this book was a pleasure to read.I highly recommend this book and hope that the author is hard at work.

This is a fast paced and very well written book!  Jonathan Dunne is talented in his ability to create a story with twists and turns that will make your heart beat faster and your brain arrive just at the moment truths are revealed.I have never been to Dublin and have always had a fantasy type wonder about the country of Ireland. It was an absolute treat to see the city through the words of Dunne, he writes in a way that makes the city real and both takes away some mystery yet adds even more. In the end the book just added fuel to my needing to see Ireland fire.The book follows Nathan, who has inadvertently stolen something from a member of Dublin's most powerful crime family. This leads us to meet the cop O'Brien who wishes to take down the Doherty crime family. It is an excellent and fast paced crime thriller. It's completely satisfying and will make you not want to put it down.

Sometimes you come across a book that is so good you feel a sense of relief to find out that it's a trilogy!  I read this book vaguely aware that it was and then about 10 pages in had to make sure that it was!  Howell is a gifted author and creates this supernatural world in such a fun way that several times I wondered about what a great table master this author would make!The Willows is this very special and magical place where witches, vampires, and werewolves all live together in peace with truces and agreements in place. As is the way of the world there begins some problems when the humans begin to have love affairs with the witches and then the others. An all out war ensues and we are brought along for the ride!This is very well thought out and a delightful romp in the creative mind of Howell. A superb treat for the supernatural geeks in us all.

Well .. Justin and Leila have one steamy love affair!When Justin is set free from being held captive for years, Leila escapes the Harem and hides in his cabin. The two must rely on each other for survival and soon the sparks erupt.The book is erotica of the finest form, but it's also a story with a very well developed plot, and excellent character development. Daria Charon has done an excellent job of bringing Justin and Leila's experiences to us as each of them have needs and seemingly the other can help them achieve those needs.This is an excellent book, fun, fast, and contains some surprises. It is for adults and I'm looking forward to more!

I love the premise of this book which is that the past never remains the past. It is woven in the threads of who we are the decisions that we all make. Kabongo does a superb job bringing this truth to us in her novel. It is very well written, well edited, and with compelling cover art.The book is a mystery and the type of mystery that just keeps you reading. Not so much just reading to figure out the ending or what the twists and turns will reveal, but the type of mystery that draws you into it and brings you along for the ride. This family, the Coopers, are deliciously dysfunctional. They tell lies, they backstab, and they are not above any type of malice that will keep secrets buried.I especially love Shelby who is strong, brave, and full of enough knowledge about herself to understand her limits and her inability to trust others will hold her back. Her story is gut wrenching and honest in a way that it needs to be in order for this entire book to work. And work it sure does. Superb.

*Fanning myself*  This book is .. WHEW!  You should read this alone or with a very close loved, or desired one.This is a book first about the bounds of family. Alex has a deep desire to honor his mother and finds in that dying wish a way to honor himself and his desires. Alex falls for a male classmate and what happens is pages and pages of amazing erotic fiction.This book is more than just delicious erotica, it is also a bit of a supernatural ride as Alex becomes.. immortal!  I was engaged from start to finish and hope to see more from this very imaginative author.

As a new mother I was drawn to this book. I was both horrified and absorbed by the story and the circumstances that make it so good. The book centers around six women who have all experienced the unthinkable- the loss of a child. We read stories like this and hold our own kids a bit tighter. Hayton does an excellent job of writing with compassion and with an excellent range of emotion. These situations are all our own worst nightmare and I feel like I've learned a lot from this work of fiction.The story also tells us a lot about the power of women and this group of women show us how to love and support one another through tragedy and the every day struggles of life even. They band together and with the help of a psychic end up finding a whole new puzzle. The book is excellent, and I very much enjoy the writing style of Katherine Hayton- she has clearly spent a lot of time with her characters and cares very much for the authenticity of their experiences.

Forever one to judge a book first by its cover, I was immediately drawn to the steely gaze of Amun as he appears to us with the stark, black background and the vivid yet cold blue eyes. I was delighted to find that author J.S. Lewis is incredibly talented and able to share a story with his readers that will invest them emotionally and intellectually.Taking a page from ancient mythology is the premise of this book and the protagonist, Amun, in order to realize his full potential as a man must not only face and overcome the trials of every day man but he is also tasked with the fact that he must become immortal. We follow along with Amun as he embarks on an exciting journey towards manhood, leaving behind those he love in search of great power that will protect them in dark times to come. His character captivates us as he grows and matures before our very eyes and his pain and struggles we are able to identify with as they suddenly become our own. Towards the books breathtaking climax we find Amun at a crossroad of his destiny as he must save his people from peril and in order to do this he must not only face the opposition but the battle that rages inside himself. Amun must come to terms with his sexuality in a climate where his desires if acted upon are punishable by death.I was also deeply moved by the side stories of characters such as Annie Palmer, William Courtney and Danny Steele, each with a groundbreaking challenge of their own that everyone is able to relate to in one way or another. The writer has something for every human being in this multi-layered story of friendship, loss, love, romance and heartbreak.This book is moving and has a lot to say. The themes within the book are timeless and that is what makes books like these so important. It is set in the early Eighteenth Century and some of the struggles- genocide, slavery, sexual oppression, and discrimination are just as prevalent today as they were back then. The more we read, write, and talk about these topics the better life on this earth will be for all beings. I highly recommend this book for mature, open-minded audiences.

This book completely cracked me up. I love to read short stories because I can put them down and pick them up while reading other books but Bolaride Jackson has done so well with this book that I read it straight through.Following his years as a young attorney in North Carolina, Bolo, entertains and never fails to show us that every life contains hilarity and that in the end we are all just working at something.Jackson has an interesting life and handles challenges in the best of light.It was really enlightening to read about a time when law wasn't all that we see on television as the sensational world of wheeling and dealing. It was interesting, too, to learn about how much of Bolo's early career was about navigating the people and institutions that have long been a foundation in North Carolina.

Karen Andor is a talented, insightful, and honest writer. The book deals with some extremely difficult situations and scenarios and could be considered a trigger for some people who have suffered trauma. It can also serve as a different perspective or outcome that may help the healing process a bit.The book follows a young boy and his brutal life at the hands of a violent alcoholic father and a mother who is not in any way equipped to be his advocate. What is fascinating is that the book expertly travels the realms of the boy's mind as he slips into his own brain to find the solace and comfort that he is unable to find in life. He has learned in life that relationships are painful because every relationship he has is bad. He goes out of his comfort zone and falls in love with an animal and that even ends in tragedy.This is a great glimpse into the incredible power of the human brain to protect us from realities that we can't possibly comprehend or deal with. The child has the beginning signs of what could end up being a severe identity disorder.I am very impressed with the way that Andor develops this story and with the respect she gives the main character. It is rare to see such difficult subject matter handled with as much grace.

This book deals with some pretty horrific subject matter that I had been previously unaware of. This story is, as the cover suggests, about a man and his dog. Greg Smith does a great job making the dog, Shadow, a main character. The development and the way Smith navigates us to love this animal is truly masterful storytelling.Captain Cramer is Shadow's companion and as a Marine he is a compelling character of strength, fortitude, and a willingness to do what is right. I very much enjoyed his part in this book. He is an outstanding main character and an hero who has the understanding of right and wrong to his core.This book is at times difficult to read because of the tough subject matter but I encourage you to read on and get past the parts that make your heart hurt because the story is really a special one.

"The trouble with women, ' said Moira, 'is that they don't stick together. If women stuck together like men do they could rule the world.".This is an important quote from the book and shows us a bit of where this book goes as its main theme is of three sisters and their escapades surrounding a hilltop observatory.I find S.A. Jefferies writing style to be fluid and descriptive. Careful attention and time was taken to develop their characters, especially Jenny, and I was able to navigate around their surroundings as if I have been there myself.I think that the themes in this book are important and well examined in a fictional and exciting setting. Enough so that I was left wondering about the themes of female strength and the bonds that we share and how important it is for us all to work together. In a society where media pits women against each other and celebrates critical behaviors it is important to remember that strength comes in numbers.This is an excellent read that goes very fast. Well done!

What a delight this book is!  I love an excellent historical romance and this certainly meets the mark with abundance. Hannelore Moore has a fluid writing style that feels like it is effortless and flows right into the pages.I absolutely loved being brought into Evangeline's world especially because it's 18th century England!  Books like this never stop thrilling me because they are glimpses into worlds that I can only imagine, and when someone else imagines them better than me and has the talent to write it down I am grateful.Evangeline has earned the moniker "The Ice Goddess" not because she is ice cold but because she is shy and doesn't engage the way other greedy or power hungry women of her time did. Her aloof countenance falters when she meets Kendall and struggles with the love she feels for him and the way she feels for herself.I really enjoyed this book and it was an excellent way to spend an afternoon.

I am fascinated by this book and completely impressed with author Ariane Page. As a student I have recently taken several classes in the Psychology and Sociology areas and have learned about different theories of the brain, motivation, and social norms. Ariane Page has brought us her very well conceived and written ideas about love and motivation.Learning how we process love is always fascinating, because we all love, we lose, we learn, and we try again. The theory in this book is LIFE, which an acronym for Law Inherent to the Five Elements. This is my first exposure to the LIFE theory and if it was explained and examined differently I probably would have disregarded it, but Page brings it to life in a practical and understandable way that makes me hungry for more information and a deeper understanding.I'm anxious for more!

This is a tremendous story that made me laugh and cry. Mostly it made me realize that so much of our value today is in the moments and the lives of those who came before us. The way that Billy Battles' great-grandson takes the love, attention, and care necessary to make stories from the journals is tremendous to me.Selfishly I took special delight in this book because Wyatt Earp and Doc Holliday are featured and I named my son for Wyatt Earp- any time I can see these two written about and come to life satisfies the geek and historian in me. I love books that surround the old west and Ronald Yates does a phenomenal job with this book. His descriptive writing technique brings life to situations and realities that we have read about in flat history books.This book is an absolute pleasure and I loved getting to read about this family through the fictional recounting of actual events.

Absolutely love this Bolse cord. It is Apple certified so you won't get an error messages that will invalidate your Apple Care and the product works fast. I absolutely love that it's high output which means fast charging and that it is multi ported. I can charge my iPhone and my battery pack from the same device. No more extra cords or hassles. This is also a no tangle cord with generous reach so that charging is easier. I was lucky enough to be selected to review this product fairly and without bias in exchange for a free product. My opinions are my own and in no way influenced by the manufacturer.

I am so impressed with this product. I had been looking for an LED night light for my baby's room and wasn't able to find one that could be muted enough for night time. This is first of all an excellently constructed product- I will note that this is a glass product and should be kept far from reach of small children.The ball doesn't ever get hot and the remote lets you play with the colors until you find the one that is right for you child's room. I change it often because .. why not? It's fun. Each color is pretty and puts off a soothing vibe. I've had this light on pretty continuously for the last few weeks with no bulb, heat, or malfunction.I was offered a product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. My opinions are my own and in no way influenced by the manufacturer.

This is a self correcting type puzzle that allows small children the opportunity to attempt and correct their matching skills. The pictures are chunky and easy for manual manipulation. The pictures bright, double sided, and interesting to toddlers.If you're trying to work on problem solving skills with your 3+ year old this is a game for you. It also teaches professions and lets you explore your community a little bit with your toddler.Excellent quality.

Perfect for my 5 month old!He is in the stage of shoving everything in his mouth as fast as possible to ease teething discomfort so these keys work best. They are completely green in recycled packaging that is frustration free. Completely made in the USA.I have had no problem with sterilization or use. They wash up nice and the baby is obsessed with them. Always a win.

This memoir is simply wonderful. It is moving beyond compare and had me laughing at some parts, and crying at others.  As a person who loves her friends deeply, I found the friendships in this memoir to be poignant and very much similar to my own friendships.Nancy is a fascinating woman who lives by the idea that each person must have some basic principals in their life to be fulfilled and happy. They are someone to love, something to look forward to, and work that makes them happy. I really love these ideas and can see how living this way would be a path to happiness.Lynda is Nancy's best friend, and some could argue, soul-mate. Their pairing for friendship is unlikely and part of what is so special. They see in each other needs and wants that mirror their own and the result is fully accepting love and support.This memoir is special and tackles some very difficult subject matter. The timing for me was perfect as I was completely transfixed with the story of Brittany Maynard and her choice to die with dignity. This memoir even shed more light on the emotions behind that story for me.

I am a sucker for all things animal and this book is no exception!  I was absolutely delighted page after page as I got to share what Mr. Flemming sees in his camera. I find his approach brilliant and his vision progressive. He is asking us to look at these photos of the animal world the same way we would look across a subway car and study another human. He is not asking us to assign human traits to the animals, he is simply showing us that there is an energy in all living things that we may not always understand. As much as we do not know what humans are thinking when they stare off, neither do we know what any animal is thinking.The pictures are vivid and brilliant. They will set you thinking and probably looking up more pictures!  The book is excellent!*This book is best viewed on an e-reader with color capabilities. I originally had it on my Paperwhite then moved it over to the Kindle app on my iPad and the experience was preferable.

I wish I was on a beach while I read this book!  It is the classic summertime relaxation book. For winter readers a fire and some hot chocolate will do!This is a classic type of romance and caper book. Leslie Huggans has a very easy writing style. There is nothing weighing this story down and at the end it's a quirky Caribbean vacation gone wrong. Victoria and Julie are embarking on a much needed vacation. Things go quickly wrong upon arriving and meeting local bad boy Jamil!This is a great thriller that ends begging for a sequel so that the adventures of the sometimes crazy Victoria can continue. There is a lot going on in this book but it never feels disjointed or incomplete. Huggans has done a great job with this one!

This is a lovely collection and recollection that makes a terrific legacy for this family. I imagine that quotes will be taken from this collection and used for toasts at Victoria and Olivia's weddings. Parents so often are consumed with guilt over the baby book that is half filled out, or the forgetting of facts about our children that we thought we'd never forget like the date of a first tooth. Sandy Appleyard shows us that sometimes the best and easiest way to remember a life is through the child's own voice. She shows us all up in this book by collecting these precious moments in time!The Appleyard children are clearly articulate, curious, insightful, and silly little creatures. I enjoyed spending the morning with them through their snippets in time.

Oh boy .. who doesn't love a children's book with a great message and beautiful illustrations?  I read this book with my little sisters and they absolutely loved it. They are both under age 8 and I think that the words were easy to understand and the pictures enough to captivate them. The message of kindness in the book also resonated with the older one who tends to be a bit of a bully with my baby sister. There is nothing better than a book that speaks to children in a voice that isn't a lecture and allows them to draw conclusions themselves about their own behavior.This book is a win and I'm sure will continue to be a family favorite. Margaret Curley is certainly a talented voice to little ones.

I adore this book.  This is a real family unafraid and without excuse being themselves.  What struck me is that all of these stories are real. You can tell that they are not written 'up' for comedic value and they are not put on stage hoping for a larger audience. They are exactly as the title promises: True Stories from an Everyday Family.When I first bought the book I was half expecting stories told in the Sedaris voice because that's what I'm accustomed to when I'm reading about families. I was happily shocked to discover this is not at all like that. This family is living the way most normal families live- with the freedom to squirt the kids with a water bottle to get them moving in the morning- with the kids threatening to call CPS.The banter reveals what is genuine and obvious love for the kids and in chapter two or three there are even letters written to the older children to guide them in life that are candid and poignant.This book was an absolute pleasure, I'm grateful to have read it.

I'm forever a sucker for reading books based on their cover!  This woman is gorgeous and her eyes just draw you right into her mind. I love how CLV is written on her forehead because I had to know why and I love that her face is so close up so that I felt like what I was about to embark on was a journey into her mind.Never one for rules, I started this series with book 3 and decided to give it 40 pages before deciding if I needed to stop and read the other two first and I knew at about page 15 that this book is strong enough to stand on it's own. That's a real compliment as so many series rely on past success and get lazy.Cassie is a completely compelling character who made me envy her psychic and paranormal abilities. She is someone that probably all women can relate to and who most men would spend a lifetime trying to figure out.Read along, you won't be sorry.  Will she catch the "Artist"? ..

I love the feel of the water spray from this shower head.  It covers a lot of area and puts out a lot of water. One thing you should note is that you just get the head. If you want the head to actually be over you, raining down, you'll need to make a trip to the hardware store, but if you want it spraying out on an angle, this will work fine.  It seems very well made and was easy to install. I received the shower head for free in exchange for an honest review.
Excellent. I use extra strength rubber bands to keep them closed.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

I read through this book as soon as it arrived; as a codger DIYer, it immediately appealed to me as soon as it appeared on my Vine list.As a caregiver and as a long term spouse coming to grips with becoming a widower, I found that I was already doing many of these things, not necessarily systematically but in my own fashion.There are now 24 days left to review the book and I am going to follow the three week plan pretending that I have never practiced any of the techniques here. Around December 15, 2015 I will update this Review with what if anything I learned.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

A few days after my wife died, both of my knees started to ache with varying amounts of pain, from 4 to 8 or 9 on my personal 1 to 10 pain scale. Nothing seemed to help, and my GP suggested seeing a doctor at the NYU Hospital for Special Surgery in Manhattan.We chose Dr. Halpern, author of The Knee Crisis Handbook: Understanding Pain, Preventing Trauma, Recovering from Knee Injury, and Building Healthy Knees for Life, and a very experienced knee expert (among other things, he was team doctor for the Jets for a number of years). Dr. Halpern diagnosed advanced arthritis, and he suggested I try Glucosamine. He said that my case was fairly well advanced -- he couldn't explain why the pain was presenting so late in the disease's progression -- and that some patients had good results from Glucosamine. In any event, side effects were minimal and alternatives were much more "heroic". (And, also, perhaps unavailing as I learned while representing a major company that made artificial hips and knees.)I did a bit of research and learned that reports of effectiveness range from 10% to 70%, depending on the population being surveyed; "Consumer Union" has historically been on the low end of that range, although more recently "CU's medical and nutritional consultants have identified and tested a few products ... with possible benefits and sufficiently low risks to recommend for general use, including: saw palmetto for benign enlarged prostate in men, glucosamine and chondroitin for arthritis, and fish-oil capsules (omega-3 fatty acids) for heart disease."Glucosamine is often sold in combination with other supplements such as chondroitin sulfate and methylsulfonylmethane. Of the three commonly available forms of glucosamine, only glucosamine sulfate is given a "likely effective" rating for treating osteoarthritis.In my case, I started taking three of these tablets a day, and the pain subsided only three days later. Today, ten months later, it is rarely more than a 1 or 2 on my pain scale, and when it kicks up I take one to three more tablets. They actually taste good, and work very well.My brother-in-law has had a similar problem for the past five years, and his pain is also controlled by this product. Based on the reports of others, it may not help everyone, but it sure helped both of us.I've tried a number of different brands, all of which provided the same relief. The bottle, sent to me free for review purposes, has worked great for me for over a week and a half. Moreover, I have had very positive experiences with several of Viva's products and have also relied on their literature and enjoyed interesting discussion with their customer service people.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

This burner writer works very well on start up from my Lenovo ThinkPad. (I misread the labeling at first and thought it would only work with Apple computers, but it started and worked well.)Robert C. RossNovember 2015Free review sample received from Amazon seller.

This was a totally new device to me when it was offered for purposes of my review by the Amazon Seller. I am very glad that they did.The device connects to your TV or monitor through HDMI, VGA or composite(AV), A technically savvy young lady at the New York-New Jersey Trail Conference connected the device to our systems, and it worked very well: colors very pure and excellent definition.Package includes:1 X HD Media Player1 X Remote control1 X Power adapter(AC 100-240V~50/60Hz)1 X AV cable1 X User manual1 X screwdriver2 X screwsI supervised her work, of course, as codgers will and did not have to intervene at any point -- didn't even have to bite my tongue. :)Well done.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

Wow!I haven't had a new belt for over ten years and it was an adventure to choose this one.Wonderful smell of leather, beautifully stitched, perfect action on the buckle -- Timberland continues to be a very high quality supplier.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

This  is a solidly made charger, 3.15 x 2.36 x 1.18 in. / 80 x60x30 mm, in  a heavy duty package -- weighs about 5 ounces I would guess.Charges well from my Lenovo Think Pad; would have liked an AC capability for charging as an option but works very well with direct current.A very nice feature; the flashing light shows how full the tank is; it came at 87% and is charging at about 1% in two minutes at the moment.Robert C. RossNovember 2015This review sample was provided free by the Amazon Seller.

As a 24/7 caregiver for a number of years for my late wife, we tried three or four different alternating pressure mattresses.During the last three months of her life, we needed a much larger and feature filled pressure mattress, primarily because she got great joy from manipulating the controls of the bed.However, this mattress would have been perfect adequate as a starter mattress when she was more mobile and needed protection from bed sores, one of the greatest banes of the bed-ridden and the caregiver.I tested this mattress for several nights and am very pleased to give it high marks, both from price and utility perspectives.Robert C. RossNovember 2015Free review sample provided by Amazon seller.

Excellent single pass sharpener, very small, very secure when attached to my wooden butcher block counter, three or four swipes and even cheap knives -- and why pray tell would own and use such a knife -- and it has an excellent edge.To a certain extent I a little embarrassed to so enthusiastic about this little workhorse. I took a five day Boot Camp at the Culinary Institute of America in New Hyde Park, and learned a great deal about knives and knife care. Check out The Professional Chef's Knife Kit from the CIA -- it covers the waterfront of how to care for and use knives in a very comprehensive and professional way.But when a little dab will do you, this sharpener can't be beat.Robert C. RossNovember 2015Free review sample received from the Amazon Seller.

This the second Luseta combination I've tried. It leaves my coarse hair very soft, has a pleasant aroma which wears off in time for breakfast.Really I can't decide which I prefer.Robert C. RossNovember 2015Review sample received from the Amazon Seller

I have coarse, very curly hair. This combination makes it amazingly soft -- I don't recognize it when I run my fingers over my head -- even six to eight hours later. "Smooth" indeed.Please, understated aroma that wears off in about an hour so it doesn't interfere with the taste of my breakfast.Robert C. RossNovember 2015Review sample received from the Amazon Seller.
Gorgeous.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

I rarely weigh ingredients when cooking, but weighing is essential for baking. I took a course at the Culinary Institute of America, their Boot Camp -- gosh they like military nomenclature at the CIA -- and the cooks and bakers were in total agreement:"TIP #2: BREAK OUT THE SCALE Many home bakers rely on measuring cups to portion out their recipe ingredients by volume. It’s probably what you were taught to do, and it may seem to work well enough. Professional bakers, however, are always looking for consistent results and they search for ways to control the end product. Knowing that the amount of flour in a measuring cup can and does vary (due to humidity, settling, how and when the flour was milled, the type of cup being used, and the way the cup was filled), professional bakers remove those variables by weighing their ingredients. Scales simply provide a more accurate measurement. If you don’t have a scale or aren’t ready to give up your measuring cups, that’s not a problem—we provide volume measurements in our recipes. -- See more at: enthusiasts.ciachef.edu/making-artisan-bread-at-home/In my experience, weighing ingredients when does make it easier to measure. With volume measure, you need to pull out multiple cups and spoons and wash each one of them at the end. With mass measure, you need only a single bowl and a scale that you tare after each ingredient is added. Weighing is also more precise. Depending on how it's packed, a cup of flour can weigh anywhere from around four ounces (113 grams) to six ounces (170 grams), a difference of 50%!  Weighing your flour and other dry ingredients eliminates this variation.But precision in other cooking doesn't mean much: If a recipe calls for a pound of onions, for example, you would probably have to cut one of the onions to get to the precise amount. I would throw them all in. The onions themselves, the browning time, other factors would lead to excellent results.And, with tiny amounts of spices, a gram for example, takes no account of variations in the spices; using measuring cups and then adjusting to taste makes much more sense to me in practice.So when baking, this scale is a very good choice, one like it essential in my experience. It is a very handsome scale; I like the low profile particularly; somehow it makes it easier to keep my counters clean and free of unnecessary utensils. Its measurements were almost identical to the other two scales in my arsenal -- over-stocked I know.Robert C. RossNovember 2015Free review sample provided by the Amazon Seller.

My doctor recommended the NeilMed Sinus Rinse - 2 Bottles - 250 Premixed Packets and NasaMist Saline Spray, Kit system four years ago: "It will take out all the crud left behind from breathing our challenging New York City air."Used virtually every day morning and evening -- it's become a way of life.They say codgers should change habits from time to time and I tried, really, really tried, but after two weeks gave up. Several problems:-- very soft plastic -- I needed to use two hands to make it work -- NeilMed one is enough.-- very little water flow -- no matter how hard I pressed, I couldn't the liquid into my mouth through the sinuses.-- hard to fill even with a little funnel my companion gave me as a present.They also say it takes 50 repetitions to learn a new skill -- but not in this bit of daily health care for this codger.Good luck if you try these and if you haven't used this sort of self treatment, try the NeilMed system. Next to learning the Stork for improved balance, this was the best medical advice I ever received.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

Astonishingly easy. I did a finished room in the attic with high hats -- an hour each -- compared to 20 minutes with these and at least 92.4% less cussing and 25 times more smiles.These are really easy to install but be sure you will get enough light -- its light is softer and more diffuse than high hats.Nearing the end of my DIYer career and this comes on the market. :(Robert C. RossNovember 2015Review based on a review sample provided by the Amazon vendor; bought three more after this one for use in a small area in the basement.

This is an outstanding grinder set, especially well packaged and will make a perfect holiday gift for a young couple just starting out life together. Solidly made, with excellent visibility for the contents. Very easy to open and re-fill. Also, very easy to adjust the grind with either device, from a very fine to a very coarse grind.  And ceramic and true stainless steel promise outstanding durability for mainy years -- one hopes the marriage lasts so long. ::)Neither of these kids are especially good cooks but both are eager learners. The set includes a very good beginning cookbook by Donna Ryan, very well written and quite useful. It has a 1950's feeling but the photographs are excellent and the text useful for browsing.This set was furnished by the Amazon Seller for review purposes.Robert C. RossNovember, 2015

My Rent-A-Kid and his 90 pound German Shepherd love this launcher. His only negative comments:"Boy, this get wet fast." -- solution a towel or two darts."Can she chew it up?" -- good question. I gave it four star despite the two mammal delight responses because the darts look a little flimsy and if the sling gets wet it is a little hard to pull back, putting some stress on the sling.I will revert in a month with an update and perhaps a change in rating.In the meantime kid and dog are having a ball -- it's a wonderful way to teach kids that dogs like the German Shepherd need lots of exercise.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

The description of this product seems very confusing to me: "Easy to adapt to your dog's size thanks to the special micro-regulation system."That is true within a certain size limit, and you need to order with care. There are different sizes for different gods.My test dog was too little for the sample sent to me for review, but it did look very well made, the adjustments went easily and well, and with the right sized dog I would rate it four stars. But before buying, I would suggest you compare prices with other similar harnesses. It seems a bit pricey based on a few minutes of sampling.Robert C RossNovember 2015

As a maintainer for the New York-New Jersey Trail Conference, I chat with other volunteers about their favorite tools, and believe me the discussions can become passionate. One of the trainers for our maintainers took this position when I asked him if these pruning shears were any good: "couldn't say offhand - typically we use larger loppers or smaller pruners. I haven't ever used shears for trail maintenance, though we do have two older pairs in the local tool cache. I do know that Fiskars is one of the most readily-available brands, and I haven't had any issues with their other products. A local Home Depot or gardening center would likely be able to give better information on shears."Approaching 80, I decided to use these on a recent maintaining expedition on the Orange Trail at High Mountain State Park.Frankly they got a bit of getting used to; the manufacturer who has great customer service and who offered me these shears for a Review -- sent me some great instructions. My first instinct when feeling resistance is to push through, but with these you back off the pressure until you hear a click -- very audible in the forest -- and then lightly squeeze again.Fun really, and as my hands get weaker I will use them again, and perhaps more and more. Not yet committed enough to put them into my tool backpack but will certainly store them in the trunk of my car for that evil day.Robert C. RossNovember 2015How to Unlock Your PrunerApply pressure by squeezing on the handles to release the pressure on the slider. The slider should then easily move to unlock the pruner.How to Use a Ratchet PrunerIn order to gain the maximum benefit from your ratchet pruner, you need to use it correctly.  A ratchet pruner is used differently to a conventional pruner.1. Open pruner all the way.2. Place pruner on the branch, as far into the jaw as possible. If you don’t place branch past the midway point, you will not have maximum leverage and the branch may be difficult to cut.3. Squeeze the handles together, advancing the blade through the branch with minimal effort. Once you feel increased handle resistance, STOP squeezing.4. Release pressure to open the shear slightly until you hear a definite CLICK.  Again STOP and do not open the blade any further.5. Squeeze again, repeating steps 3 and 4 to completely finish the cut. Do not pull or rip at the branch.Caring and Maintaining Your Ratchet PrunerTaking good care of your pruner will help ensure they work well and remain trouble free.1. Use a clean cloth to wipe the blade of any residue.2. Remove any debris around the spring or ratchet mechanism.3. Apply a coat of oil (I use WD-40 because it is so versatile) to your newly cleaned pruning shears.4. Oil also helps your pruners open and close smoothly without catching or sticking.5. Use a rag or paper towel and wipe off any oil residue, leaving a thin coat of oil.

A few days after my wife died, both of my knees started to ache with varying amounts of pain, from 4 to 8 or 9 on my personal 1 to 10 pain scale. Nothing seemed to help, and my GP suggested seeing a doctor at the NYU Hospital for Special Surgery in Manhattan.We chose Dr. Halpern, author of The Knee Crisis Handbook: Understanding Pain, Preventing Trauma, Recovering from Knee Injury, and Building Healthy Knees for Life, and a very experienced knee expert (among other things, he was team doctor for the Jets for a number of years). Dr. Halpern diagnosed advanced arthritis, and he suggested I try Glucosamine. He said that my case was fairly well advanced -- he couldn't explain why the pain was presenting so late in the disease's progression -- and that some patients had good results from Glucosamine. In any event, side effects were minimal and alternatives were much more "heroic". (And, also, perhaps unavailing as I learned while representing a major company that made artificial hips and knees.)I did a bit of research and learned that reports of effectiveness range from 10% to 70%, depending on the population being surveyed; "Consumer Union" has historically been on the low end of that range, although more recently "CU's medical and nutritional consultants have identified and tested a few products ... with possible benefits and sufficiently low risks to recommend for general use, including: saw palmetto for benign enlarged prostate in men, glucosamine and chondroitin for arthritis, and fish-oil capsules (omega-3 fatty acids) for heart disease."Glucosamine is often sold in combination with other supplements such as chondroitin sulfate and methylsulfonylmethane. Of the three commonly available forms of glucosamine, only glucosamine sulfate is given a "likely effective" rating for treating osteoarthritis.In my case, I started taking three of these tablets a day, and the pain subsided only three days later. Today, ten months later, it is rarely more than a 1 or 2 on my pain scale, and when it kicks up I take one to three more tablets. They actually taste good, and work very well.My brother-in-law has had a similar problem for the past five years, and his pain is also controlled by this product. Based on the reports of others, it may not help everyone, but it sure helped both of us.I've tried a number of different brands, all of which provided the same relief.Robert C. RossNovember 2015
Works fine here with iPhone 6 and with my iPad. As advertised.Robert C. RossNovember 2015

As a five foot, six inch geek, big boned, this watch barely "works". Not at all at the opera or, as my beloved says, "in polite society. You need something more elegant, Robert."Elegant? Me? "It will take more than a watch my dear to make me elegant."But out on the trail where mud and leaves and creepy crawly sometimes hide the time on more elegant watches, this one fits the bill. The extra weight is reassuring somehow and the big numerals are almost always visible.Also great while working, building wine racks, building a trail on a rocky route, weed whacking. Makes me look really tough!Four stars -- three for elegance, five for rougher work -- choose your type and enjoy perfect time keeping.Robert C. RossNovember 2015
Perfect fit, just as expected from Oxford. Very well made with tight seams.

Recently re-released in Paperback, this important work is being published once again, with a fully updated full-color map included!From the publisher:"Rarely, a guide to understanding a classic American landscape comes along. The Catskill Forest: A History is Michael Kudish's account of his life-long pursuit of how climate, soils, plant biology, and people have affected the Catskill forest since the last glacier retreated 10,000 years ago. It's all here: Native Americans, European settlement and agriculture, early forest industries. Dr. Kudish guides us into the mountain ranges one by one. Pick your favorites--Slide, Bearpen, Peekamoose, Kaaterskill High Peak, Shokan High Point. Go out on the trails. Explore the long history of connection between the Catskills and the people fortunate enough to inhabit or visit these enchanted mountains." --Morton S. Adams, MD, Olive Natural Heritage Society and Catskill Institute for the Environment."This book is one of the most comprehensive natural histories of the Catskills and its map includes historic uses along streams throughout the Catskills. Information that is invaluable to anyone trying to understand stream ecology today. Great stocking stuffer for the budding naturalist in your life! Or for the adult one as well.Extracts: "Some people consider human effects on the landscape as part of natural history, but this writer prefers to keep the natural and unnatural (i. e. human) history separate because of the very different nature, and greater degree, of forest disturbance caused by people. This brief history is written more from the viewpoint of the forest itself, and less from the human viewpoint expressed in most historical writing. The Catskills, as defined geographically by this writer, extend greatly beyond the Catskill Park Blue Line, especially on the west and north. This brief history therefore includes lands as far as the West Branch Delaware River and as far north as the Manor Kill."Human effects first began to be felt along the Escarpment and in the Ashokan Basin as Native American populations increased in the adjacent Hudson Valley sometime between 7,000 and 5,000 years ago. Their frequent fires began to sweep up into the adjacent mountains and converted the northern hardwood forests into southern hardwood forests; the latter consist primarily of nut trees – oaks, hickories, chestnut, and a shrub: mountain laurel. Repeated fires locally in the interior may have come later, the northern hardwood forest having been converted to the southern hardwood forest along the Esopus-Birch-Vly Creek corridor and the East Branch Delaware River corridor perhaps between 4,000 and 3,000 years before the present. Southern hardwoods therefore follow people.""European industries invaded the Catskills, each industry disturbing the forest in its own unique way. Settlement and agriculture were first, increasing during the first two decades of the 19th century. Farming for crops and pastures meant forest removal. Lumbering was done for houses, barns, mills, factories, and other buildings."A wonderful book for anyone interested in the Catskills or in nature in general.Robert C. RossOctober 2015

The Amazon seller offered me this combination for my Review and I am very glad they did. My wild and rather coarse hair comes out very smooth, soft and manageable -- not so important really in my codgerhood, but nice nonetheless.Years ago I earned the nickname Beethoven because of my hair a very convoluted pathway: Robert to Bobby to Bob to Beto [after I took up Spanish] and thence to Beethoven after a brief stop at Einstein.Now I'm back to Robert or Bob with the help of this shampoo and conditioner combination.Robert C. With Vine's help, and as a rank beginner, I've been trying several photo editing programs.At the getgo, for some reason this is the easiest to use for me -- and I'm not really sure, but several of my photographs were really greatly improved.I've read several of the other more specific reviews, and have decided to use this one -- it works smoothly on my Lenovo ThinkPad and with Windows 7 -- I avoid upgrading as long as possible because of the costs of learning, which software manufacturers always under estimate in my long experience with computers.More anon, with more experience.Robert C. A great deal of the money with these two toys goes to royalties -- the pieces are well enough made and since there are inter-changeable parts, probably worthwhile for a real Star Wars fan.But for my Rent-A-Kid, the figure had no interest and he liked the vehicle much better. These are beautiful cups and lined with nickel. Some  people believe that an occasional drink from a pure copper cup will not hurt you, but why take a chance?The nickel lining also protects the cup -- it may ding a bit, but a pure copper cup would be very easily damaged.Lovely behind my bar.My favorite recipe is from Epicurious:Ingredients•1 half lime•2 ounces vodka•4 to 6 ounces ginger beer, preferably homemade or Cock'n Bull or D&G Old Jamaica brandsPreparationSqueeze lime into Collins glass (or copper mug) and drop in half lime. Add 2 or 3 large ice cubes, then pour in the vodka and fill with cold ginger beer. Serve with a stirring rod.Wikipedia tells the story of this drink, based on a story in the New York Herald Tribune::The mule was born in Manhattan but "stalled" on the West Coast for the duration. The birthplace of "Little Moscow" was in New York's Chatham Hotel. That was back in 1941 when the first carload of Jack Morgan's Cock 'n' Bull ginger beer was railing over the plains to give New Yorkers a happy surprise…The Violette Family helped. Three friends were in the Chatham bar, one John A. Morgan, known as Jack, president of Cock 'n' Bull Products and owner of the Hollywood Cock 'n' Bull Restaurant; one was John G. Martin, president of G.F. Heublein Brothers Inc. of Hartford, Conn., and the third was Rudolph Kunett, president of the Pierre Smirnoff, Heublein's vodka division. As Jack Morgan tells it, "We three were quaffing a slug, nibbling an hors d'oeuvre and shoving toward inventive genius". Martin and Kunett had their minds on their vodka and wondered what would happen if a two-ounce shot joined with Morgan's ginger beer and the squeeze of a lemon. Ice was ordered, lemons procured, mugs ushered in and the concoction put together. Cups were raised, the men counted five and down went the first taste. It was good. It lifted the spirit to adventure. Four or five days later the mixture was christened the Moscow Mule...[The Moscow mule is almost always served in a copper mug. The popularity of this way to serve the drink was due to Martin, who went around the country to sell Smirnoff vodka and popularize the Moscow mule. Martin asked bartenders to pose with a speciality copper mug and a bottle of Smirnoff vodka and photographed a polaroid picture of them. He took two photos, leaving one with the bartender for display. The other photo would be put into a collection and would be used as proof to the next bar that Martin visited of the popularity of the Moscow mule. The popularity of serving the Moscow Mule in a copper mug has carried through to present day, primarily due to tradition and aesthetic reasons.Robert C. RossOctober 2015Review samples provided by the Amazon seller for purposes of this Review.
