The crib sheet fit my crib mattress quite well.  100% cotton.  Made in China.Waterproof quilted pad - It measures 18X27  and is white in color.  It would be good as a changing pad or in a bassinet.  Also, if you are breastfeeding in bed, this is a nice size to lay down beside you to protect bed linens.  When paired with a second quilted pad, it could work well in a pack 'n play to protect the bottom from spit up and leaks.  It has no tie downs and it is a touch small for use in a crib.  This product washed very nicely. Top layer 100% cotton, middle layer polyester fiberfill, bottom layer 100% vinyl.  Made in China.Protective Crib Mattress Covering:  This measures in at 28X52 and is white in color.  I inserted it underneath my sheets.  It has no tie downs.  Top and bottom layer are 100% polyester.  Middle layer is 100% PVC.  Use caution when drying this particular item.  I left it in a bit too long and the PVC started to react poorly to the heat of the dryer.  Made in China.

For the first 25 weeks of my pregnancy, I had no fewer than eight pillows cushioning my front and my back and legs.  My husband had to reach over a mountain of pillows to remind himself that, yes, we shared a bed.  Despite all the pillows, I found myself constantly on my back, which doctors and nurses and every book tells you is a big no-no.  So, I ordered this pillow and when it came, I immediately thought it was going to be fantastic despite my husband saying, "Gee, I've always wanted to sleep next to a massive refrigerator."The pillow is massive.  I have a queen bed and it takes up half the bed easily, but it replaces the individual pillows that I had supporting me.  When I first tried it after its arrival, I napped on top of it, face up and the pillow was so comfortable on my back.  Using it as a reading prop was also wonderful.  When I started to use it as a support for side sleeping, I had problems.The pillow is the same width and height all around the "U" shape.  The material is not overly soft but not particularly firm.  For supporting the back and belly, this is great.  There is enough give on the pillow to accommodate a growing belly.  However, the height of the pillow really hurt my neck.  I don't normally sleep with my neck at the angle that is pictured in the stock photo.  I try to keep it more neutral.  The user's head doesn't sink down particularly well on the pillow, which can cause intense neck cramps, next-day discomfort, and overall grouchiness.The last couple of nights, I've tried to invert the U pillow so that my head is at the opening and I use a different, lower pillow to support my neck.  I haven't found this positioning to be as effective at cradling my belly and back.  The legs of the U end up flaring out and I end up sleeping on my back.For individuals who like tall pillows, plan to use this as a reading support, or plan to sleep on their backs on top of the pillow, this product will probably work great, but I have to find something that offers better neck support for nighttime support.

I made my husband put this thing together and the first thing he said when I dumped the gazillion pieces out of the box was that it would be easier to put together an airplane.  There are so many pieces and for new parents like us this unit was a pain to put together and required careful attention to the directions and hunting for random pieces.  When finally assembled, the unit is on the whole heavy but does not offer the impression of being sturdy.  It has a low weight threshold of 20 pounds and only moves in one direction.  It is a battery hog requiring 4 D batteries along with one C battery.  Turning on the device requires that switches be in an unlocked position and the user has to push the seat to get it moving.  Folding the device is a pain and moving it without folding it is also a pain.  The seat is nearly horizontal so baby is looking upwards rather than at the things happening around him.  As battery life dwindles, music quality naturally suffers.  Really, the only two things I like are the elephants on the swing which match the nursery and the soft fabric.

When I travel, finding things that have multiple utilities can help save space and lighten the overall luggage load.  This microfiber blanket is quite ample in size and for the space conscious traveler it can function as a beach blanket, sleeping throw, or even a massive towel.  I've spent a lot of money on travel towels that are made out of microfiber because microfiber travel towels are light and dry quickly.  With the Yoler blanket, you essentially have a substantial quick-drying blanket that can function as a massive towel for a price that is equal to or better than units marketed as travel towels and half the size.As noted above, the size is great.  You can put two adults on this blanket comfortably or several children.  I really like the corner pockets on the blanket that can be weighted down with sand or stones.  That is a smart addition that I have not seem incorporated in many blankets I've owned.  The microfiber material allows sand and rocks to be shaken off relatively easily.  The travel bag is a nice addition that allows for easy toting of the blanket.I have a yellow Yoler beach blanket, and it is a very cheerful color.  The biggest flaw with the yellow is that I found that when placed on grass, it can collect grass stains.  It is not a huge knock; I generally anticipate that blankets placed on grassy surfaces will pick up dirt and stains, but I did have some difficulty removing the stains from the fabric.  I wish the Yoler blanket were offered in some darker colors to hide stains a bit better.  For use with kids, the blanket is bound to pick up stains from drinks if not from surfaces it is placed upon.All in all, I would recommend this blanket, and I personally will consider it as a gift option for others.I was provided with a free sample to test.

I had to fool around with this product a few times; the initial attempts did not yield great results, but after playing around with the amount and incorporating a hair dryer, I have found that this sea salt spray is actually pretty nice.  I already have curls, but they are often wild and I've often yearned for the great curls that I've attained at the beach on visits past.  I actually like the second day results of this product better than the first day.  The product dispenses easily and it doesn't have an overly strong scent.  Even when I have used too much product, the result wasn't overly heavy - it looked wet but didn't feel weighed down.  Even though the product has salt in it, I did not find the product to be overly drying even when using the product three or four times in one week.

When just looking at the tiny product stock image, this looks like a really cute clothing piece for a little one.  And it is cute, but it is not very well made.  The bath rode is said to be made out of terry that is "incredibly fine, soft, and strong."  I don't think I would use any of those words to describe this piece.The fabric is thin and not very soft; it reminds me of cheap discount towels that I've purchased at Dollar General when I forgot to pack towels for a vacation.  The fabric also sheds little pieces of white over the pockets and any people who are in contact with the robe.  The shedding went down slightly after a few washes.The trim details and pockets seem to have been rather messily down; there are lots of loose strings.In terms of things I like, it is great that the  sash is affixed to the robe; it is one less thing to lose.  I think the grey and white is a nice color combination.  The lightness of the robe makes it a good piece for spring and fall.Ultimately, the quality is lacking on this piece.  The loose strings are prevalent and who really wants to gift a lint roller along with an infant robe?  Kind of tacky.  Knowing all of this, the color scheme is nice.

When this stroller is paired with the Graco SnugRide Click Connect 35 Car Seat, Gotham, the user effectively creates a travel system that permits easy movement of the car seat from the vehicle to the stroller.  Please note that Graco has two types of connection systems - the click connect and classic connect.  You have to use the click connect with this stroller.  You may elect to purchase the stroller,  SnugRide Click Connect Seat, and car seat base as a set rather than on a piecemeal basis.  See here for an option:  Graco Aire3 Click Connect Travel System, Gotham.  All this being noted, and if not clear, this stroller does not come with a car seat.  If you want to use the stroller with an infant, you'd want to purchase the car seat.ASSEMBLY:  The stroller has some assembly that is necessary when the box arrives.  With a couple snaps of the wheel and front security bar, the stroller is ready to roll.  Compared to some other infant items that I've had to assemble, this unit was a breeze.CONNECTING THE INFANT SEAT TO THE STROLLER:  This is a pretty easy process.  The user must fully recline the seat (see below), open the car seat attachment flap that is found on the front of the stroller, and then insert the carseat into the stroller and pushing down with enough force so that the car seat will latch into the side mounts found on the stroller.COLOR AND ASSETS: The color is great - a gender neutral black and tan.  Overall, the unit looks sleek and somewhat sophisticated.  The canopy extends easily, and I haven't had many problems with it retracting on its own.  The seat can also be mostly vertical or reclined.  There are straps on the back of the unit that are pulled down to make the seat vertical.  There is a button that can be pressed to recline the seat fully.  The seat must be reclined fully to safely accommodate the SnugRide Seat, which is used for infants up to 35 lbs/32 inches.STORAGE:  The storage area under the stroller is a bit on the small side.  If you have a massive changing bag or even a book bag, I would opt for something a big thinner or it isn't going to fit.STORAGE:  The stroller does fold up easily.  There is a pull located in a pocket underneath where a child would be positioned.  The pull merely needs to be moved upward for the unit to collapse.WEIGHT:  The picture on the stroller box shows a happy mother carrying a collapsed stroller in one hand with an infant in the other hand.  I don't know about that.  The stroller still has a decent sized footprint and 21 pounds is not feather light when also potentially carrying a diaper bag or personal purse.EASE OF MOVEMENT:  Over concrete, grass, and rocks, the stroller moves pretty easily.  I'm impressed by the smooth ride that the four wheels facilitate.

I've been providing grain free cat food to my cats for a little over a year.  I do encourage cat owners to give it a try, especially for owners who have cats with digestive issues.  Additionally, I've always been able to integrate a new grain free flavor into my cat's daily diets with few consequences (e.g. loose stool or vomit).  I've used nearly all of the Natural Balance grain free flavors as well as the 4health brand that is sold by Tractor Supply Company (indoor formula & whitefish potato and pea).  All together, I've tried about seven options. Next to the Tractor Supply Company's whitefish, potato, and pea option, I've never struggled so much to get my cats to eat a grain free option.  I have to mix this in with another cat food and even then I find that my more intentional cats will spit out the pieces they do not enjoy.  I do like the size of the pieces; for older cats, the pieces are small.  Also, there is very little odor.  The 4health grain free indoor formula offers a cat food that similarly lacks an odor and smaller sized pieces.  I would recommend that over this option.

Balance Bites are an interesting concept.  Each pouch contains little chocolate protein puffs that offer 13 grams of protein and 190 calories.  For a snack, I like the amount of protein and the overall calories.  Also, when I eat snacks, I most prefer those that allow snacking for an extended period of time.  Snacks such as Balance Bites offer the impression that you are getting to consume a lot more since each bag  is packed with protein puffs.The problem with these protein puffs is that if you like tasty snacks, this one is a little lackluster.  For the amount of protein, I expected some type of chemical protein flavor that often accompanies protein powders.  There wasn't really a chemical flavor; there wasn't much of any flavor despite being coated in a milk chocolate layer.The milk chocolate layer does melt easily and because this is a snack that involves the hands, it is rather messy.Another eating option is to pair the puffs with milk or a milk alternative and eat them like a cereal. I paired a bag with So Delicious coconut milk, and the result wasn't too terrible.  Pairing the protein puffs with ice cream also sounds somewhat appealing to me, but then the concept of the 190 calorie snack goes out the window.At the end of the day, I would encourage the company to continue to work on its formulation with a specific focus on flavor and a secondary focus on making the puffs a little more resilient to heat.

In theory these seemed like a good idea, but this product did not work for me; the pieces never worked for how I was carrying in my pregnancy.  I'm carrying most of my weight in my stomach, so I have been able to get my pants on and zipping is still possible but not entirely comfortable at 24 weeks.  The problem is that none of the black elastic options fit; they are all too long and easily come undone.  The inserts do not match very well.  I've found it better to just wear belly bands with my regular jeans or to wear maternity jeans. Maternity jeans are very comfortable and I found them at many thrift stores.  If you live near a Clothes Mentor, I highly recommend stopping in for discounted maternity wear.

The handle is very short on this.  I'm 5'6'' and there is a great deal of bending over that needs to occur to complete the cleanup task.  If your younger kids are on cleanup duty, then this will likely work okay.  I can't say that I find this unit particularly durable.  It is virtually 100% brittle plastic.  With two dogs and daily cleanups, I don't see this lasting a long time.  The tongs/teeth on the device get tangled in grass that is not cut short, which can make it difficult to retrieve doggy debris.  All in all, if you have your eyes set on other options, look for something longer and that has more substantial metal components.

I ordered these for use with regular educational panels in which the panelists need to be seen by observers from the back of the room.  The chairs provided the height, but I have to say that I have had fears that some of the panelists would break the chairs because these chairs do not come off as durable.  They were not the easiest pieces to assemble.  The footrest sits at an angle and the metal braces had to be pounded with a mallet because they would not lie flat.  Thankfully, I keep these at my office where there is enough storage that the chairs do not have to be folded.  They would not endure constant folding and unfolding.

This cable is MFi certified, and after testing it on an iPhone 6 Plus, Ipad, and and iPhone 5S, there were zero compatibility issues. The heavy gauge wire and nylon braiding feels extremely durable and well made. It looks good, too, especially in a car with a dark interior. It has a certain "heft" to it that the standard Apple lightning cable lacks (I have worn out three of them, all from the sheathing breaking apart at the insertion point to the plugs). I can't see the cable breaking or the sheathing coming apart without severe, abnormal abuse. The 6 feet length is perfect for just about anything. Another great product from Anker.

My overall impression is that these are mediocre.  A serving size is three pieces with a total of about five servings in a resealable bag.  Each piece is one to two bites, but unless a toddler is consuming them, two bites is likely the maximum.I like that you get 7 grams of protein per serving, but at 180 calories, I'd rather go for a Quest bar that has just a few more calories, 20 grams of protein, a lot more fiber, and a lot more flavor.  These bites only have 1 gram of fiber per serving.  I don't know why the product description currently says that they are a good source of fiber.In terms of taste, I didn't find the blueberry flavor to be very strong.Texturally, the pieces are satisfying.  They are a mix between a softer granola bar and a muffin.The ingredient profile is found below.  Note the addition of palm oil; the harvest of palm oil has led to mass deforestation in parts of the world.Whole Grain Oats, Soy Protein Isolate, Sugar, Wheat Flour, Canola Oil, Refiner’s Syrup, Water, Almond Pieces, Glycerin, Honey, Dried Blueberries, Egg White, Rice Starch, Molasses, Salt, Soy Lecithin, Cinnamon, Baking Soda, Calcium Carbonate, Natural Flavor, Palm Oil, Blueberry Juice Concentrate, Mixed Tocopherols Added to Preserve Freshness.

First thing first: This is not a truly wireless device. There is a base unit that plugs into your audio output from your TV, but then there is a second device about the size of a deck of cards that you have to carry with you and connect your headphones to. On one hand, this is a plus because you can use any wired headphones or ear buds of your choice. On the other, it can be a bit of a pain to have to carry around the receiver (it comes with a neck lanyard). Just something to be aware of.The back of the base unit has an input for optical audio cable, stereo RCA jacks, and a mono RCA jack. For my testing I used the stereo RCA jacks because my television only has one optical audio output that is always connected to my sound bar. Sound was clear and loud, and the default ear buds are of mediocre quality. They do come with three sizes of buds so it was easy to fit them for a good audio seal. The claimed range of 33 feet seems about accurate. Walking to the kitchen with a wall between the base unit and myself, the range dropped to about 15-20 feet. Standard stuff.Overall, the device does what it says: Beams sound from your TV to a set of headphones without have to have the TV volume itself on. But this is hardly anything revolutionary, there are countless wireless listening devices all over the market place right now. That brings us to the big problem with the device: It is $200, priced at the high end of wireless listening devices, and offers nothing special to justify the cost. I would look at other options for better prices.

1:30 Mins After spending 10 minutes trying to catch crickets with my bare hands every week, I decided to get out of the Dark Ages. There must be a better way. So I started researching Bug Vacuums and most were toys - which is okay as long as they work. I settled on this one because of the ability to lock the insects in the chamber, since crickets were my insect of choice.The vacuum has good suction but since the opening is large for bigger insects you must have it directly over the insect to suck it in. But once it is in the chamber it is not going anywhere - the suction is really good at the back end.So as you can see from the video I caught at least 40 crickets in about 20 seconds.It comes with 4 "AA" batteries but as a rule I always switch them out of any toy and insert fresh Duracell batteries.The Good:Easy to use - just pull the trigger.Easy to empty out the insects as the chamber comes apart in two areas.Trap door to lock the insects in.Trap door doubles as a magnifying glass so you can study the insects you trap.Comes with a cool green light.A great choice if your in the market for a bug vacuum

2:04 Mins In the video I show you how I calibrate my pH Tracer Digital meter with these three buffer solutions for a 3 Point Calibration.. I use each pH buffer and the results were 100% accurate:Buffer Solution 4 = pH 4.0Buffer Solution 7 = pH 7.0Buffer Solution 10 = pH 10.00Watch the video to see the results firsthand.These Buffer Solutions are plenty big so they will be good for many calibrations. A great deal and a solid purchase.

3:20 Mins I got this tester to review for my YouTube Channel but I also like to share my reviews here on amazon.com.The tester is well organized and easy to use. It comes with simple clear color instructions. Basically you will use five drops of each specific reagent to do the six test factors (five if your not doing Bromine) and a tablet for the CYA (Conditioner) test.The ColorQ Pro 7 test for Free Chlorine, Total Chlorine, Bromine, pH, Alkalinity, Calcium Hardness and Cyanuric Acid. There is enough reagents for 144 test and 100 tablets for CYA testing. Plenty if you are a homeowner for the season.What is to like about the ColorQ Pro 7:Easy to preform each test.Results are reliable - I matched them against digital testers and my Taylor FAS-DPD K-2006 kit. Results are right on.Easy to read digital display.No more color matching - the colorQ gives you an exact readout.The unit runs on AA batteries which is good.Reagents are clearly marked and have an expiration date marked on them.Cons:Reagents do expire so figure to buy a new set every season.It does take a little more time than your traditional reagent test and test strips - (but the results are spot on and worth it).It may not be a suitable price point for some - but you are paying for ease of use (you can't beat the digital readings).Bottom line, if you are looking for a test kit that gives you accurate easy to read results and is simple to use, this is it.Watch the video to learn more.

1:51 Mins If you have a pool that gets a lot of fine particle debris - St. Augustine grass, thin bamboo type leaves etc., then this is the canister for you. I personally like the Hayward W560 better but that one does not pick up fine debris as well as this one.This canister is well built and will last you several years if not a decade or more. The lid is easy to remove as long as you keep it lubed and change the o-ring when it wears out. The video shows you another trick with the lid o-ring to make it easy to remove.To see more details watch the video.A solid purchase for sure.

1:09 Mins These Polarized Sunglasses do exactly what the description here states. It eliminates the glare from the Sun and allows for crystal clear vision. They also fit very well and are super light on your face.One thing to note is that the lenses are very dark at times if you are not in direct Sunlight. But after awhile you get used to them and it is not a real issue. If you are coming from standard lenses you will notice an amazing difference right away.For me, I was looking for a pair of Sunglasses to cut down on the glare while I service pools. Lately, I guess I am getting older, the glare has been bothering me and I needed darker lenses. So these Sunglasses fit the bill and they are perfect for outdoor use in a Sunny area.The lifetime frame and lens warranty is pretty good too. It comes with a storage pouch and a lens cleaner. Not much to the packaging but a great value.Watch the video to learn more and to see them in more detail.

1:20 Mins I received these googles to test and post a review.They are really cool goggles. Fit really well, are super easy to adjust and they stay in place while swimming and jumping in the pool. I like the nice mirrored lenses and the tint of these goggles.It comes with two extra nose pieces for an exact fit and a super nice case to prevent them from scratching.And the Lifetime guarantee is a definite plus. Order a pair - you will like them for sure. Very niceWatch to video to learn more.

1:19 Mins My son is in his 2nd year of tennis lessons. We play in the street all the time and decided we needed a net to enhance the informal practice sessions. So we went out and measured various lengths as there are 10 ft., 12 ft., 14 ft. and larger nets available. we settled on this 18 ft. net as it is a large area and cars can still pass it in the cul-de-sac.It took us about 10 minutes to assemble it the first time. It is very simple to set up. The parts look durable and the net is a quality product. As you can see from the video it is a perfect size for rallying and a great practice aid. It is also very light weight and easy to carry and set-up.The price is affordable and the quality of the product is good.

1:49 Mins Another pool guy swore by this product so I picked one up at my local SCP Wholesaler to try out on some stains on my pool route. I was skeptical at best. But right from the start it took off a Frisbee size rust stain. Then a small little rust stain and last a large stain that has been on that particular pool for a few years - not exactly sure what it was. The video will show this thing really working.The other pool guy suggested I try it on scale on the pool tile and sure enough it took the scale right off too. I also show it in the video rubbing off a black algae spot on the pool bottom.Some of the negative reviews are due to a misunderstanding and it seems the earlier listing was for a 6-pack of the product. Also some stains might not be what they appear. The plaster has defects called Mottling, which is not a stain, so rubbing it will do nothing. If you have dark copper staining the only way to remove those stains is with an acid wash. Nothing will rub those off. But for rust stains and other similar stains this thing works great.

2:45 Mins I received this to review on my YouTube Channel but think those on Amazon.com can benefit also from the review.NaturAqua is a 100% mineral salt product. It does many things when added to your pool. It controls algae growth, clarifies the water, allows you to use less chlorine and stabilizes the pH.Using mineral salts in a pool is a fairly new and unknown concept here in the US. I spoke with the manufacturer and it has been widely used in Mexico for over 18 years. This is the first time it has been sold here in the US.A little bit of this product goes a long way. The container is only 10.6 oz. but for most pools that will get you through the entire swimming season.I have been testing the product now for over seven weeks in my test pool and it is looking great. This is a good alternative product if you are sensitive to chlorine and want to keep the levels low in your pool all season long.The test pool has been fluctuating between 1.5 ppm to 0.5 ppm and looks crystal clear.The product is effective and works very well.

1:24 Mins These gloves are great for outdoor work. For my type of work they start to show wear after 2-3 weeks but they are getting wet constantly so that is a factor. They are very comfortable and the backing is very breathable so you can comfortably wear them all day without issue. The grip is very good and the protection they offer your hands is excellent. I have been using them for almost three years now and they are the best.Watch the video for more details.Note that I wear both the medium and large size. The medium fit me a little better as I am 5' 7" and 145 lbs. When in doubt go with the large size. I can easily wear both sizes.

2:49 Mins I've had my Max CG for about 2 months now and have been using it almost everyday on my pool route for pools, spas and water features. The Extreme Multi-Layered bag is very good but mine started to wear out. I thought I would give the Sand Silt bag a try since I am mainly vacuuming up dirt and fine particle debris.This bag has turned out to be exceptional. The fit and quality are great. The bag is also very well made and it traps sand and dirt very well.As you can see from the video it does a great job with very fine dirt and debris and after several uses it is holding up without issue.For the price you are getting a great bag.

2:40 Mins I use the IMAK Hand / Elbow Arthritis Gloves and have been wearing them religiously for over four months now to sleep. They work great in relieving my hand pain and discomfort.I've been using these Vibrating gloves now for over 2 months and I must say they do add to my treatment. At first there is no noticeable difference but consistent use - for me that is once or twice a day, you do notice added pain relief. I think if you are expecting to put these on and be cured after one use, you don't understand the nature of arthritis. For me it is a constant regiment of being extra careful with my hands, wearing the compression gloves, watching my diet and using these vibrating gloves. All of this is continuous and if I stop the pain will return at a higher intensity.So basically it is like fighting a war in which you cannot let up - the treatment needs to be done everyday, probably for the rest of my life to prevent worse pain and discomfort. Like I mentioned in my IMAK glove review, my Grandma on my Dad's side had severe arthritis, my Mom and her Mom also have severe arthritis so it is no surprise to me at 43 years old that I have developed arthritis. Plus the work I do doesn't help -swimming pool service - constantly using my hands.These gloves work well and are an effective treatment over time. They are comfortable, charge quickly and relieve the pain in my hands.

0:56 MinsWas reluctant to get the skin for the T5i since I liked the small body and excellent grip provided by the actual T5i body. Had one on my T2i and liked it. After a long trip with the Rebel T5i I decided that the skin was needed to protect it and keep the body scratch free.You can see from the video that it fits the T5i really snug - like a glove. Some reviewers noted it was loose but not so in my case. Offers good protection, buttons are still accessible and it is very durable. The one on my T2i is about three years old and still looks good.

2:58 MinsThe reviews of System Mechanic scared me away. No way was I going to load a program that could crash my computer. the AVG seemed like a safe option - does just enough without potentially messing up the computer.Was thinking about replacing my slow, slow, slow Windows 7 desktop (2 years old) but for less than $20.00 why not try this - I thought. I ran a free program the night before to see if I had issues - I did (you will see that in the video). Loads of issues in fact.The AVG program downloaded just fine - product key is easy to find (it is also in your Amazon.com order e-mail receipt). Program is easy to work with - it does everything for you and you just need to click "okay."The dashboard is nice and user friendly and it comes with some very nice optimizing tools for the screen and programs to speed up the computer. Plus the Registry Fix, Disk Defragmenter, Disk Dr. and many other features.Great price, safe to use and sped up my computer to where it is running very smooth now. So far so good.I would recommend this as it worked for me.

3:45 MinsBeen using a Pro Vac for almost 20 years now  - not the same one of course ;). They last about two-three years on my route. I also use the 22" one for vacuuming my larger pools - also a great product.But the 14" is my default vac head. It is easy to use, swivels nicely and is built to last. The seal on the bottom is great as it increases suction and allows for an overall better vacuuming job.The Good:smooth vacuuming with great ball bearing wheelsSeal on bottom allows for great suctionSwivel handle allows for sharp turnsPerfect size for the step area & spasGreat for spot vacuuming using automatic cleaner hosesExtra heavy weights so vac head won't floatComes with a swivel head attachmentBasically an all around great product.

7:39 MinsLets start with the drawbacks of this cleaner. It is all plastic so if you drop it from any height you will probably crack it. It would be nice if this thing had some aluminium plating on the bottom and on the handle. So rule number one - don't drop the Pro 1500.It is too large to vacuum some step areas in a pool - not a major issue as you can brush the top step down.The back seal needs a lot of silicone lube to keep it water tight - but this thing is underwater for at least an hour each day so it makes sense the the battery compartment seal needs to be very strong.So that is the reason it got four stars - there is room for improvement.The Good now. The suction on this thing is great. When I tested it with my hand in the mouth the suction was similar to a vacuum hooked up to the skimmer on a 50 ft hose. It vacuums up the bottom really well. The Layered Debris bag traps both dirt and leaves no problem. It is a good size bag so you won't be stopping every few minutes.Note that a pile of leaves will clog up a standard manual vacuum and it will clog this one also. The opening is the same size as a manual vac and hose.The battery will last for about one hour or more - it comes with two so you can get 2-3 hours of vacuuming out of this thing no problem. That is good enough for my route.Has a nice shoulder strap for easy carrying. The Vac head it comes with is pretty good too and it comes with a standard plastic brush and wheel head too like the Pro 900.Very easy to maneuver in the pool and makes vacuuming a breeze.It comes with a one year warranty so that is a plus for sure - especially if you drop this thing ;).All in all a solid product.

4:21 MinsThis cleaner works well and if you experience a lack of suction simply tie part of the bag off with a rubber band - basically cut the debris bag in half and suction will increase tremendously. The bag actually sits too close to the motor impeller opening - so when it starts to get a little full suction will drop off. This trick will keep your cleaner suction strong even when the bag is filling.The overall design seems good, I've been using it everyday on my pool route and haven't had any charging issues or other problems - I did shorten the debris bag down to create more suction. I just keep the charging port well lubed with Magic Lube Silicone Lube to prevent water damage and make sure I drain the unit completely to prevent any motor damage. Simple steps to take so you aren't sending this thing into Warranty. I will update this review over time and let you know how my unit is holding up longer term.

4:20 MinsFirst, the only difference between the MAX and the MAX CG is that the CG has a higher power rating. Is there a huge difference in suction? Not really. But it is noticeable and the CG runs louder when you turn it on.I did extensive research by reading the reviews here and on other sites. The main cause of failure seems to be not lubing the charging port before putting it in water. In the video you see me Lubing it up with Magic Lube Silicone Lube. Essential for a good water seal. Second, the motor on the Pool Blasters are vented to prevent overheating so you must completely drain it out off all water to prevent rust forming in the engine. Two simple things to remember.If you notice that you have a problem with the cleaner losing suction after a minute even with a clean debris bag I discovered a helpful trick. Simply tie the bottom portion of the bag off with a rubber band to shorten the bag. This creates more area for the impeller and will increase the suction dramatically.The improved debris bag that comes with this unit is quite good. It is multi-layered and although it looks and feels fragile it rinses out without ripping no problem. It also traps dirt very well.Suction drops off if the bag starts to get overfilled as the motor pulls water from behind the bag. Also, when the charge starts to weaken you will notice a drop off in suction. Fully charged and with a clean bag you can submerge it and stick your finger in the mouth and feel really good suction.It has the standard one year Warranty and like almost all manufacturer you will pay to ship it back. I hate that but it is common practice with almost every manufacturer. Shipped a basketball back to Spalding - paid $5.00, shipped a camera in to Cannon - $8.00, etc. Hopefully if you follow the tips listed you won't need to use the Warranty at all.Good solid cleaner and it does what it is designed to do.

0:59 MinsIf your looking for a good looking violin at rock bottom pricing this is it. If this is going on a shelf on display it will look like a $100+ instrument. The strings actually tighten well and the sound is decent. The bow as you can see from the video started falling apart from the first use. As a starter violin or if you are just going to dabble with it not a bad investment.Bottom line: good looking violin, great case, okay sound, poor quality bow.

4:42 MinsI was worried after reading the reviews stating the battery compartment didn't seal properly. That would be bad. But I was relieved when the unit I received had what I believe to be the updated battery compartment cap. The older units seem to come with one that had clips on the side so maybe that was the issue all along? Regardless, as you see in the video I load the battery compartment seal up with silicone lube like how my son likes his toast - "lots of jelly Papa." Safe to say I have opened it twice now in three weeks since getting it and no water inside, "yeah!" - If you haven't seen the video I use Magic Silicone Lube for the water seal.With that out of the way, this thing works great. It comes with 8 knock off Duracell looking batteries so I am sure it will run longer and better with fresh batteries. But so far no complaints. The power is good enough to do exactly what it designed to do - pick up the leaves on the bottom. Like all leaf vacs it won't pick up large branches or rocks, some small seed pods are okay - picks up good size acorns no problem. It is mainly for a pool with a lot of leaves.I like the fact that you are not dragging a garden hose around and you save water. So it is faster and easier to move this thing around.It comes with a one year warranty so if there is a problem you can get a replacement as some here have noted in their reviews. I like it and will use it on my pool route.

3:35 MinsThere are a lot of different patches on the market and I chose this one based on the good reviews. I was surprised by how much material this kit actually comes with. Yes, the patch material is a little thin, but that shouldn't effect the long term hold of the patch as the actual vinyl liner is also quite thin itself. The glue is very good and pliable and they give you enough to do several patches. More glue than I expected. There is also instructions in Spanish and other languages.As you can see from the video it is pretty easy to do as long as you can reach the area to be patch (you might have to dive down in other cases).A good buy for the price and this seller shipped it to me in one day with AmazonPrime. Excellent shipping.

5:05 MinsI currently have this cleaner in my pool and it is spotless.This is the New redesigned and updated Kreepy Krauly by Pentair (Model 360040). If you have a Vinyl or Fiberglass pool you will need (Model 3060042) as it has a Pleated or Flat Seal.This is actually the first real overhaul of the cleaner since its inception. There have been over 3 million Kreepy Krauly cleaners sold Worldwide making it one of the most recognizable cleaners on the Market. My customers refer to their cleaner as Kreepy Krauly even if it is not one.I though I would be retired before Pentair remodeled their flagship cleaner. The version previous works great in the pools they are in so I figured they wouldn't mess with it. I'll be honest the old version was sometimes a hard sell since it did look dated. The new version just looks spectacular.From the color scheme down to the sleek new style it is a great looking cleaner. It will sell just on how cool it looks. But of course the other selling point and one that is more valid is that this cleaner is a Beast. It will pick up large debris that other cleaners won't even attempt to pick up. It also is designed to cover the entire pool when set up correctly. All in it is a design that really works.I will point out a few of the things I really like about the new unit. First, the cleaner itself is made out of a harder plastic that by the looks of it is very durable. The Kreepy already had parts that lasted forever so I expect this new one to have even more durable parts. The Seal plate is extra thick so it will also last longer.I like the new bumper. The Kreepy Krauly Classic works great but the bumper would sometimes not pull the cleaner out of the step area. This one has no issues and is designed to help the cleaner out of tight spots. Plus it looks very durable.I really like the adjustable Dive Float. One of the problems with the Kreepy Krauly is that it works too well. It would sometimes come out of the pool or get stuck on the hose coming out of the Side Port or Skimmer. Now you can simply adjust the Dive Float down to prevent that.The cleaner also comes with a generous amount of hoses, Twelve one Meter hoses or almost 40 ft of hoses.Suffice to say this is a great improvement over a cleaner that really didn't need to be improved. I highly recommend the New Kreepy Krauly.

5:23 MinsThis is a great looking cleaner when installed in a dark plaster or peebletec pool. It will not only work great but blend in to the pool surface and won't detract from the overall look of your pool.Here I give a review and show you how to properly install the Poolvergnuegen Limited Edition "Dark Color" 2 wheel suction side automatic pool cleaner. I feel that this is the best suction side cleaner on the market today.This cleaner works well in all pools and will not get stuck in any corners or on the steps (as long as you have the correct wheel RPMS). It is super reliable and the only part you need to change regularly is the tires (every 2 years or so). I have eight of these installed in various size and shaped pools on my route and have no issues thus far, 2 are over 4 years old. This is the first Limited Edition that i have installed and I really like how the dark colors look in a colored plaster pool. It just blends in well.This is also a product made locally in America which insures a great quality product.

This is a good purchase especially if you have Lego set 60025 already. It is not in the same car category but is part of that sets team. This is easy to put together and me and my son had fun racing the two sets in our kitchen to see who would win the trophy that comes with this set.I wish Lego would make more of these smaller sets - my son saves up his weekly commission ($3 a week) and so it took him only 3 weeks to save for this set. He built it in about 30 minutes.Most Lego sets are now $20-$40 which is okay but there is also a need for these smaller low priced sets.

3:54 MinsThis product really works as described. It has some kind of powerful enzyme that breaks down scum in the pool water.At this account I would scrub these tiles every week and the scum would just come right back as if I never scrubbed the tile line. The customer would constantly complain.I thought I would give "Pool Perfect" by Natural Chemistry a shot here as I have used it successfully on less extreme cases. Basically the problem here is that the dogs will swim in this pool every week and the gardener will blow dust and junk into the pool each week with his leaf blower. It really doesn't help that these tiles are light tan in color.So I scrubbed the tiles once again and then I added the "Pool Perfect." To be honest I didn't have high expectations at this account. The next week I was surprised to see the tile looking like I just cleaned them. I added two more capfuls of "Pool Perfect" and gave it another week. As you can see from the video after three weeks the tile is still looking like I just cleaned them (As of now it has been 5 weeks and the tile still looks great).  So I have been adding the maintenance dose each week now and  haven't had to scrub the tile line. This stuff works amazingly well.If you are interested in the tile brush (it actually attaches to a pole nicely but in this pool the decking overhangs at an angle so it is easier to use it by hand) Here is the make:Purity Pool TSQC Tile Scrubber with Quick ConnectIt comes with a regular pad but I upgrade to a more coarse one:Purity Pool RPC Replacement Pad for Tile Scrubber, Coarse

5:22 MinsHere is Zodiac's newest cleaner the T3. I was skeptical about it since the T5 was less then spectacular. But the T3 is a surprisingly good cleaner. It is based partly on the T5 and I think it has some of the good qualities of the G2 also. It is weighted very well so it climbs the walls and moves at an excellent speed (once the suction is adjusted properly with the flow gauge that came with the cleaner).It reminds me of a mini G2 cleaner which I think is the best of the Zodiac bouncing suction side cleaners. I like the molded plastic as it feels very durable and I also like the fact that Zodiac kept things simple and this cleaner only has twelve parts. It operates with the one moving part concept, that being the new redesigned diaphragm.As you can see in the video it picks up debris very well  -not sure why the small rock stopped it but the big one didn't -- probably the angle of entry. You get the idea that it won't have any trouble in a pool that gets lots of debris. If it is pliable the diaphragm will pick it up.It did get stuck in one area of my pool by the steps when I manually dragged it to that spot and let it try to get out. But it hasn't gone to that spot by itself. I say what was happening to case it to get stuck and the solution was simple. At the recommended suction of "3" it just would wedge itself in the corner and couldn't get free. I lowered it down to "2" and it worked it's way out of the corner no problem. So the key if your T3 gets stuck in a corner is to lower the suction and it will work it's way free. I left it set at "2" so it won't get stuck in the future. Adjusting the hoses and weights won't solve this, just lower the suction.I think the cleaner is priced very well for what you get. I still wish Zodiac would include a threaded side port fitting with their cleaners. Most other cleaners come with it and to purchase one will cost you $20-$30. You can't hook it up to the threaded side port without it so if you don't have one you will need to purchase one. Here is the best one: Hayward W400BWHP White Free Rotation Vacuum Lock Safety Wall Fitting.The only problem I have is that the new style hoses are limiting. If you want to spot vacuum your pool or spa you can't just attach a vacuum head to the hose. Also, the twist lock elbow doesn't fit into the side port without a locking device and even then it isn't secured as well as universal type hose.  In the installation video I show this in more detail. I also will show you how to connect a leaf canister in the installation video --coming soon!Here are the good and bad points that you see at the end of the video expanded:The Good:Picks up lots of different size debris:It does a great job on the debris I gave it and gets a  thumbs up in that departmentVery well build and weighted down good:I can't say enough about the hard plastic body. It just feels indestructible. It feels heavy too which is good for balance in the pool as it climbs the walls and moves around.Moves around the pool really well:This cleaner moves at a very good pace -- just like the great G2 cleaner.  It will clean the entire pool in no time at all. It also goes up the walls with no problems.Comes with durable new style locking hoses:Okay, the hoses do have a good point. They look and feel very durable. But there was nothing really wrong with the old universal hoses.The Bad:Only has 30 feet of hoses :Two more hoses would have been nice. But it should work in most standard size pools.No side port connector device included:Again, a big gripe with Zodiac. Make a wall locking fitting for the side port and put it in the box.New style hoses limit spot vacuuming:Again, you can't really utilize these new hoses for manually vacuuming your pool or spa.Footpad & Finned Disk one part together:It looks like a good idea. But I don't think the parts on the old cleaner wear out at the same pace. It does save you one part by combing them together.All in all I give this cleaner four stars. I just am not a fan of the new locking hoses. Zodiac got it right again with the T3. They are back on track here and this one is a winner.If you need to connect a leaf canister to this cleaner here are the parts you will need to make the new style hose connection to the canister:Baracuda MX8 Cleaner Leaf Catcher Hose Adaptor R0533300Baracuda MX8 Cleaner Leaf Catcher Hose Adaptor X77094

1:22 MinsWe were on the fence about ordering this Cutout. I couldn't find a review or a photo or video showing it next to a person so there was no way to know how it really looked. But we needed a centerpiece for my son's train theme party so we decided at the last minute to order this. I picked a seller in California hoping to get it in less than one week. The seller was great about tracking it down from the manufacturer and making sure we got it for our party. I would recommend the seller for sure:  Lamps Beautiful. They went out of their way on this one and we are very thankful.As you can see from the video it is a high quality photo on a piece of cardboard. It looks real so that was a relief. I thought it would be larger but it turned out to be a good size. I think there are some slightly larger ones available but my son likes cargo trains. I would recommend it for a party. It was packaged very well and is a good quality product.

2:47 MinsHere is a product review video of the Nordic Flash Floating Camera Strap for your digital Waterproof camera. I am using a Samsung HMX here but it works also on Your Underwater GoPro/Panasonic Lumix/Nikon COOLPIX AW110/Canon PowerShot D20/Fujifilm FinePix/Olympus Tough/Sony.This is a handy thing to have if your going to use your camera while fishing on the lake, swimming in the Ocean and even in your backyard pool. Here is the cool thing about it - it is a 2 pack. That means you get two floats for the price of one.At the end of the video I show me using both floats on the camera. Being in the pool industry I know one thing about water - it will destroy everything eventually - especially salt water. So if you are using this a year from now and the plastic or strap has been weakened by constantly being in water and it snaps while you are swimming in Lake Baikal in Siberia Russia your camera will sink 1,637 Meters or  5,369 feet (deepest lake on Earth). But wait, you had two floats holding your camera so all is well Comrade ;)That is one of the major complaints I was reading about these floating straps - but the Nordic Flash solves this problem by giving you two floating straps. Very nice.The Nordic Strap is very comfortable while on your wrist and the strap has good slack so you can shot videos or photos while the camera is strapped on.  The color is bright enough to see from very far away and it floats very well with the camera attached if it were to come off your wrist. But it fits on your wrist very snug.Did I mention it is a 2 pack? Excellent product.Oh, I received this product for free for a review on my YouTube Channel - but I thought I should post a review here also.

4:06 Mins***Update*** 6/14/2015 - after a year and a half the drive is still working great. No issues at all with the drive so I think I am in the clear.Got this drive delivered on a Sunday by AmazonPrime. Wasn't home to see who dropped it off, maybe a local Warehouse employee...So far this drive is impressive. It connected to my computer within seconds. If you watch the video you will see it backing up my photos pretty quickly through the 3.0 USB port.It is super quite. It is backing up as I type and my Desktop is louder then this thing.It is compact. About the size of a VHS tape. If you don't know what that is  that means I am getting old. If I had one of my Dad's 8 tracks around I would have used that ;)It comes in a hard metal case which is pretty cool. It adds some heft to this little drive. It also makes me think it is durable. I think that also raises the price point above other drives in it's category.I will update this review in a couple of months to let you know if the drive is still doing well. So far I like it. A good buy.

3:35 MinsThere are a lot of different patches on the market and I chose this one based on the good reviews. I was surprised by how much material this kit actually comes with. Yes, the patch material is a little thin, but that shouldn't effect the long term hold of the patch as the actual vinyl liner is also quite thin itself. The glue is very good and pliable and they give you enough to do several patches. More glue than I expected. There is also instructions in Spanish and other languages.As you can see from the video it is pretty easy to do as long as you can reach the area to be patch (you might have to dive down in other cases).A good buy for the price and this seller shipped it to me in one day with AmazonPrime. Excellent shipping.

I have this card in my Samsung Galaxy III.It has been in there now for about 8 months with no issues. Okay, it had one issue but that was the phone design itself. It would un-mount if the phone was moved around roughly. It seems to pop out very easy in the Samsung Galaxy phones. So I solved the problem by putting some electrical tape on it to hold it in. So far after 8 months it hasn't un-mounted. It will give you an ungodly amount of storage on this phone. If your wondering if your Samsung Phone will take this card - it will with no issues. It shows a total of 59.6 GB of available space once installed. A must have since most phones come with 8 GB of internal memory nowadays.

I wanted to make sure this thing held up before I reviewed it. So far it still snaps shut and is used almost everyday while driving. It attaches to the dashboard of my Lexus (it is that soft but rigid leather material) and so far has stayed on like it is super glued on there. Apparently it can be removed and moved but why mess with perfection.It holds my Samsung Galaxy III which already is a huge phone, but wait! Add an Otterbox Case to make it look like it is on Steroids! But it still fits in this holder nicely. I have it a little high in the holder so I can reach the volume button if needed. If you clip this phone type directly in on center the volume button is covered by the clips. Not a huge issue.This is a really good Car mount if you have this cell phone. Would reccommend it.

So you got one of those Visa Gift Card Credit Cards for Christmas, huh. I got a $100.00 one and I hate splitting the balance in a store. It is confusing to the cashier and annoying when the line is held up because the exact balance is off.So use it on amazon.com instead  by purchasing a gift card for yourself.Enter your name and e-mail as the gift card recipient.Just enter the card like this:Name on Card: Gift Card Recipient (that is what it says on mine for the name)Card Number: the 16 -digit card numberExpiration date: mine was 02/22 - Wow - that is a long time from now.After that finish the order and an e-mail will be sent to you. In my case I had $100 in my amazon.com gift account instantly.This is a nice way to use up the card if you don't want to spend the complete $100 at once. Amazon will apply the balance to future purchases. I used mine all up on a 4 TB hard drive which made it a great deal!Hope that helps.

Okay, Windows 8 is complicated. 8.1 makes things a bit easier  -at least the start Icon is on the bottom in Desktop mode. But for a 92 year old codger it can be mind boggling. He finally needed a newer computer and so he entered the strange world of Windows 8 (Rod Sterling is standing over your shoulder). I sent him some YouTube videos to watch but he is "Old School" and needs to hold a book in his hands. This book is perfect as it has great pictures which makes it very easy to follow. He should now be able to handle Windows 8.1 without pulling the remaining hair out of his head ;)I gave him two tips before getting the book and they might help you also:If you get stuck just hit the "windows" key on the keyboard and it will take you back to the "Start" menu - the screen with all the tiles. Then if you need to escape and take a breather click on the "Desktop" Icon and relax as you view Windows again. All is right with the world. This key is located on the bottom left between the "FN" and the "ALT" key. it has four squares on it and look like a window.There are some full screen apps now which means there is no "x" at the top to close it. Help! You are now trapped forever on that screen... you can hit that "window" key on the keyboard again to escape. To close a full screen app simply scroll the mouse to the very top, it will transform into a hand. From there drag the mouse down and to the bottom of the screen. The full screen app should shrink and as it reaches the bottom (it will drop halfway through the bottom of the screen) it will close.There is an alternate way to close these full screen apps but this way is pretty easy. I don't see the point of full screen apps. They confuse the heck out of everyone.So these two tips saved him as he waited for this book to arrive.For more tips of course get this book and read it. It is handy to have around if you are new or even have used Windows 8 or 8.1 for awhile now. Very useful.

I know there are two memory modules pictured here for 4gb of Memory which had me a little worried since I thought it might be two 2gb modules. I read in the item detail that it is one module but the photo had me wondering.It is 4gb on one module which is good because my Laptop only had two memory slots. So I easily upgraded my 4gb laptop to 8gb. Very easy to install took about 45 seconds to insert the module.Package was actually from Crucial.com which is a huge internet computer Memory Website which made me feel better about the purchase. So far after 2 months the computer is working great with no issues. Would recommend.

There were so many choices for screen protectors on Amazon so I went with the one with the best reviews. Turns out to be a good choice.These things cover the entire front of the ASUS MeMo Pad FHD right up to the edge area which is great. The slit for the front facing camera is just perfect.Okay, I will admit it, this is something I can't do so I let my wife do it. I just am not a detailed Perfectionist type like her ;)The first try was a botched attempt because some bubbles formed due to dust on the screen. My fault as the table she was working on was a little cluttered ( got yelled at for that). So she pealed it off and tried with number two on the kitchen counter. This one went on perfect with no bubbles.It fits so good that you won't even know it is on there. Doesn't effect the screen quality or touch sensitivity in the least. But you must put it on in an area that is 100% dust free and clean -if anything gets under the screen during the application it will not look good. That is how good it sticks to the screen. We could see the dust trapped under it in the first try.Not the manufacturers fault but the envelop was a little bent even though it says on there in big type "Do Not Bend." Reminds me of the Toy Story airport baggage scene...

4:34 MinsThis tablet is amazingly good for the price - I got mine for $232.00 as I know the price fluctuates and I have seen it as high as $289.00 so be patient and snag it for under $240.00I did a video review covering the basics but just to sum up:The tablet is super responsive and fastGreat screen resolution 1920 x 1200 (like your LCD TV)Expandable memory with a mini SD slotAwesome sound qualityASUS brand name - they make good laptops alreadyLarger screen then the iPad (9.7")Light and well constructedExcellent price pointresponsive keyboardvery good cameratouch screen is not over sensitiveBasically like your Smart Phone Jumbo sized ;)The video goes into more detail. I would say this is an excellent choice for a tablet. You will be happy with it.If you are reading this review from your Android Phone or Tablet and can't see the video (The Amazon APP won't show it) you can watch it from your Desktop or Laptop or you can watch it from your Android device if you follow these steps:1. Download Adobe Flash Player for Android (Note: it is not available in the PLAY STORE so you will need to download it directly from ADOBE. If you don't know how there are some videos that will help you, just Google: "How do I install Flash Player on my phone?" It is very easy to do.2. Install the "Puffin Browser" from the PLAY STORE3. Open Amazon.com in Puffin4. Go back to this review and hit play ;)

5:21 MinsIn the video I show you how to assemble the table which I found to be pretty easy. The hardest part was getting the tiny screws into the handles. It seems very well constructed for the price. This model CHH received the best reviews so I decided to try it out. I didn't want a full size table since they take up a lot of space. This one is portable and small enough to put away after playing with it.It is a great size table for my 5 year old son. The players spin well and though some have commented on the thin hollow rods, they seem fine. The bottom fit in snugly and all the parts fit well. The wood and players themselves look fine.Again, there were a lot of these 20" tables on Amazon but I think I chose wisely with this one. Watch the video as it covers everything you need to know.

2:22 MinsThis was given as a gift to my 5 year old son. It assembled in minutes and works great. As you can see from the video this thing will pop a ball up and also pitch. It is made of hard plastic and though it looks like a toy it works very well.It comes with a good plastic bat and three rubber balls. It can probably pop-up or pitch at least five balls before it runs through it's cycle and turns off. It runs for a short cycle and then turns off so that is a nice feature. It takes four "D" batteries not included of course ;)My son loves it. As you can see from the video this thing really works. It is an everyday type toy -at least here in Southern California where it has been 80 degrees all week in late December - we are spoiled here for sure.So far about 7-8 kids have had a try at it in the park. All of them love it. Two parents are going to order it for their own kids.

2:33 MinsThis case is really good. The tablet fits in there very snugly and doesn't move around at all. The quality of the case is great also. I mainly purchased this for the stand option. I like the dual stand mode and the fact that it is not held up by a tab cut into the back of the case like the cheaper versions (which tend to weaken over time/use). It is a sturdy product with all the buttons and cable hook-ups easily accessible. The video will cover all of this also if you watch it.Good point:All the cable holes are uncoveredThe volume button is also uncoveredThe speakers in the back of the ASUS are uncovered by the case as it has two slits down the backThe top switch is uncoveredWell made caseNice colorBad points:Makes the tablet a bit heavierThe camera hole will create a shadow unless you unvelcro the holder part before taking a photo.A great case for your tablet.

My eyes can be sensitive to light and I never drive without sunglasses. Even with sunglasses, though, sometimes the light glare can be difficult. For instance, when you find yourself driving behind a silver car and the sun glares off that car in a way that blinds you. Not to mention that driving with sunglasses on at night doesn’t really work, but some cars headlights blind you.The HD Vision Visor is a great way to reduce the glare from the sun or oncoming headlights. There are two pieces to it, and you simply flip it up or down depending on whether it is day or night.I found that this visor really works well to reduce the glare for me. The only reason I didn’t give it a full five stars is that I think it needs to be a little wider and a little longer. If they make a larger one, I’ll definitely want it too.I received a complementary sample unit for review.

It is so annoying when you drop things in that gap between the seats in your car. Sometimes you can find the item again, and sometimes you can’t. Even when you do find the dropped item, reaching it can be tricky. Months ago, I dropped a micro SD card in that area and was extremely lucky to have found it, but it was very difficult. The solution? Prevent things from falling down there in the first place.The Catch Caddy Car Seat Catcher, Car Organizer is a great way to handle that. You still drop things, but instead of getting lost under the car seat, they fall into this caddy, and you simply pull the caddy out and retrieve your item.I had a bit of trouble with it popping out at first, but I finally got it pushed down far enough between the seats to stay put.This is a set of two, which is great for those of you with two gaps to accommodate. My Chevy Impala only has one, so I have a spare on hand in case something happens to the one I’m currently using.This is a very simple device that is infinitely useful.I received a complementary sample unit for review.

It is handy to have a scale around the house. I have a postage scale and I have a kitchen scale, both of which have been very useful to me. I was intrigued by the portability of the Smart Weigh Digital Pro Pocket Scale with Back-Lit LCD Display, Tare, Hold and PCS Features 500 x 0.01g (2 Lids Included).It is important to note, that while the size and weight of this scale are very convenient, its maximum weight capacity is 500 g, so if you need something that can handle bigger items, this is not the scale for you.If you just need to weigh small packages or letters, jewelry, or ingredient portions in the kitchen, then this scale may be just the thing for you.It is battery operated, and the manufacturer includes two AA batteries in the device. The LCD panel is easy to read and the unit has an auto shut off feature to help prevent draining your batteries. I weighed several items on this scale and then my other scales to compare, and this scale reported the same weight as the others each time. So, either this one is accurate or they are all wrong by the same amount.If you need a small, portable scale, you’ll definitely want to give this a look.

I love to cook and often host dinner parties for friends and family. In order to accommodate food issues for various guests, I often end up making two entrees in addition to sides, salad, and dessert. Needless to say, I go through a few dishes in the process, especially measuring spoons and measuring cups. One thing I don’t want to have to do while in the middle of cooking such a big meal is to stop and wash the measuring cups I need to use again soon. I prefer to have several sets.The OXO Good Grips Plastic Measuring Cups, 6-Piece, Black is a good set to have on hand. This set offers five measuring cups and a leveler tool in this set, all of which nest and lock together very well to keep all of the pieces together. The cups are well marked on the outside of the cup near the top so you can easily see the size you need before you take them apart.I was surprised to find that Oxo included a 2/3 cup in this set – I’ve never seen that size before. Along with the 2/3 cup, you’ll find the standard  cup, 1/3 cup, ½ cup, and 1 cup measuring cups. The leveler is a nice touch, but unnecessary in my opinion. It works, but a butter knife works just as well. In fact, I can’t attach the leveler tool to the top of the stack if I want to store them in the drawer where I keep my other measuring cups because the leveler makes it just a bit too tall for that drawer.These measuring cups can be easily washed by hand or in the dishwasher. I am very pleased with them and would recommend them to anyone who needs a set of measuring cups..

I have used suction cup holders in the shower with success, but I have to say that the InterDesign Classico Suction Soap Dish is not a good one. My shower wall is smooth and clean, yet this soap dish falls within an hour of attaching it to the wall, even when empty.I would not recommend this soap dish. There are others that work much better.

New computers or CD/DVD burners come with software to create and copy discs, but that software is usually a starter edition that provides basic functionality. This is enough for the general user, but there are times when you need your media creation software to be a bit more robust.I’ve had TiVo since the first model came out and one of my favorite features is its ability to transfer recorded programs to your computer, where the show can be burned to a DVD. Since this TiVo feature was introduced, there has always been only brand of media burning software at a time that could transcode the TiVo video format to DVD. That started with a different company, but Roxio bought them several years back.I have to say that I have always been disappointed that Roxio has offered less functionality for creating DVDs from TiVo files than the previous company offered, but the software still works well for the core function, transcoding the video. What is missing is a lot of extra templates and features that made the menu screens for the DVDs a bit spiffier. And of course if you need software that can create a DVD from a TiVo file, Roxio is your only option today.Roxio does a great job of burning copies of CDs and DVDs as well as creating new ones. You can use it to create back-up discs of your data as well.Roxio Creator NXT 3 does a lot more than burn discs, however. You can use it to edit video, make movies and slideshows, and even record directly from your computer’s screen using the new ‘Live Screen Capture’ feature. As with previous versions, you can also convert videos to formats that can be transferred to and played on portable devices like iPods.This version of Roxio supports a variety of Windows operating systems, including Window 8, Windows XP, and all of the workstation class versions of Windows in between those two.The install of Roxio went smoothly on both of my Windows 7 x64 computers and the software runs very well on both.If all you need to do is to make copies of discs or burn data to discs, I recommend you stick with the software that came with your computer or optical drive. If you want a full-featured media creation program that can edit and create video and turn TiVo files into DVDs that can be played on most DVD players, then you will want Roxio Creator NXT 3.

After using a few different power banks, I’ll never buy a spare battery for a smartphone again. It is so much easier and more economical to use a power bank. A spare battery can only be used with one device, but power banks work wonderfully for charging most devices that charge via a USB port.The Eachine Mini Y5 6000mah Super Compact LCD External Battery Power Bank is a great option for anyone who wants a small, lightweight power bank that still packs a lot of battery juice. With 6000 mah, this unit can charge my Samsung Galaxy S4 smartphone fully more than twice.This power bank comes with the unit itself and a micro USB cable that you can use to charge the power bank and also to connect a device to the power bank. Like all of the other power banks I’ve had, this one doesn’t come with a power adapter, but the device can be charged using any USB power adapter or the USB port on a computer.Most power banks have a built in flashlight and this one has a good bulb in it.Because it is smaller in size, it only has one USB port, so you can only charge one device at a time with this unit. You can find power banks with two USB ports, but they will be larger and heavier. This one fits easily in my pocket.One thing I really like about this one is the digital display, which shows you how much charge is left on the device. It never shows 100% - the maximum charge I’ve seen is 99%, which is not a problem for me. Although this did cause me some confusion Christmas Day. I’d used the device the day before and plugged it in before bedtime Christmas Eve so it would be ready to use the next morning. When I woke, it had only charged up to 66%. I plugged it into another device to charge it and hours later it still showed only 66% charged. I decided to deplete the battery completely by leaving the flashlight on all night. When I picked it up to turn on the light, it finally struck me that I had set it on the nightstand upside down, so it was actually charged to 99% the whole time! I had to laugh at myself, but in my defense Christmas Day was pretty hectic.I would recommend this power bank to anyone looking for a powerful yet lightweight device to charge their USB powered electronics on the go.I received a complementary sample unit for review.

I have five cats and I spoil them a little. I don’t let them run wild, but I do like to reward them when possible. I don’t give them treats every day, but they do get them several times a week. I normally buy treats with seafood or catnip flavors, but I recently tried TEMPTATIONS TUMBLERS Chicken & Turkey Flavor Treats for Cats, and they have thoroughly enjoyed them. How do I know? Well, they ate them. And as anyone who has a cat knows, cats don’t eat something they don’t care for. In fact, one of my male cats doesn’t like soft food or soft treats – he only eats crunchy food and treats. He love these.The manufacturer tries to play up the round shape, saying that they are fun for cats to roll around and play with. Mine don’t play with these treats – they just eat them. Maybe if I only had one cat they might play with them, but when you have more than one, they eat treats quickly before another cat takes them.I’ll definitely buy these treats for my kitties in the future.

Even when I was slim, I sometimes wanted to wear something that helped flatten my tummy a little. When I worked in a bank, it was usually control top pantyhose – which I hated wearing. When I don’t have to wear pantyhose, I normally choose some shaper wear. I recently tried the Maidenform Flexees Women's Shapewear Brief Firm Control, Blush, X Large.The first time I wore it, a couple of people at work asked me if I had lost weight. These people see me every day, so that was a good sign. I wore it all day under my work clothes and I do think it helped flatten my stomach a little.I’ve worn an X-Large size for a couple of years now and while I am still that size, I have lost some weight in the last few months – the looser waistbands on my pants and skirts prove that. Even so, the X-Large size of the Maidenform shapewear fit a bit tighter than I thought they should. It felt fine in the stomach area, but it cut into my skin a little around the leg holes and the waist of the shapewear.I think the product works, but I am not sure if the uncomfortable fit is due to the way it is cut or if they are just sized smaller than they actually are. If you try these, I would recommend ordering a size larger than you normally wear.

I love music and carry my iPod Classic everywhere I go. I have my whole music collection on that iPod so I can enjoy any song in my collection. I also have a lot of my favorites on my Samsung Galaxy S4 smartphone. My iPod Classic requires headphones or an external speaker to listen to them and although the Samsung phone has a speaker built in, a phone’s speaker is never really ideal for listening to music.The BeoPlay A2 – Grey is a great option for me. With its 3.5mm audio port, I can plug my iPod or other devices directly into it, but with its Bluetooth connectivity, I can connect many more devices to it wirelessly.The BeoPlay also has a USB port built in that you can use to keep a device like a smartphone charged using the battery in the BeoPlay. That battery can last up to 24 hours, but if you use it to charge another device, it would shorten that time. One thing that disappointed me about the charging function is that it only charged a device while it was playing sound from it. If I stopped playing something on my smartphone, the BeoPlay powered off after a short while and then stopped charging my phone.The BeoPlay comes with a power adapter to charge it, but no other cables. You must provide your own 3.5mm stereo cables or USB cables if you need them.The sound on this speaker is really phenomenal. It gives 360 degree sound coverage and the audio quality has a depth to it you just don’t get on a smartphone speaker.I am very happy with this speaker. If it could charge a device even when not playing audio from it, I would give it 5 stars, but since it does not, I have to give it only 4 stars.

I cook a lot and entertain a lot. It can be frustrating to spill or splatter your outfit with whatever you are cooking in the middle of a dinner party, requiring you change and soak your top before a stain sets in. To prevent such mishaps, I try to remember to don an apron before cooking. I have several aprons – some are just utilitarian and plain and others are nicer. I’ve really liked the recent trend with more feminine and flirty aprons. The Flirty Aprons Women's Sadie Blue Chocolate Apron is the second one I’ve had, and while I really like the colors, pattern, and the style, I am a bit disappointed in the actual fit.The apron says one size fits most. My current size is XL, and other aprons that are one size fits most worked well for me. Something about this one just doesn’t work with my body type – the curves of the apron hit my curves all the wrong ways and just doesn’t suit at all.

I like my make-up to look natural, but that doesn’t mean I won’t jazz it up a bit with some glittery eye shadow when the occasion warrants it. JAPONESQUE Velvet Touch Shadow Palette, Shade 02 gives me a nice, subtle eye color that allows for a little sparkle when you want it.Combining some matte colors with the glittery colors makes it easy to dress your eye make-up up or down with this one palette.I haven’t used this brand before, but I have to say I like the colors and I like how smoothly the shadow applies and blends. Although I do like it, I can’t say I would buy it myself when the drugstore brand work just as well at a fourth of the price that Japonesque charges for this one.The eye shadow kit comes with a mirror built in, but doesn’t contain any applicators, which surprised me. I don’t think I’ve ever had an eye shadow that didn’t provide applicators before. This isn’t really a problem for me, since I use my eye brushes to apply the shadow anyway, but it is worth pointing out to other customers who might miss them.

My old shower curtain had a long life, but was finally ready to go. Raising kittens a year ago didn’t help it – apparently they liked nibbling on the edges of the curtain, which facilitated the sides tearing.One of my major requirements in a shower curtain is that it be machine washable. Being able to run it through the washing machine periodically extends the life of the shower curtain liner immensely, while maintaining a sanitary condition in the shower. The LiBa Shower Curtain Liner, PEVA Antimicrobial PVC Free Shower Curtain meets this requirement.The grommets for the shower curtain rings feel strong, which means they are less likely to rip with daily use. The liner itself is not quite as heavy as my old one, which means it billows in while I am showering, unlike the old one I had which had more weight to it. With this lighter one from LiBa, I have to set a couple of things on the liner to weight it down. This works since it is hanging in a regular tub with a ledge I can use for this and not a shower stall.That’s really my only disappointment with this liner. The look of it is nice, and the plastic is nice and clear, which allows more light in the shower.I received a complementary sample unit for review.

One of my greatest talents is being both clumsy and accident prone.
