Of course, YMMV, and please be sensible when putting items in there and don't use it with fragile heirlooms, or over a crib, and all that common-sense stuff...But, it works great for me and bonus: if my needs change, I can use it at the office, in the laundry room, in a closet, and yes, even in the shower!I've also used several of the other 3M Command Strip products and have always been very satisfied with their functionality.I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you in the same manner! :)

The short: Despite my wanting them to be awesome, I believe these gave me painful headaches.The long: I hate to give these a two-star rating, as they have such great "specs" and I really wanted them to work. They are also much less expensive than my usual once daily vitamin. (all of these factors prevented them from being a 1-star item). However, I experienced terrible headaches that only started when I initially began taking the vitamins and stopped when I stopped taking them, and I otherwise never have headaches. I have been taking various multivitamins (usually a women's formula, once daily type) for well over a decade and whenever possible, I purchase a food-based, organic, vegetarian multi. I really liked that these were also raw, as I try to incorporate as much raw as possible. Sidenote: It does worry me that the "raw" on their packaging is spelled weird, as I am familiar with "greenwashing" or other misrepresentations such as the word "organics". "Organics" is very different than the word "organic" when it comes to product labeling guidelines and can be very misleading. My concern is that "RΔW" in this case is different than "RAW" or "raw" as I would prefer. The website does claim the product is RAW, and says uncooked & untreated (not unheated, if that matters). So, the use of the Δ, instead of an A, could simply be a design-choice and not intended to mislead consumers. Regardless, I believe my "hands on" experience overrides my minor skepticism about the "rawness" of the product.Anyway, I took these vitamins for almost two months, until I couldn't stand it anymore. Within the first week, I noticed that I was getting severe headaches that would last for hours. I almost never get headaches (maybe once a year, when really stressed), so after the first two, I started to wonder. A few weeks later (yes, I know I probably let it go too long), I was experiencing long-lasting, painful headaches almost daily. They were interfering with my daily life. Being in school and working, tasks were very difficult with such debilitating headaches. I made an appointment with my doc, just in case it was something serious. Doc said all looked fine, but sent me for some bloodwork, for a more thorough look. It was at this point that I started to suspect the vitamins, but I was reluctant, since they had so much going for them. I had to wait a while to get the bloodwork done, as the doctor wanted it to correspond with a certain time in my cycle. I stuck with the vitamins for a few more weeks, until one day when I just couldn't take it anymore and, even though I had already bought a second bottle (I bought it just after I bought the first one, to be ready for when the first ran out), I switched back to the multivitamin I had taken previously. The headaches dissipated within the first two days and by the third day, they were all but gone. It's been almost two months since I stopped taking them and I've had maybe 4 headaches in that time (mostly occurring in the time just after the cessation of the "RΔW" vitamins), and none of which were as painful as those that I had when I was taking the RAW ONE vitamins. I am able to work a full day again, and have a much stronger sense of well-being.I'm glad that so many others have had positive experiences with this vitamin and I don't want this review to dissuade anyone from trying this product. Rather, I'm posting this to share my experience perchance that it might help another to determine the source of an otherwise unexplained "side effect".I do like other products from this company, including their Raw Organic Protein, their Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, and their Living Foods Chocolate Raspberry Bars. However, I will continue to purchase my multi from another supplement company.

I have owned this light for several years and am very happy with its function. I use it in my bathroom and it adds a nice decorative touch. I really enjoy the soft amber flickering glow. This is not a utility light and will not "light up" an area like a hallway, or even a countertop or sink. In a completely dark room, it will light up its own face-plate, as well as an inch or so border on the wall surrounding it. Mine is plugged into an outlet next to a mirror, so that helps to reflect a bit more light. However, it still will not illuminate anything more than a few inches or so away from it, and even up close, the illumination is wonderfully dim. Some light does come off of it, but it is mainly for decorative purposes. It can, however, be seen from afar. There are several doors in the hall, so I close the others and I leave the bathroom door slightly open for guests, and this light, which can be seen from the hall, is a nice "welcome" into the room.PROS:- LED (saves, energy, money, and does not get hot)- not overly bright; in fact, perfectly dim- flicker looks almost "real"- IMO, beautiful design- covers whole outlet, almost looks like a sconce (protects other outlet, too)GOOD TO KNOW:- will not "light up" an area (I like this and have other lights for other areas)- takes up the space of two electrical outlets (I like this feature, but might not work for other users)- ambient light sensitive (turns on if no light in area, dims if some light in area, will not turn on if brighter light in area) - cool feature, but the light is so pretty that I kinda would like it on all the time. However, this auto-off feature does save energy and extends the life of the bulb.Light makes me happy and this one makes me especially happy. When I walk past my bathroom, I feel like inside is an old medieval castle, sans rats, drafts, and invaders. It makes me smile :)INFO ADDED:For comparison, I also have:Cooper Lighting HS8 90-Degree Motion-Activated Night LightAmerTac 73092CC LED Motion-Activated Nite LiteMr. Beams MB852 Wireless Motion Sensing LED Under Cabinet Light, White, 2-PackMr. Beams MB723 Battery-Powered Motion-Sensing LED Stick-Anywhere Nightlight, 3-PackAmong several other LED lighting products (bulbs, lanterns, flashlights, headlamps, outdoor, ribbon, etc).At this point, it's hard to say which area/nightlight in this list is my favorite, as it depends on the application. I really like the Cooper Lighting HS8, for its high brightness and soft fade off feature. The AmerTac 73092cc (both styles listed together on Amazon) are nice because they are not too bright, but each light up a short hall in my home, offering increased safety, and since they plug-in, I don't have to think about batteries. The Mr Beams MB852 is super bright and great as a "utility" light or in a closet or pantry. The MB723 is nice because the light can be easily "directed" and it's not quite as bright as the MB852's. Plus, it has a light-detection feature, so if there's other light, it won't activate. It's nice to have battery operated lights, for areas where no outlet is available. I have bought several Mr Beams products and have been happy with all of them.I believe lighting is very important, for safety, decoration, function, convenience, and when done properly, beauty! Just like we are taught to use the right tool for the job, we need to use the right lighting for the job!I rely on reviews here at Amazon to help me make informed buying choices. I hope this review has helped you in the same manner. If you voted this as helpful, I Thank You! :)

I bought these for my mechanic to install (along with a spring kit, also bought here on Amazon). He said they went in without issue (with the help of the new spring kit).I've been driving with them for about 2 months and they seem to be working fine. No issues with stopping, noise, grinding, or any other noticeable annoyances or safety issues.Surely they fit other cars, as well as my subaru legacy.I rely on Amazon to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review has helped you in the same manner.

We have one of these in each of three bathrooms in our house. We'd put one in the kitchen, but have one of those big-head pull-down faucets and it won't fit. We bought our first one in May 2009, and have been using it daily, ever since, without any concerns. We then bought two more in Nov 2009 and as of this review, we still have the same ones, on all three bathroom sinks - all 3 - 3.5 years old and all in perfect working order!PROS:- use LESS water: eco- and water-bill friendly!- easier to wash hands and brush teeth, just click the stick!- less water mess around faucet- less grimy mess behind faucet (none, actually!)- keep faucet handles cleaner and with less germs (think about what you touch and when)- easier for those under 5' tall to wash their hands (no reaching for handles)- may be safer, as you set the pressure and temperature, so difficult to mistakenly set "too hot" water- claims to "fix" leaky faucets (ours never leaked, so we can't test that)CONS (just things to be aware of):- the spray is more like a showerhead spray, with individual streams of water, in a circular pattern, which splashes a bit more. Without it attached, the water is simply aerated in a single, thick stream, which does not splash as much. (minus one star)- if you have the pressure set high, it will make a loud "thud"-like sound when turning it on and off. We keep our pressure moderate, so this is not an issue for us.- although most of our guests think the sticks are neat, especially the youthful ones, a few guests have been curiously unable to figure them out (despite my well-placed signage).I did make a little sign, laminated it, and taped it to the top of our faucet handles, blocking quick access, to remind guests how to use it. In addition, I let new guests know to "read the signs" when they head into the loo for the first time. (We have signs for our dual-flush-style toilets, as well) This makes for funny discussions as well as an opportunity to tell people about the wonderful benefits of these "faucet sticks".My mom, and our other frequent guests, are happy to use them. :)I think it encourages young kids to wash their hands, as they seem intrigued by it.We get a lot of questions about germs, but once we point out that, in "mainstream" bathrooms you are using the toilet, touching the handles, washing your hands and then touching the germy handles again; and in our bathroom, you swipe the stick with the BACK of your hand, without touching any handles, it makes sense to people.We are buying more as gifts for people. They're Great!!PS - we bought ours at a local home building store (with an orange logo), for around 6 bux. Also, if you google instant-off and check out their site, you will see a variety of lengths in both white plastic and stainless steel, etc. Ours are white plastic. They generally "blend" into the color of our sink. We wipe the stick and the spray part when we clean our bathroom.Not sure about his one here, but ours came with a 13/16" Price-Pfister faucet adapter. We did not need it, as ours fit without them.I have also posted photos at: Instant Off Water Saver.I rely on reviews here at Amazon to help me make informed buying choices. I hope this review has helped you in the same manner.

My mechanic installed this kit when he replaced my rear drums. I have a '96 Subaru Legacy Wagon 2.2 AWD Automatic.He reported that all the pieces in the kit worked and fit properly. A few hundred miles later, and I can still report that everything is working as it should.N.B.: I buy the parts for my mechanic. While he didn't ask me to buy this kit when I bought the drums (he said everything he needed came with the drums I would buy {also purchased on Amazon}, or could be re-used), I bought this hardware kit anyway, as a precaution, so he'd have it while he did the install. My concern was that, due to the age of the car, some of the old parts might break during dis-assembly, or might break just after re-installation. Since he found some of the old parts to be fused together, he decided to use all of the parts from this hardware kit, and since he already had it, he didn't have to wait for a parts delivery, AND I got my car back faster. * * * TIP: Consider having this on hand, even if you don't think you'll need it.I rely on Amazon to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you in the same way.

I am a massage therapist and have experience with several products which aim to reduce pain. In fact, it's a staple that I travel with, whereever I go, and I keep a bottle in the car, one at the office, and a few at home (just in case). People come to me with their aches and pains and, in addition to other options, I usually tell them about a spray like this (and give them a bottle I happen to have closeby!).I mainly use Biofreeze spray and when comparing the two, I like that much better. It seems more concentrated than CryoDerm, as I can feel the effects better and the spray goes more on my skin, rather than floating around in the air, like the CryoDerm. It's like the particles are smaller and lighter with CD.I can spray biofreeze in the car and others can smell it, but it doesn't affect their breathing. When I spray this in the car (and I notice it, too), it goes into mouth and eyes and makes breathing difficult. This is with windows closed or open climate control on or off. I use a muscle spray in the car often, so I have tried various "configurations".Also, I can "feel" the BioFreeze working for many minutes after I've applied it. With the CryoDerm, in my experience, the effect wears off quickly, so I need to reapply (if my passengers can stand it).One good thing to report is that, with both sprays, I do not experience any skin irritation or ill effects from using it. I generally have sensitive skin and use only natural products, organic when feasible.Just a note, I have been known to spray products such as this on the back of my neck on an especially hot day, to help feel a bit cooler.I see a lot of positive reviews, so it may just be a personal preference. I recommend that you try a few different brands and find the one that works best for you. For me and my clients, friends, & family, that product is BioFreeze Spray.I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you, too.

I purchased this for my mother's use. She was able to pair it right away (she's never paired anything before). I was shocked when she called me, using it.Shocked, for two reasons (the first being how truly easy it was for her to set up, despite her somewhat limited tech experience).The second being that I could just barely understand what she was saying.She's had a blackberry for several years and we talk ALL THE TIME, so I am quite familiar with how she SHOULD sound, on the other end. I've heard her through various phone appliances and this was, by far, the worst.She was really happy with how easy it was for her to set up and how I sounded to her, through the speaker. She not happy that she had to repeat things and was concerned that her voice wasn't clear on the other end of the line. She often works while on the road, so this part is extremely important.I purchased this after doing extensive research to make sure it was easy to use and sounded great. Easy to use: check. Sounded great: not so much. Bummer.Based on reading other reviews, it seems as if only a few others have had this issue. My unit was purchased brand new, so it's possible that I got a bad one, among a sea of great ones. She was quite happy to return it, and not interested in trying another one.Personally, I have a Jabra SP200 which I am very happy with (why'd I wait so long!?!), but I wanted one with more fetaures for her (pairing more than one device, etc.) and I thought this would be a good deal. Nope.Buyer beware. If you buy this, be sure to try it out right away, to allow time to return it if you get one of the rare bad ones. Call someone you call all the time, or call your voicemail and leave a lengthy message, both before you pair it and again after you pair it and compare the sound.I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you in the same way.

I really, really, really wanted to like this. I like other things from this company and I LOVE coconut water - especially straight outta the nut! No sweeteners needed. (I also like coconut manna, and coconut smell, and coconut milk, shredded coconut, etc). This tastes nothing like coconut water. I think the stuff they add to it is what ruins it. It tastes salty and fake. I wish they could/would just dehydrate the coconut and powder it and package that. Maybe it would be different.I love coconut water, but don't feel comfortable with the environmental cost of shipping, etc. i was happy to find it in powdered form, and happy that there were so few ingredients. I REALLY wanted to like this. I'm so bummed. I can't even give it away.I see it is out of stock - maybe they are reformulating it?? Big Tree Farms, if you read this, PLEASE improve the taste of your formulation and let us know when you have. I'll GLADLY update my review for an improved product!I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you too!

I bought these for my fiancee. He is a very lean size 12. He thinks he is a ninja, and likes to spring around the house, so I thought these would complement his springing nicely. Plus, I bought Zem ninja shoes for myself and didn't want him to feel left out. Unfortunately, these socks were way too tight on his calf. He wears calf-high dress socks almost every day, so he is used to the feeling of socks on his leg. He really likes Nautica & Gold Toe brand dress socks, and has never had a problem with socks being too tight. He wears a 32x32 pant, and is about 6' tall, so IMO he does not have exceptionally large calves (they measure 13.25" at the widest point). I even slid one over my forearm (10" circum), and it was really tight.The socks are 21" from end to end. And are anatomically correct, with room for the big toe and a separate, larger slot for the other toes, with the heel cup on the back.They are kind of a scratchy, thick fabric. Also, as the other reviewer states, these socks are black, not brown.I cannot recommend these, unless the person has exceptionally small calves.I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you, too.

I am a "hook fan". I already have a lot of hooks in my house so, I bought this hook primarily for travelling. I figured it would always fit on the door I need it to. I just returned from a long vacation, where I stayed in eight different places, ranging from the floor at a friend's house on the side of a mountain, to a luxury 5-star hotel in the city. I was so happy to have this hook with me! It worked in every situation! Sharing a bathroom with others and they took all the hooks to dry their towels? No problem! I brought my own! Come back to the hotel room on a rainy day with no place to hang your coat? No problem! I brought my own! Trying on clothes and the store just doesn't have enough hooks? No problem! I brought my own!Of course, you do need to have a place from which to hang the hook, but there's usually a door, the back of a chair, a towelbar, or even a dresser drawer closeby that works great!I used to travel with 3m command hooks, but was hesitant to use them, due to their "permanence" (use the sticky stuff just once). This hook is great since can be moved quickly and easily. So glad I found this, as this hook works very well - it is coated metal (magnet sticks to it), strong, thin along the top (to facilitate door closing), has two sizes for various applications, a prominent "lip" to catch the hanging item(s), and there's even a hole drilled into one of the lips, (if you wanted to secure it to something). Could also be used to run narrow twine in a creative set-up, hanging laundry while on the road, etc. (I have a twisted bungee cord for travel laundry, tho).The magnet idea allows for a good place to leave notes for yourself (shopping list, reminder), or for a loved one (have a great day! i love you! see you at 7p for dinner, etc), if you use the hook for something daily, like: a towel, robe, purse, jacket, keys, bag, dog leash, etc. I like the 'snap! strong magnets by threebythree' that I got at the c0ntainer st0re.While I haven't tested the *limits* of this hook (I do wanna use it as long as possible), I did just toss two 3-lb wrist weights in a tote bag (total weight, according to bathroom scale: 6.2 lbs), then, I put them on a hook that was over a door. Seemed sturdy, so I swung the door open and closed several times. Still Sturdy. You might be successful in going up to 8 lbs, but that's on you to test. 10 lbs might be pushing it. Also, the more weight you put on this hook, the more stress you will put on the door hinges/screws, or whatever you have "hooked" the hook onto. Once or twice might be ok, but over a few days or weeks or more, you might have alignment issues with the door. Just something to consider, if heavy loads are intended. [many thanks to L. DeFrenne for the question]Note on c0st: I have seen it range from 12 to 5 d0llars here on amazon; and as low as 2 d0llars at the C0ntainer St0re (they also have it in white)! I may have pd more than I could have, but it was definitely handy to have when i needed it. Just an fyi to others.I highly recommend this hook - especially for travelling! With it, you know you will always have a place to hang your hat (...or your towel, or bathing suit, or jacket...)I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you, too!

I'll admit, I don't do the cooking in my house. I do some of the eating, though, and these grits are YUMMY! They are the only brand my fiancee (the house chef) buys and he cooks grits a few times per week. We like them with a bit of Earth Balance and some Himala Salt.Living in area where grits are not common, I'm glad to be able to have them whenever I want and however I want (sometimes, when there's extra, I put them in the fridge for the next day - still just as yummy!). My guy likes to add nutritional yeast to his grits, for a B-vitamin boost and a cheesy taste!PS - I had a problem with the shipping of another Bob's Red Mill product and I called the company. They were very friendly and provided me with excellent customer service.So, I recommend both the company AND it's grits!I rely on Amazon's reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you in the same manner.

My fiancée had been clacking his teeth at night (waking me), so I had bought him a few night guards, including this one. He prefers the "football type", partly because, I think, he can imagine that he's football player. Personally, I can't imagine how anyone would find that comfortable. Lo and behold, my dentist recently recommended I use a night guard (is grinding contagious??). Luckily, these came in a 2-pack, so to follow my dentist's orders, as well as support my guy in wearing his, I tried out the remaining den-tek guard.USER EXPERIENCE:I was anxious about it staying in place, but so far, it stays in place perfectly. I have a very small mouth (dentist uses kid-sized implements on me), and this guard does not feel bulky. In fact, I find it extremely comfortable.I love that it's adjustable and has numbers on the adjustable part! The first few nights, I was guessing, but I quickly found that it fits me best at 2 on the left and 3 on the right.I can easily talk and smile while wearing it! In most circumstances, it's hardly detectable.I don't feel it promotes excessive saliva production, "morning breath", or drooling.In the beginning, I discovered these little, horizontal "bumps" (like a road speed bump) along the inside of my cheeks when I woke up. One on each side. I was worried, but upon investigation, found that there are similarly-sized slots in the guard and my cheeks must be pressing against them, creating the "imprint". The bumps go away within a half hour of removing the guard, and now, several weeks later, they are much flatter and hardly noticeable when I wake up.Fortunately, I have not noticed any sores, scrapes, or areas of discomfort on either my my cheeks or gums, as other users have reported.TIPS:I clean the guard with soap & water (dr bronner's peppermint) upon removal AND prior to insertion. I slide the adjustable spine thing in and out several times, under running water, to help cleanse that part. A few times per week, I also brush the guard with my toothbrush (oral-b, powered) & toothpaste (uncle harry's glycerin-free).My first pack did not come with a case, but the second one did and it's HUGE! I might give it to my guy for his hulk-sized guard. I have found that the dark blue, round, pill-stacker canisters from the Vitamin Shoppe work perfectly. They are much, much smaller (& they stack!). So far, I keep the lid off, but before we travel, I'll have my guy drill a few holes in the side, to help with air circulation when I do cap it.OTHER PRODUCT DETAILS:In the packs I have received, so far, the "pad" part is blue, not white, as currently seen in the official product photo. I wish they were white, or clear, as the blue makes them more noticable when I talk or open wide.Also not easily seen in the official photo: the front "bracket piece" has a wave to it, so it fits over the frenulum labii inferioris.Check out the product picture posted by Logan Dillard, which has notes. If you are on the mobile site, you have to switch to viewing the desktop site to see it. This pic is a better representation than the official product photo, of the guard I received. The wave part in the front is still somewhat hidden, though.The package states: "Always been BPA FREE" & "Made in USA". They recommend you "see your dentist for a consultation within the first 3 months of using the product". Their # is 800-4DENTEK, if you have questions. Be sure to read the lengthy notes on the back of the package, as there are some important considerations, such as TMJ, bite changes, etc., that users need to keep in mind. The info may be similar, but my package looks different than the one posted by another user (newer version?).Many thanks to amazon for offering this on subscribe & save, and many thanks to the other reviewers for sharing their experience. I rely on reviews to help me make good purchases; I hope this review helped you, as well.

I have bought several of these in the past, and have just bought a few more. They are very handy to have around the house and make great gifts. I have given them to all the appreciated contractors & mechanics in my life and they love them! I keep one hanging on my bedpost, for occassional night reading, as well as to have a pretty handy light at night (just cause it has a strap doesnt mean you can't also carry it, every so often!). They're perfect for those "what's that noise?" or, "where'd i put my..." moments. Also, for carrying things/laundry into a dark basement, or for older kids running around at night. They are also great for camping (especially when setting up camp in the dark or using a porta-pot: look ma! no hands!). They are super for crafters/sewing folk, to give a bright spot of light right where you need it.I also toss one in my suitcase when I travel. Better to have a flashlight with a headstrap, in case I need one, than to not.I have purchased two other models, and, while they do have their "pros", I like this one the best, as it is overall better.I have made one modification, a small piece of black electrical tape placed on the clear underbelly of the lens helps reduce light backflow when I need to tilt it down. Easy-peasy!Are there better ones for industrial (heavy duty) or backpacking (light weight) use? Surely. However, for $15-20, this is still a handy item, well worth the cost. For many of my gift-recipients, it turns out to be one of those "I never would have thought I needed this, but I use it all the time" items.PS: I use sanyo eneloop rechargeable batteries to power it; saves $, eco-better, & also highly recommended.I rely on Amazon reviews to help me make informed buying decisions; I hope this review helped you with your purchase research.

Bought to use in a Maytag Mgde500 dryer (performance series).It was easy to put together (what you see in the pic is 2 separate pieces). And, although I apparently had chosen the correct "holes" for the bracket the first time, I also tried a different set, just in case.Once assembled, it simply sits in your dryer, with the wire bracket in the back and the plastic tray resting on the front/lint screen area.The dryer can then spin "around" it, while the rack remains stationary. My old dryer, a Maytag Ensignia (super awesome, but not stackable) had one, and since I had bought it used, the previous owner showed me how it worked. That previous knowledge was helpful in using this new one for the first time.This new rack fits less snugly, and the front part does not rest evenly in its place. Maybe if I put something really heavy across it and dried it at a high heat for a long tine, it might sit better. Regardless, it works with my machine, as is, and I'm happy to have a drying rack once again.PS - as this can be used for more than sweaters, the rack turns the dryer into a much more useful appliance! Consider using it to more quickly dry delicates, shoes, camping gear, tools, toys, art supplies, things with nooks and crannies/small parts that are difficult to get to with a towel, things that can't be tumbled, etc. I'm considering trying to dehydrate food in there at some point... Of course, the usual warnings apply: no oil or flammables, etc.NB: for several reasons, we have never used fabric softener liquid or dryer sheets with our new dryer. If we did, I would not consider putting food in there. Our clothes are still soft and without static.Happy Drying!I rely on amazon reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this review helped you in the same manner. :)

I like that this has better ingredients than other protein powders (no artificial sweeteners, no solvents - google hexane and isolate for info, no radiation, and vegan). I do not like the heavy stevia taste. I know that part is subjective, but if you are at all sensitive to the taste of stevia (as me and my fiancée are), you may have a difficult time with the taste of this flavor.I called Sun Warrior and asked about a non-stevia product (among other questions) and they were very helpful (& friendly!) steering me in the direction of the Natural flavor, which has ONLY the protein powders & MCT. As we await the package of Natural in the mail, we'll use bananas and peanut butter to help cover the taste of the stevia in the Chocolate.N.B.: My mom (who doesn't mind stevia) finds this to taste amazing and will be the happy recipient of our remaining chocolate powder.I do wish this also had Brown Rice Protein, and that the ingredients were organic, but, as it is now, the ingredients and the "Cold Extrusion process" which is "free of solvents, GMOs, radiation, artifical colors, & preservatives", along with superior mixability, help make this protein powder my top contender among all others.I rely on Amazon to help me make informed buying choices. I hope this review helped you in the same manner :)

If you have a house with indoor plumbing, these can save you money and frustration. They did for me!We have 5 sinks, 3 toilets, 2 showers, an ice-maker line in our fridge, a dryer that needs water, plus the washing machine and the water heater. That's 14 opportunities for damage. I personally know of 6 households who have suffered damage from a flood that began inside the house. That's enough for me to want to find ways protect my home. These little devices help put my mind at ease.I recently had some plumbing work done (6 months ago). I placed one of these devices in the area where the work was, in case there was a leak.Today, after sitting silently for months, the little guy let out a scream (it beeps SOS in Morse Code). Apparently, one of the connections was allowing water to drip on the floor, and it had, by that point, created a 6" wide puddle on the floor. It was under a sink, behind a trash can and a cabinet. Had the alarm not gone off, I would have not seen the leak until it was much farther out and caused damage. But today, I just turned off the water at the shut-off, and a single microfiber washcloth wiped up the little bit that had dripped. Easy-peasy.I HIGHLY recommend these. I tested each of mine when they arrived and have not experienced any false positives since I set them up (18 months ago). I have found them to be very loud and effective. For the price, I think it's smart to have one strategically placed at each point of water in your home. At the current price of ~$25/3, that's just over $8 each. Considering the cost and frustration of the aftermath of a flood (even a small one), early detection by one of these little guys could prove to be a huge savings.These make great gifts, too! Especially for housewarming, "Relative's" Day, or a practical-minded loved-one. Don't let the 1-star reviews make you look elsewhere. It seems as if most of them are about volume and are at least a few years old. I believe the manufacturer made some changes, as mine (and according to other reviews, others') are plenty loud.Side note: I purchased rechargeable 9V batteries (Tenergy LSD) and a 9v charger (Tenergy V-9688), to use with these and other detectors in the house. Both available on Amazon.I rely on Amazon reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope this helped you in the same manner.

He's the cook in the house (I buy the gadgets and write the reviews). While I have purchased many helpful gadgets, this one is his favorite.We've owned it for just over a year and he uses it several times per week. He makes soups in the pot, smoothies in the glass, sauces in the bowl, and clean-up is in the bag! Well, just a few drops of Eco-friendly dishsoap and whirr it around with some water in a container gets the bulk of the mess off!The blades are very sharp, and although there aren't myriad settings, it seems to always blend at just the right speed.The kicker? He likes it better than our $400 BlendTec blender.Yep. He also refuses to use a hand mixer, preferring a wooden spoon, instead. But he loves his smartstick so much that it goes on vacation with us!In our opinion, every kitchen should have a hand blender. They are easy to use, easy to store, and easy to clean. Being portable is also a bonus! From our experience, this particular one is especially good and, therefore, we highly recommend it!I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions. I hope my review helped you, too!

Three reasons my guy likes these better than any other spong he's tried: (in our house, he does the dishes & I write the reviews)1. The scrubby part is scrubby enough that it gets gunk off dishes but not so sctratchy that it damages finishes (we've had other scrubby sponges that have ruined the finish of our flatware). Either way, proceed with caution, just in case.2. The spongey part (even though it's like velvety-soft) is more durable than other sponges, in that it lasts longer when washing dishes and it holds up better to "sanitizing" (we prefer the microwave method).3. They're better for the planet! (and, we like that they're tan, too!)So, if these sponges cost a few cents more than others, we believe they are worth it, since they are gentler on finishes (while still being effective), eco-friendly, and they hold up better.With 'subscribe & save' and the coupon that's avail now, they are even a better deal!Hope that helps in your sponge-buying process!

These socks are quite nice, they are well made, comfortable, and wash well.The socks come in a small box and are neatly rolled up.  They come in three different colors; navy, brown, and black.  The fabric is thick and soft, and the seams and finish are well done.My husband who wears a size 13 has been using these socks.  He's found them to fit well and be comfortable.  They come up about an inch above the ankle and do not slide down.They have been washed in our front load washer with cold water without bleach, and dried on low heat. They came out fine, didn't shrink and didn't pill.All in all... nicely done dress socks.(Sample provided for review)

Vichy's sunscreen is a light and pleasant sunscreen.  It looks and feels just like any other sunscreen, an off-white creamy lotion, but the Vichy does not have a strong odor and absorbs quickly, without a greasy residue.  The slight fragrance that the Vichy does have smells pleasant, and is barely noticeable.  In fact the Vichy reminds me more of a facial moisturizer with SPF 15 sunscreen that a straight-up SPF 60 sunscreen.  With that said, I won't be slathering the Vichy on my face daily, since it is not intended to be a daily moisturizer.  Rather I've been using it on my forearms and neck when I'm working in the yard, or spending a lot of time outdoors.  It's kept me protected for hours, and I haven't noticed any skin issues or irritation when using the Vichy.All in all... a pleasant alternative to typical smelly and sticky sunscreens.

Invicta's stainless steel watch is quite the timepiece.  It's well made and attractive, but it is substantial.The Invicta is made nicely from stainless steel.  Everything is well assembled and it feels substantial in the hand.  That's because it is substantial, at 6.20oz in weight and 1.75" across the face.  This is a big watch, and it will attract attention.  Yet, since the color and style is restrained, it does not appear garish.Not only is the face huge, but also the band.  That will be a god send for people with large wrists, but if your wrist is small you will need to have lots of links taken out.  At 5'7" and 135 pounds I was able to slip the watch on without even unclasping it.  Thankfully the watch is easy to size at a jeweler and there is some adjustability in the clasp if your wrist falls between sizes as you remove links.  With all of that said, the Invicta is not uncomfortable to wear and does not feel like a burden.The face's design is simple, but elegant, and work well for both casual and dressy events.  There are three chronograph dials and a date window within the face.  Despite the complexity the watch is easy to read with large markings and big hands.  The hands and hour markers also glow in the dark.  The buttons to control the chronographs are on the side, along with the crown.  The crown is stiff and hard to pull out, however.  Perhaps it will get better in time.The Invicta is rated at 100M water resistant, and while I will never go that deep, based on my experiences with other Invicta watches in pools and the ocean, it should be fine.  It has also kept perfect time.The included box and case are both well done and make a nice presentation, but the case smells strongly of the cheap plastics that it is made from.All in all... a big, beautiful watch.

DII's heavyweight dishclothes are nicely made and colorful, but they are tiny.The dishclothes are quite nice is appearance.  They feature a subtle woven pattern that uses different purples.  The overall look is that of a deep purple, and I would consider their description of the color as "eggplant" to be quite accurate.They are also very nicely made.  The stitching is well finished and there were no loose threads.  They are made of a heavy fabric that absorbs water well and doesn't leave fibers behind.Please note that they are 12" x 12", so unlike most dishtowels that are long and rectangular, these "dishclothes" are closer in size and shape to a dinner napkin.I washed them in my front load washer on a regular cycle (they recommend the gentle cycle, but I don't want to have to do a special load just for these) and dried them on low heat.  They came out perfectly and did not shrink much.All in all... pretty purple towels that are pretty petite.

Solid Gold's Sunday Sunrise food is a hit with both my Wheaton Terrier and Italian Greyhound.The Sunday Sunrise food consists of small flat pellets. They are about the size of a dime. All of the pellets are hard, there are no soft or chewy pieces.My 12 year old Italian Grayhound and 6 year old Wheaton Terrier both love this food. Now admittedly my Terrier will eat anything, but the Grayhound is very picky and even she likes Sunday Sunrise.  The one negative is that the pellets are a bit large for her and since her teeth aren't what they used to be, she can sometimes have trouble chewing it.They have had no issues with the frequency or consistsncy of their stools, and neither of them has had any grumbly tummies.All in all... great dog food.

Dan Cruikshank's book A History of Architecture in 100 Buildings is a wonderful piece.  It's well written, interesting, and contains fabulous photographs.The books breaks up the 100 buildings by grouping them in the following categories; Pioneers, Rhetoric, Sacred, Urban Visions, Big and Beautiful, Material Matters, and Lost and Found.  Each group contains a short entry for each structure.  The entries are usually no more than 2 pages long, and describe who built the structure, what it was used for, how it was built, and the materials used to build it.  It's all very straightforward and easy to read, but it's also quite interesting.  Making up the list of building are some expected suspects; The Great Pyramid, The Flatiron Building, The Taj Mahal, etc.  Also, however, are buildings you've probably never heard of before, at least I didn't!  The author chooses structures from all time periods and places.  This isn't a book you would necessarily read from cover to cover, and I found it more interesting to pick and choose entries based on what caught my eye as I thumbed through.The photographs that accompany each entry are well chosen and beautiful.  Each entry has at least two photographs accompanying it.  Some of them are small, while other spread over two pages.The book itself is also quite nicely made and printed.  It's a hefty volume, that feels great in the hand, and looks wonderful on a coffee table.All in all... beautiful buildings in a beautiful book.

Lenox's holiday train salt and pepper shakers are well made, nicely detailed, and a decent size.The shakers are made from your typical Lenox ceramic.  It's a nice ivory white.  They are well done, and do not feel particularly fragile.  There is a combination of hand painted sections and appliqués.  The hand painted parts are done in red, green, grey, and a metallic gold.  The designs are nicely finished, and fanciful.Unlike some holiday salt and pepper shakers these Lenox pieces are a not miniscule.  They won't get lost on the dinner table, and guests will notice them.  They are about 3.5" long, 2" inches deep, and 3" tall.You fill them from the bottom, by pulling out a rubber plug.  Since the pieces are so large they will hold a lot of salt and pepper.  The engine releases its contents from the top of the steam stack, through one hole.  While the coal tender releases its contents from the top of the Christmas tree, through two holes.  They are not specifically labeled as salt / pepper so feel free to use them as you please.All in all... cheery Christmas table decorations.

Solid Gold's Lil' Boss food is a hit with my dogs.The Solid Gold consists of small dry pellets.  They are quite petite, and shaped about the size of peas.  I have a 12 pound Italian Greyhound (who is 12 years old) and a 25 pound Wheaton Terrier (who is 7 years old).  Both of them love this food.  Admittedly the Wheaten will eat anything, but the Greyhound is very picky and she loved this food right off the bat.They have been eating it solely for a few days and I have noticed no issues or problems.  There are no grumbly tummies or diarrhea.  Their poops, however, are lighter in color, and they also smell a bit more pungent.  Still, that's the only change I've noticed.All in all... they love it!

Who doesn't know and love Reese's peanut butter cups, Hershey's chocolate bars, KitKats, and Almond Joys?  Well now you can have all of those tasty treats in a cardboard box with a drop down door.The treats you'll find inside are similar to what you would find in a Halloween bag of candy.  The KitKats are 2 full sticks, the Reeses are 1 regular sized cup, the Almond Joys are snack size, as are the Hershey bars.  Unfortunately the mix is random from box to box, so there's no telling how many of each you will get.The box is very sturdy and all of the treats were undamaged.  They were fresh, and none of the chocolate had a waxy white coating on it.The little individually wrapped treats are great for lunches, snacks, or maybe even Halloween.All in all... candies in a box.

Medieval LEGO is a great way to learn about important events and people from the Middle Ages.  The book covers the years 1028-1485.  There are many important people (eg: Robin Hood, William Wallace, etc.) and events (eg: Treaty of York, The Black Death, etc.).  Each entry is only a couple of pages long at most and the typeface is quite large.  There are great LEGO model photos to go along with each event, which are detailed and well done.The way this book is designed makes learning about the Middle Ages both fun and simple.  It's much easier to learn when it's presented in such an enjoyable manner.  While the book is definitely aimed at younger readers, I enjoyed it as well as an adult.Physically the book is about 7" square, which makes it easy for little hands to handle.All in all... a great concept.

Okidokeys Smart-Lock is a nifty device, and has real potential, but some of its features just don't work reliably.The Okidokeys is very easy to install.  You simply remove the back of your deadbolt (the non-keyed side) and install the Okidokeys in its place, the front of the lock remains the same and operates as it always did with the same key.  The whole process is very straightforward and took me about 20 minutes.  Unfortunately, two necessary pieces were missing from my box.  I called Okidokeys and they sent out replacement parts and had them to me in two days.  They were very nice and easy to work with.Once the Okidokeys is installed you'll need to create an account on their website, download the app to your phone (Android or iOS), and sync the lock with you phone.  This process wasn't that complicated, and took me about 15 minutes, but the website and app are both very rudimentary looking, and not very user friendly.  They can both use some polish.The lock itself is quite large.  Size-wise, it reminds me of the boxes real estate agents hang off of your front door.  With that in mind you'll want to make sure that your door doesn't have any trim pieces or windows very close to the deadbolt, as it could make installing the Okidokeys impossible.The Okidokeys comes with three covers, brushed silver, brushed brass, and shiny brass.  I used the shiny brass cover to match my other hardware.  The covers, and a great deal of the lock itself are made of plastic.  This is unfortunate, as it makes the lock feel cheaply made.  Moreover, when the lock is operating it's very loud and sounds like a child's toy.  Appearance-wise it's sleek and will work well with most decors.In use the Okidokeys is a mixed bag.  Firstly, you'll have to be within your phone's bluetooth range to use it.  That's not a problem, but unlike a Nest thermostat (which runs off of Wi-Fi), you can't access the Okidokeys from afar.  Thankfully the lock always responded to the app and unlocked and locked the door without issue.  From opening the app, to having the door unlocked or locked, it took about 10 seconds total.  Your total time will probably vary depending on your phone set-up.  When you're inside the house you can use the button on the Okidokeys itself to operate the lock as well.One feature I had about a 75% success rate with was the hands free unlocking.  In theory you tell the Okidokeys the location of your house on a map, and when you get within a certain radius your phone will start trying to communicate with the Okidokeys to unlock it for you without having to reach for your phone.  Unfortunately, as I mentioned before, sometimes it just didn't work.  Just remember, you have to have the Okidokeys app running in the background for hands free to work, and I found that when I increased increase the search radius I had better results.Some other features of the Okidokeys is automatic re-locking, but to use that you'll have to attach a small sensor to your door frame and inside the lock.  I did not try this feature, as I figured it would lead to trouble, and I'd probably lock myself out unintentionally (if anyone is good at that, it's me!).  One feature I really liked was the ability to receive notification on your phone of when the door is locked / unlocked and by whom.FYI: I have a Kwikset deadbolt and an iPhone 5s running OS 8.4.1.All in all... it's convenient, but I wish it was more consistant.

Manhattan Toy's Deer Play Mat is a wonderful little play mat with an adorable design and high quality materials.The play mat is nicely made from a variety of different fabrics, but all of the fabrics are high-quality and the mat is nicely stitched and finished.  There are no loose threads, bunched fabric, or sloppy seams.  The pay mat comes very nicely presented.  It is folded and bound with a white fabric ribbon.The mat is basically round (it has a few small appendages), and about 2.5 feet in diameter.  It's a decent size and not only gives a baby plenty of space to lay about but also can be used as a small blanket.The design of the mat is quite adorable.  In person in looks exactly like the photo, a sleeping deer.  The color scheme is definitely aimed towards girls, with a mixture of light pinks, whites, and blacks.There are lots of different fabrics and textures throughout the mat.  There are soft fleece parts, fuzzy parts, satin parts, corduroy parts, and a bed-sheet type part.  Besides all of the different textures there are also some sections that are filled with crinkle materials, for some audible and tactile fun.  The bottom of the mat is done in one single piece of soft fleece fabric.All in all... a wonderful little mat.09/25/2015 Update: I've washed it a couple of times on the gentle cycle in my front loading washer and on low heat in my dryer and it came out perfectly.

Glasstic's water bottle is nicely made, works well, and people notice it and like it.The Glasstic consists of four pieces.  There is the flip-top cap, the screw-on base, the plastic outer shell, and the glass inner shell.  There are also a few silicone o-rings to complete the necessary seals.  Basically the glass inner shell slips into the plastic outer shell.  The bottle will come completely assembled, but it's easy to take apart and clean as necessary.  The bottle feels high quality and nice in the hand.In use the Glasstic is a great water bottle.  It holds 16 oz. of liquid and since there is bit of a vacuum created by the two chambers the bottle doesn't sweat (only a little bit of water condenses inside the two chambers) and beverages stay cold or hot for longer periods of time.  It's not a true vacuum, mind you, but it's better than a single-walled bottle.  The lid opens easily and swings back 270 so it will be completely out of your way.  The opening is not huge, but I had no trouble drinking out of it, and there's plenty of room for a straw.  The lid locks closed as well, but on my bottle the lock / unlock indictors were mixed up.  So when the bottle was locked, it showed as unlocked, and vice versa.  When everything is sealed and locked the bottle doesn't leak at all.  On the back of the lid is a sturdy handle to carry the Glasstic.Cleaning the Glassic will necessitate a bottle brush.  The opening for the glass insert is simply too small to get a hand down inside of.  Alternatively, you can place the whole thing in your dishwasher.  Glasstic recommends hand washing the silicone seals, however.  I ran the whole thing though my dishwasher, and it came out great.All in all... a great idea, and it works great!

AXE's Phoenix deodorant works well for me and has a nice scent.The deodorant comes packaged in your standard variety container, with a twist bottom and a pop-off cap.The AXE has a very masculine scent.  It smells clean, and kind of soapy.  It also has a hint of pine to it.  Overall, it smells like you think a man would smell, if that makes sense.I wore the AXE for two very active days.  One day I lifted weights at the gym, spent some time at the office, and worked as a kitchen assistant.  The next day I cleaned the house and mowed the lawn.  Therefore, on both days I was fairly active.  I was never sweating profusely, but I certainly did work up a sheen.  At the end of both days the deodorant worked well.  Unless you got very close to me you didn't smell any body odor at all.  Overall, I don't sweat easily, so your milage may vary.All in all... great deodorant.

These sterling silver cubic zirconia butterfly earrings are nicely made, beautiful, and a great value.The earrings feel high quality in the hand.  The stones are securely set and the sterling silver is a heavy weight, and does not feel flimsy.  The cubic zirconias have great sparkle and are beautifully cut.  The butterfly clasps on the back hold securely to the post.  The earnings come in a very nice black box, which is perfect for gift giving.The earrings are simple and understated, but also quite beautiful.  They would look equally at home on a teenage girl or a more mature woman.  Moreover, they are simple and understated enough to be worn while running errands, but also just glitzy enough to wear to an upscale restaurant.  The butterfly design is playful without being too cutsie.They are quite petite, about the size of an M&M, so lots of different body types can feel comfortable wearing them, and they are very light in weight.All in all... really nice earrings.

Yellowknife's Lightning cables are well-made, come in fun colors, and have a unique flat design.The Yellowknife cable is made of a thick and pliable plastic.  Instead of a traditional round cable, the Yellowknife is done in a flat design.  It looks and feels like a heavy-duty rubber band without the ability to stretch.  It does, however, share a rubber band's ability to easily flex into manny different shapes.  Construction quality is definitely a step-up from Apple's standard cable and should take a beating before it breaks down.  The cable cames in a small zip-lock bag and includes a small microfiber wipe.The cable worked well on many different chargers and in my MacBook Air.  It had no problems connecting to my iPhone 5s and charged it quickly and without issue.All in all... a great cable with a unique design.(Sample Provided)

Shacke's luggage tags are pretty much the best luggage tags you'll ever use.These tags are bright and fun in appearance, and will make your luggage stand out while it's rotating on the carousel.  The pattern is a fun geometric design, and while both tags have the same pattern they do have a different color scheme.Not only do they stand out appearance-wise, but also in build quality.  The tags themselves are made of thick and pliable rubber.  They remind me of the bottom of a sneaker.  They are also quite thick and would take considerable effort to tear.  Additionally, the well-finished leather straps make sure the tags stay securely attached to your luggage.All in all... while luggage tags might seem somewhat of an unimportant purchase, when one gets ripped off of your luggage they won't seem so insignifigant, so get the best tags you can!

Hershey's S'mores kit is a great idea, and makes tasty S'mores effortlessly.The S'mores kit consists of a large box, which has a bag of marshmallows, 4 packs of honey graham crackers, and 18 full-size Hershey chocolate bars inside.  The marshmallows and graham crackers are unbranded.  The marshmallows and graham crackers are very tasty though, so they don't feel like a "cut-rate store brand", or anything.  Additionally, everything inside the box was undamaged, and very fresh tasting.I've been making the S'mores in my microwave.  I have a 1300 watt microwave.  The box says to place the graham cracker, half a chocolate bar, and the marshmallow in the microwave at 50% power for 10 to 15 seconds and then place the other graham cracker on top.  That works out fine, but I like to melt chocolate a bit first and then place the marshmallow on top for a few seconds after that.  I feel the chocolate needs more time to soften up before the marshmallow goes in.  You can make them over a fire, or in a grill, but I prefer the ease of the microwave (and I'm making them as a snack at work!).All in all... easy, tasty treats!

Tresemme's Perfectly Undone conditioner is a great, high-quality conditioner.  It's very thick and coats my hair evenly and smoothly.  I typically use Pantene conditioners, but this Tresemme is even thicker than Pantene's.  It really feel luxurious and pampering for your hair.It smells really nice as well.  A little sweet, a little fruity, and leaves my hair smelling great.  It's not a feminine or masculine scent so it's great for everyone.It rinses cleanly and easily and leaves my hair easy to control and frizz and fly-away free.  I even put a little in my damp hair to aid in styling it.Now as far as it making my hair look perfectly un-done... I'm not so sure.  It seems to behave like every other conditioner I've ever used.  If pushed, I'd say it leaves my hair a touch more matte in appearance than the Pantene conditioner.It comes in a large push top bottle, which is fine, but for such a large bottle I would have preferred a pump.All in all... great conditioner.

Honeywell's Quiet Set Personal Table fan is compact, works well, and is nicely made.The Honeywell comes completely assembled out of the box and is nicely assembled.  It's made entirely of plastics but they are high quality, feel good in the hand, and look good in your room.  The controls on the front are also nicely done, with good feel.  Included with the fan is a detachable plug.  The fan runs on DC power, which basically means that unlike a normal thin plug this has a power brick.  It's not very big and it seems to be pretty efficient as it doesn't get hot to the touch.  Indeed, Honeywell boasts that this fan uses up to 50% less power because it runs on DC.  It's a shame they didn't offer the option of battery power as well.The fan is very simple to use.  There are 4 buttons on the front; a power button, a fan speed button, an oscillation button (which has a 90º sweep), and a timer button.  The timer offers options of 2, 4, and 8 hours before shutting down, and there are 4 fan speeds.  Instead of listing the speeds as low, medium, high, etc., they are described as Sleep, White Noise, Refresh, and Power Cool.  There is a blue light to indicate which speed you are on.  A really thoughtful feature is that the light for the Sleep speed is much dimmer than the rest, making it great for a dark bedroom environment.  Another nice touch is that when you change a setting the oscillation pauses for a second so the fan doesn't try to keep rotating while you're pressing buttons.This is a small fan with a big grill, but looks can be deceiving.  Unlike some other tower fans that a have turbine-like vertical fan system, this Honeywell has a small circular fan inside of the large grill.  The fan itself is about 3.5" inches in diameter, taking up only about half of the grill opening.  With all of this information in mind, you should know that this is a fan for small spaces and modest needs.  Even on Power Cool, you're not going to feel much air movement if you're more than a few feet away.  Ideally this will work well in a bedroom as a supplement for an air conditioner, on a desk, or just for some white noise while you sleep.Speaking of noise, even on its highest setting it is not very loud and the Sleep setting is the perfect volume to do just that... sleep.One thing I don't like is that you cannot take off the grill to clean the fan's blades.All in all... more of a breeze than a gust of wind.

OXO's salad dressing shaker is nicely made, works well, and cleans up well.The dispenser consists of two pieces, the top and the bottom.  They screw apart by the black rubber grip that runs around the top of the base.  The whole dispenser is made of plastic, but the plastics are high quality and feel great in the hand.I make my dressings in my food processor, but I use the OXO to store it, shake it up, and pour it.  It works well for those purposes, but some of the dressing having chopped nuts and scallions in them and the pouring spout on the top can be a little constrictive causing the dressing to pour out at a trickle.  I've solved that problem by chopping my ingredients more finely, but I still find the opening to be a bit smaller than I'd like for any creamy dressings.  Creamy dressing need a slow and deliberate pour to keep them from spilling over the top of the spout's stopper as well.Speaking of the stopper, opening the OXO to pour out dressing couldn't be simpler.  You just tip back the silicon-lined stopper.  The stopper seals tightly and no dressing escapes while shaking the OXO.I've washed the OXO many times in my dishwasher without problem.All in all... another great OXO product.

Oahu's drawer pulls are stylish, nicely constructed, and well packaged.The drawer pulls are boxed up very well.  Inside the main box you'll find 10 smaller boxes each containing a pull and a screw.  Additionally, each of the crystal ends are wrapped in protective plastic.  Because of the excellent packaging, all of the pulls arrived in perfect condition.I used the drawer pulls on an old five drawer dresser.  I simply unscrewed the old pulls and placed the new ones on.  The front of the dresser drawers are about 1" thick. The included screws were the perfect length and they held securely.Once the pulls were installed they looked very nice.  The crystal ends are perfectly clear, and the facets are nicely cut.  They give off a nice sparkle.  The chrome part that the crystals attach too is also nicely done.  They have a smooth and shiny chrome finish.The pulls are very modest in size, at 1.5" in diameter and 1.5" deep so they would well on both furniture and kitchen cabinets.All in all... a wonderful set of pulls at a wonderful price.

The SOFI zipper tote is a great little storage solution.  It's well made, nice looking, and works well.The SOFI is made of a mixture of a linen-like fabric on the outside and a square pattern on the inside.  The outside fabric has a nice sheen to it and looks high quality.  The outside fabric is goodish-brown in color, while the interior is done in a light blueish-lilac color.  The small canvas handle and large zippers are also nicely made and the SOFI feels sturdy in the hand.The SOFI consists of two pieces, there is the box itself and the reinforced base.  Without the base in place the walls of the box collapse down and the SOFI folds flat for easy storage.  One downside, however, is that the base does not fit inside the folded SOFI so out have to make sure to keep the two pieces together or you'll be stuck with a SOFI that will collapse down on itself.  Once the base is in place the SOFI is very sturdy and easy to move around.I've been using the SOFI in my hallway closet and have filled it with scarves, mittens, and earmuffs.  It's perfect to place on a high shelf because you don't have to bring it down to remove an item, you only need to unzip the front.  The zippers are large and smooth in action, with no snagging.  If, however, you want to get the whole box down, it's easy to do so with the large handle on the front.All in all... a stylish storage box.

Pantene's Daily Moisture Renewal Hydrating Shampoo is a wonderful shampoo.  I've been using it for a couple of weeks now and I really like it.It has a nice thick consistency and lathers up well.  You don't need to use much, as a little goes a long way.  The fragrance is very nice.  It has a subtly sweet and fruity scent and it works well for both sexes.  This Pantene leaves my hair feeling soft and looking shiny, while cutting down a bit on frizz.FYI: I have thick wavy hair that is about 6" long.All in all... smells great and works great.

The GreenWorks Twin Force lawn mower, is powerful, quiet, and works really well.The GreenWorks mower is very nicely made.  It’s constructed primarily of plastic, but it feels very robust and well screwed together.  All of the components feel of high quality in the hand.  Assembling the GreenWorks is easy; you just take it out of the box and attach the handle.  The process involves no tools and takes only minutes.It’s an amazingly simple lawnmower to use.  Once the batteries are charged you pop them into the two slots on the top of the mower.  Then set the cut height using the sliding lever on the top – no need to set each wheel individually!  Lastly, press the button on the handle and pull back on the safety bar.  Once that’s done… boom… the GreenWorks comes to life.In use the GreenWorks is a revelation, especially if you’ve only used gasoline mowers.  All of my previous mower experience was with manual-push gas-powered Craftsman mowers.  They were powerful, but they were also heavy and loud.  The GreenWorks packs all of the power of those machines, but it’s very light, easy to maneuver, and so quiet.  My neighbor also has a cordless electric mower (an older Black & Decker) and even he commented on how quiet the GreenWorks is.  It sounds no louder than a powerful fan on low speed, and even high speed is very subdued.  Lastly, it’s such a joy to not have to get and store gas.Moving performance was quite good.  First about my lawn, I have a .30 acre lawn that is basically flat and has a few patchy/bald spots underneath large trees.  I never let my lawn get too long and mow it every weekend.  In my case, 99% of the time the GreenWorks operates on its low speed, but when it hits a thick patch of lawn, or some twigs, it ramps up to high speed.  It does this only until it clears the obstacle, and then lowers down again instantly.  The switch between high and low speeds is automatic and not user controlled.  I found my lawn to be cut very evenly and I did not have to do multiple passes to get an effective cut.  I used the GreenWorks’ mulching feature and the clippings that were left behind were small and inconspicuous.  I have yet to use the included bag, and have no plans to.Battery life is quite good.  I’m able to mow my whole yard without having to stop and recharge.  Once one battery dies the second battery automatically kicks in.  One thing to bear in mind is that the GreenWorks will always draw power from the battery on the left hand side compartment first, and then switch to the other.  I find it best to place the small battery on the left.  This way after the small battery dies, and the GreenWorks switches to the large battery, I can pop the small battery in the charger just in case I need some extra juice.  The charger is quite quick and even just a half hour of charging will yield a decent amount of run time.  Thoughtfully both batteries have external charge indicator lights.If you’re using the mulching feature, you’ll want to remove the mulching plug in the back of the mower after each use, as it gets quite full of grass clippings.  Be prepared for a bit of a mess when you remove it.  I also like to clean the underside and body of the mower with a brush to keep everything clean.  I store the GreenWorks in my one car garage.  It fits between the wall and my car, and I fold down the handle to make it as compact as possible.All in all… a great mover, that’s also tremendously convenient.

Mudder's tongs are really well made and feel sturdy.  The weight of the stainless steel used in the construction is impressive.  The arms of these tongs don't bend or twist when in use.  The silicone tips are nicely made and attached, and have scalloped edges.  The one quality flaw was that the silicone grips on the sides of the tongs were not securely fastened.  I had the push them into place.  It was easy to do, but still.I've used lots of tongs at my part time job as a kitchen assistant, and I much prefer tongs that don't have silicon tips, because they handle direct heat and large firm items better.  I find that the tips of silicon tongs flex a bit too much when lifting heavy bulky objects.  For instance when removing ramekins from a water bath the silicone tips of these tongs do not get as strong of a grip as medal tipped tongs.  Still, they work great for most other kitchen tasks like moving chicken breasts around, mixing salads, and pulling soft items out of boiling water.  The grippy tips also make them great to grab items off a high shelf!The tongs clean up well in my dishwasher.All in all... they won't perform every kitchen task perfectly, but work well for most.(sample provided)

Kurtzy's shell pearl stud earrings make a great gift for young girls, or women who want something elegant to wear while running day-to-day errands.The earnings come in a small silver gift box with a bow.  It's a nice presentation, but my box had lots of extra dried up glue on it.The earnings themselves are quite nice looking, and come in a variety of shades to compliment almost any outfit.  The colors are all subtle and neutral, so you won't have to worry about the earrings standing out and calling attention to themselves.  The overall construction quality is high and they feel well made in the hand.On closer inspection, however, you'll find that not all of the "pearls" are round or the same size and there are some slight finish issues with some darker spots.  While regular pearls have many of the same issues, for some reason with these earrings it looked artificial.  With that said, unless you're looking at them up close, they look great overall.They are small and light.  They are about the size of a large pea, and my 5'0" petite mother found them to be the perfect size for her.  She also had no issues with the clasps coming loose or an allergic reaction.All in all... subtle, elegant, and a great value.

How can you complain about almond extract, especially from McCormick.  I've never had any issues with McCormick's seasonings and extracts, and this almond extract is no different.The extract comes in a sturdy plastic bottle with a flip top lid that has a small spout.  You can also remove the screw-on top when you need a larger pour.I used the extract in a white cake recipe and the cake came out perfectly.  As expected, the almond extract smells and tastes sweet and slightly nutty.  Almond extract is great for recipes where you want the overall result that vanilla extract will give you, but not the coloring, and since almond extract is clear, it works perfectly.The bottle I received has an expiration date of November 2018, and it arrived undamaged.All in all... you can't go wrong with McCormick.

Contigo's Party Cup is a great idea.  It keeps beverages cold, and doesn't sweat.The cup is made from a combination of red and regular stainless steel.  To make the cup more comfortable, there is also a smooth plastic ring that runs around the top edge.  Construction quality is very high and the Contigo feels great in the hand.  Keep in mind that it's 16oz, so it's not a small cup.The Contigo works as advertised.  It keeps my chilled beverages cold and doesn't sweat at all.  I used it on a hot day (~85º) and the ice in the Contigo lasted a lot longer than that in a regular glass.  Additionally, while the regular glass was sweating quite a bit, the Contigo was completely dry.  No need for coasters when using the Contigo.On the bottom it says to hand wash the body, which I assume means the whole cup.  I hand washed it and it came out great, but I also ran it through the top rack on my dishwasher a couple of times and had absolutely no issues (you milage will vary).The Contigo gives your beverages absolutely no metallic aftertaste.All in all... the evolution of the cup!

I have a 25 pound Wheaton Terrier and a 12 pound Italian Greyhound.  The Wheaton is a very active 6 year old with a steel stomach and the Greyhound is a sleepy 12 year old with a sensitive stomach, but both of them loved this food, and neither of them had any issues with loose stool or flatulence.The TruFood has a very soft consistency and smells and feels pleasant.  The little plastic bowl in comes in is perfect for feeding out of.All in all... the dogs approve!

SO & CO's stainless watch looks great and works well, but the details belie the upscale look they are going for.The SO & CO makes a great first impression. The stainless is shiny and well finished, and the watch face is clean and tasteful. Looking at the SO & CO more closely, however, is not so great. Two things stood out, the rotating bezel around the watch face is very loose and wobbly feeling, and the small magnifying glass over the date window is just glued onto the watch face instead of being an integral part of the crystal. Still, the SO & CO feels well made in the hand.The SO & CO has a modest sized face and band. I am a 5'7" male weighing about 135 pounds and I found the scale of the watch to be perfect for me. The band was much bigger then ideal, but that's to be expected. There is some adjusting you can do without taking links out (by pushing the band further back into the clasp), but I needed links taken out to get a proper fit. Additionally, when you adjust the band by pushing it all the way back into the clasp, the clasp does not lay flat anymore.The watch is quite heavy and bulky. Don't expect to forget you're wearing it.Looks wise the SO & CO is quite stylish. Everyone who saw it liked the look. The face is simple and understated, but also modern and stylish.The large white markings on the black watch face are easy to read at a glance, and during the two weeks that I tested it the time was accurate.The watch is 100 meters water resistant, has a screw down crown and a locking clasp.All in all... nice looking and nicely made, but they didn't sweat the details, more like 3.5 stars overall.

K-ble's Lightning cable is great for people who need a seriously strong cable.  The K-ble is well made from end to end.  The USB and Lightning connections are done in a combination of dense plastic and aluminum, while the cable itself is wrapped in woven fabric.  The K-ble feels great in the hand, and is obviously well made.The cable charged my iPhone 5 and 5s great with no issues or concerns.All in all... a great cable.(sample provided for review)

Life Sky's insulated beverage bottle is well made, works well, and is durable.The Life Sky is very nicely done in stainless steel and plastic.  The metal and plastic are both high quality, assembled well, and feel great in the hand.  I have the champagne color and it's really quite attractive.  I get lots of compliments on it.The bottle is very easy to use.  By pushing the large silver button on the front you release the top, which pops open.  You can lock the button when you want to make sure the top doesn't accidentally pop open.  It flip open top works flawlessly about 99% of the time, but does get stuck on occasion.  Additionally after opening and closing the lid a lot the pin that secures the rear hinge in place starts to push its way out.  It's very easy to push back into place, but it was something I had to keep an eye on.Drinking from the bottle is very comfortable and straightforward.  Liquids come out easily, and the spout fits my mouth well.  The bottle does not leak at all when closed and it kept my ice water cold for hours.The Life Sky is also very sturdy.  I dropped mine a few feet onto concrete and despite some small dents and scratches, it still works and doesn't leak.I cleaned the Life Sky by hand and in the dishwasher without issue.  If you want to clean it by hand, you'll need a bottle brush as the opening is small.All in all... a great water bottle.(a received a complimentary sample)

DII's polyester tablecloth is well made, has a nice pattern, and washes well.The table cloth is made of a solid colored fabric that has a checkerboard pattern with raised and lowered squares.  The color is vibrant, and similar to the color of the Carolina Tar Heel's logo.It's a very nicely made table cloth.  It's cut square with even neat stitching and feels soft.  One thing to be mindful of is that it pulls easily.  My wooden dinning room table has been better days, and has a bit of a rough edge, which resulted in a few small pulls in the fabric.It fits my oval dinning room table just fine, but it would probably fit better on a rectangular table because on my oval table the corners of the tablecloth hang down quite low.  My dinning room table fits 6 seats, and is 60" long and 45" wide, but this cloth would easily fit a larger table since there is about a foot of extra fabric hanging off of each side.The tablecloth washed well in my front load washer and came out wrinkle free from the dryer.All in all... a nice simple, but not cheap looking, tablecloth.

DeWalt's Max Hedge Trimmer is quite a machine.  It has lots of power, a long reach, and a long battery life.The DeWalt is very nicely made.  The blade is sharp and nicely finished.  The plastics that make up the body of the trimmer are good quality and well assembled.  Overall, it feels like a quality piece that can take a beating.  Adding to the sense of sturdiness is the significant weight of the DeWalt.  When you first pick it up it can seem almost absurdly heavy, but thankfully it balances well in use and the weight almost seems to disappear.The DeWalt is very easy to use.  You just pop in the battery, release the trigger safety, and then pull the trigger.  Once the battery dies you simply place it on the charger and a few hours later it's ready to go again.  On the battery itself is a 3-led status meter to keep an eye on the charge level.Speaking of, the battery packs a serious punch.  The DeWalt is very powerful and made easy work of my shrubbery and tree branches.  It cuts through new growth, old growth, and dead growth with ease.  There was only one time it got jammed, and it recovered instantly.  The battery also lasts a long time.  I used the DeWalt for 15 minutes of continuous use and it was still indicating a full battery.  You can easily complete most yards in one charge.As I mentioned before the DeWalt balances nicely and the rubberized handles are large and easy to grip.  The 22" blade makes it easy to reach far off branches and complete the top of most hedges in one pass.  It's also not very loud.  You can't really converse over it, but you won'r need to wear ear protection, although you may want to consider protecting your eyes, as branches can sometimes go flying.  Overall, it's a pleasure to work with.All in all... a powerful yard work buddy.

Kitchen Aid’s 14-Cup food processor is powerful, versatile, and well made.The Kitchen Aid is a large machine.  It positively dwarfs my older 7-cup Kitchen Aid food processor, and just about makes it underneath my kitchen cabinets.  It’s made entirely of plastic, but feels very solid and well assembled.
