Playback was also excellent.Using a memory device, such as a thumb drive or external hard drive, programs can also be paused and played during general viewing.  This is helpful during those times you need to make a quick bathroom pit stop, grab a drink, or attend to something else.  Mediasonic calls this their Time Sync feature.  As with the PVR feature, pausing and playing a program only works well with properly supported devices.  It uses the memory device attached to the box to buffer content when viewing is paused.  If the storage device gives you problems when recording, you'll also have problems when pausing.For the money, this is a fine digital converter.  It supports a number of very helpful features, allows for HDMI connectivity (not found on all converter boxes), and supports both OTA antenna connectivity and cable/satellite connectivity.  Its use really excels for OTA use.If you're in need of a digital converter at a reasonable price, the Mediasonic HW180STB is a nice selection.

I have to admit, I purchased this more for me than my son--I'm 50!  My parents had this *exact* car when I was a kid, right down to the green paint and the faux wood paneling.  What we especially loved about this station wagon was the moon roof and the long, curved window above the back side window, all of which are faithfully reproduced on this car and are very, very cool!  Our car didn't have two dogs looking out the back window, which this car has.  Rather, we had a black poodle. :-)We also purchased the same Matchbox car as this, but in red.  That car has black dogs looking out the back window.My son and I share this car during playtime.  I'm particularly fond of this car though, and my son knows it as "Daddy's favorite car!"  He knows not to lose it. :-)

Wow... This is an excellent game for the price.  My son is a MAD MAN with this game!  He's only 3, but he has it mastered.  After seeing how much he loves it, I just unlocked the entire thing and purchased it for him.  He was so excited to have additional trucks and vehicles to play with.  He was home sick one day and couldn't really do much of anything.  We set him on the couch and let him have a quiet afternoon.  He spend hours playing this and never got bored.We totally recommend this for any child or adult.  With children though, we recommend exercising moderation.  It's very easy for them to get addicted to games like this.  It's very well thought out and programmed.  If your little one loves vehicle-based games, download this one and take it for a spin.  I'm sure s/he will love it!

This was a Christmas stocking stuffer gift for my son who was quite excited to receive it. What's nice about the Disney cars is, the quality is very good. The body is metal, not plastic. It's also a very accurate representation of the Disney car character. My son has a number of these cars in the series, and I won't hesitate to purchase others in the future. The price isn't too expensive, and it gives him a lot of quality play time playing with each of the cars in this series.

I’m a huge fan of the Pearl Izumi line. I recently purchased this thermal cycling tight to allow for cold weather riding. I use these over a base layer and have ridden in weather with wind chills below 32 degrees. Personally, I don’t recommend riding in that frigid of weather, but if you have to, I’m here to report that while my face and feet were freezing and in pain, my lower extremities were not. These thermal tights are really amazing.As is typical with Pearl Izumi, you get what you pay for. These tights are expensive, but the fit, construction, and performance are all excellent.I highly recommend to any and all riders, if you’re going to be riding in cooler weather, spend the money and purchase a quality pair of riding tights. You don’t need to look around any longer; these will do just fine!

Having a Samsung Galaxy S3 with an extended-life with a high-capacity battery makes finding a decent belt holster/pouch a real challenge.  This is especially true when shopping online, since you can’t test fit it to see if it will work.  With the massive battery I have attached to my S3, the phone is about a 1/2" thick and .56 lbs. (yes, I weighed it on a digital scale).  I found this Rebano belt pouch, took a chance, and ordered it.When I received it, I put it on my belt, crossed my fingers, and then tried putting my S3 in it.  It fit perfectly!  The fit was a little snug, but very usable, and the fit loosened over time.  I was so happy to have found a pouch that works with this battery.  The last thing I wanted was to find it didn’t fit, then I’d have to contact Amazon to inquire about a return.I purposely didn’t write this review immediately for a reason: I wanted to wait to see how this pouch held up to daily use.  I’m happy to report that, after a year, it works as well as the day I received it.The pouch is constructed of leather or faux leather material (not sure which) with quality stitching all the way around.  None of my stitching has come undone and the pouch is still in fantastic shape.If you have an extended capacity battery and are looking for a case, you’ve found one!  If you have the stock battery, this case will still work very well.  Either way, this is a quality case at a nice price.

As usual, Taylor of Old Bond Street (ToOBS) makes an exceptional shaving cream; the best I’ve ever used.  It’s so good, in fact, I no longer feel the need to explore and experiment with other shaving creams and soaps.  I’ve been doing that for over thirty years.  This is my third bowl of ToOBS, and each bowl is as good as the previous one.The lavender shaving cream is a bit different than some of the others.  The scent is clearly lavender, but very mild.  Too mild, in my opinion, but I recognize this is a subjective opinion.  It’s a wonderful scent while shaving, but after rinsing off and applying aftershave balm, it’s nonexistent.  I previously used the sandalwood scent, which, by contrast, was quite powerful.  The sandalwood scent would last all day, even after shaving balm was applied.  I’ve found different ToOBS shaving creams can have a different scent intensity.Regardless, this is a great shaving cream that I highly recommend.  Just be aware that the scent is not very intense.  This may be a feature to some customers.I’ve read other reviews of people complaining of their shaving cream being dried out when they received it.  ToOBS shaving cream is supposed to be quite soft and easy to swipe onto a brush with only a few whisks.  The lavender soap I received from Amazon is my first experience with the soap being dried out.  It’s not dry to the point of being a cake—it does have some softness to it—but I have to work my brush on the cream and whisk it around a number of times to get just a little onto the brush.  I don’t think it’s supposed to be this way.  This dryness might be contributing to its lack of scent intensity.  Perhaps other users can comment and share their experience, if they have a normal bowl of the lavender cream.I’m still a devoted ToOBS fan.  The dryness of this bowl doesn’t reduce my star rating for the product.

Wow . . . This little guy is LITTLE!  I want to tear one apart just to find out where all that memory is being stored.I purchased this to stock a digital picture frame.  The other thumb drive I had stuck out past the side of the picture frame.  I needed a smaller one to make sure no one would see it.  The Silicon Power 8 GB drive worked perfectly.The material around the connector is a soft, grippy, rubber-like material that feels nice to the touch.  My only complaint is the protective top cannot be affixed to the attached chain, as shown in the picture.  This leaves the top susceptible to becoming lost.  Even still, I wouldn't hesitate to purchase one of these again.  Their physical size is excellent, they work great, and are sporty in their tiny form factor.  The price is right too!

Very nice thumb drive pack at an excellent price.I purchased these to put in a digital electronic picture frame.  My only mistake was that I didn't take into account how long these are.  They're standard for a conventional thumb drive, but I didn't realize that they'd stick out the side of the picture frame.  This isn't a fault of the thumb drive, of course, but something I wanted to make people aware of, in case some of you use one for a picture frame.  The colors are nice, and the white protective covers are useful.Oh, and if you accidently put one through the wash, I'm hear to report that they'll probably still work.  Mine did! :-)

This thermometer was sent to me for my honest review. If you take a look at my other reviews, you'll see that receiving a product for review does not guarantee a positive review.I have to admit that I was skeptical when I saw this. I'm a former nurse, and this just wasn't around when I was working. However, on trying the unit, I was surprised to by just how easy and accurate it is. When I was aiming at my forehead without a mirror, I got some significant fluctuations. However, when I looked in the mirror and took my temperature, I could make sure my aim was a consistent distance from my temple and that there was no hair in the way. Maybe the reason that some folks are questioning accuracy is because it does matter that you're approximately the same distance from your skin each time, and it's really hard to do on your own face without looking in a mirror. When my aim and location are consistent, I don't get a variation of more than two-tenths of a degree. That's a very insignificant fluctuation for my needs and excellent for a thermometer in this price range.When you DO aim it at something like your hair, you'll get a "LO" reading. This is your indicator that something's gone wrong. The enclosed manual lists reasons for LO message: Hair or perspiration in the way, an air draft or dramatic change in ambient temperature, temperature readings too close to each other without giving the thermometer time to reboot, and distance of measuring too far. Easy.Another nice feature of this infrared thermometer is that it's non-contact. If you have the flu or some other communicable illness going around your house, not having to wash the thermometer between contacts is really convenient and hygienic. At the time of this review, there's the ebola scare going on around the world, and I'm noticing that non-contact thermometers are widely being used because they're great at reducing the risk of spreading disease.A really neat feature is that you can measure more than just your own body's temperature. The thermometer actually has three modes: Surface temperature, body, and room. My boyfriend is a retired mechanical engineer and likes to tinker with building things, including solar-powered creations, so this will come in handy for measuring surface temperature. As I write this, I'm in an office that I swear gets hotter than the rest of the house. Well, now I switch on "room" mode and do comparisons. Since we're in the process of doing some reconstruction on the house, it's helpful to have something that lets us know where we may need to add ceiling fans, etc.As far as the unit itself goes, it's got a great ergonomic design. It comes in a plastic storage case that includes two AAA batteries. I read the info booklet just to ensure I didn't miss anything, but you really don't need it because the design is very intuitive. There are four buttons on the front for: mode, Celsius/Fahrenheit, memory and a large button for scanning. The side has a button that turns the beeping sound off and on; it's nice to be able to silence the beep for times you want to measure someone's temperature while they're asleep.I highly recommend this product, especially if you are concerned about spreading illness and/or you are caring for a sick person whom you don't want to disturb every time you take a reading.

2:02 Mins I was sent this glass teapot for review (as well as the tea in the video, which is not part of this purchase), and when it arrived (carefully packed, thank you!), I actually gasped at how beautiful it was when I opened it. Even though it looks lovely in the photos, the photos just don't do it justice.First of all, let me mention the beautiful beadwork on the sides and handle--stunning. The beads on the handle also help keep it from slipping in your hand as you pour the tea. Since it looks so delicate, I was surprised to read it's top rack dishwasher safe. I think I'll still hand wash it, though, because I like it too much to run the risk of having it bump against something in my dishwasher. Cleaning was really simple -- just swish with some soapy water. The infuser basket lifts out, of course, so that's easy to clean as well.When you see this in person, you may at first wonder how the tea escapes the infuser. However, if you look closely, you'll see there are very finely cut slits in the infuser basket that allow your tea flavors to escape as it steeps. Loose teas will likely escape those fine cuts, so I would recommend this for blooming tea. Tea Beyond makes a wonderful "Fab Blooming Tea" that I am currently using, and it's amazing to watch the bud unfold to this soft pink color that complements the butterfly atop the glass teapot.This would make a wonderful gift for yourself, for a friend, for Mother's Day or really any time. I've included a video with a time lapse showing the bud unfurling. It's so much prettier in person! Know that the teapot is the only item that comes with this purchase, but the tea can be purchased separately at Tea Beyond FLS-3SET-BLF2100 12-Pack Fab Flowering Blooms Tea.If this video review was helpful to you, please like it and let me know your thoughts! Enjoy!

1:00 MinsUPDATE December 2014:Unfortunately, the glue on the casing around the speakers is now starting to separate. This doesn't affect the sound, but it is something that shouldn't be occurring. I have the speakers sitting on a shelf, and it is rarely is moved, so this is some kind of problem with the adhesive used. I have downgraded my rating due to the adhesive issue mentioned with the casing as well as the brand name.***I was sent the Truffol DuraSound Speaker in exchange for my honest review. If you check out my reviews you'll see that being provided a product does not always result in a positive review.My initial impressions of the speaker is that it looks a lot more elegant than the round, "spring-style" Bluetooth speakers. I've had a problem with the spring-style ones vibrating and bouncing all over a table so much that they eventually fall off the table. This one, however, is solid, a nice weight without being heavy, and a style that doesn't lend itself to movement as it plays your tunes.Another thing I like is that the style is simple and elegant. Mine speakers are black; sitting on my other black electronics, the speaker looks okay out in the open whereas many times Bluetooth speakers have some wild colors that are great for travel but not so great for leaving out in the open.The texture of the speaker is sort of a flat matte feeling due to everything being encased in rubber. The only glossy, reflective things are the buttons on the top. These buttons allow you to move to previous or next track, adjust volume, or pause/stop playing. I use the pause occasionally, but the other two really don't get much use as I usually reach for my phone nearby to move to a different track.This paired so easily with my iPhone. I also really like that it uses a micro USB port. There's another spot for Line In. Because of the micro USB port there are no cords that have to be attached for this to play.You don't need to SEE this speaker to use it, and this might be helpful for those who are vision-impaired or just don't want to have to see buttons to use them. When you switch the power to ON, a female voice says, "power on." Once you've paired your device (you'll only need to do this once) when you turn the speaker on, it searches for the device you paired and then announces "connected." When you turn off the speaker, it announces "power off."Battery life is unmatched with every other Bluetooth device I've used. In fact, I don't even think about the battery running out on this when I'm using it. With others, a couple of hours into a pool party and the speaker would die. This one I just plug in every few days whenever I think of it. Battery life is "up to* 8 hours. I've not tried to run it all the way down, but I've used it for hours on end without any issue of running out of battery.CONS:--The sound quality has left me a little disappointed. This just doesn't provide as loud and full sound, especially bass, that I was expecting from its size. For the price, it's decent sound and better than many in a cheaper price range, but still not what I'd expect from the appearance.--The Truffol logo was loose from the start. It was crooked, and when I tried to straighten it, it fell off. You can see it fall off in the video as well. I'd just leave the logo off, but it does leave an indentation where the logo is supposed to be, so I'll have to find a way to affix it again.This loses a star because of the cons above. However, don't be mistaken--of all of the Bluetooth speakers I've owned and reviewed, this is my favorite. It's used almost every day. The others are now in drawers or regifted. If you're an audiophile, a speaker in this price range isn't going to please you. If you just like to listen to music while you work or move about your home and want to get a fuller sound than you would just using a phone or tablet, this is a really good buy. It's worth paying the price difference compared to many smaller, cheaper speakers.

I was sent a sample of this to review, and this represents my honest opinion. You can check my other reviews and note that receiving a product for review does not always result in a positive review. I love this product and intend to buy it when my current bottle runs out.I have been using another brand's Vitamin C serum for some time now in an effort to help reduce brown spots and freckles on my face as well as help prevent wrinkles. If you're not familiar with the benefits of vitamin C, just know that it is a powerful antioxidant that helps prevent premature aging.The first thing I noticed about this serum is that, unlike others I've used, this one isn't oily or full of "cones" (silicone, dimethicone and the like). I'm in my 40s and still have hormonal acne and occasional cystic acne, even having a course of Accutane in my mid-30s, I am very careful about what products I use because my skin will break out. When I apply this serum, my skin just absorbs it without leaving an oily or slick feeling on my skin.The Viva Vitamin C Serum doesn't interfere with my makeup, either. With other silicone- and oil-heavy products, I had to limit application to only nighttime because of how it shortened makeup wear. That slimy feeling I had using other vitamin C serums is not an issue with this brand.I'm so used to companies putting unnecessary fragrances in their products, and this one has no added fragrances. There is a scent, but it's very mild, and I can't even distinguish it enough to describe it.As far as packaging goes, it's a dark ("amber") bottle with an eyedropper. There's no product waste, and you can keep the product bacteria-free by not having contact with the tip of the eyedropper. The amber bottle helps prevent breakdown of the vitamin C. I also store it away from natural light in order to retain its efficacy. The bottle bears the stamp that it has a 12-month shelf life after it is opened.The ingredients just can't be beaten. First, there are ZERO parabens. As a breast cancer survivor who has read about possible negative health impact of using products with parabens, I avoid products containing parabens, particularly when they are things that remain on my skin for long periods of time. When I checked the list of ingredients, I was pleasantly surprised that there was no "fluff" or cheap fillers in the list. Here's the full ingredient list:Deionized aqua (water)organic aloe barbadensis leaf (aloe)sodium ascorbyl phosphate (vitamin c)methylsulfonymethane (MSM)cassia angustifolia seed polysaccharide (botanical hyaluronic acid)hamamelis virginia (witch hazel)kosher vegetable glycerincarbomerarginineorganic simmondsia chinesis (jojoba oil)tocopheryl acetate (vitamin e)phenoxyethanolethyl hexyl glycerinorganic centella asiatica (gotu kola extract)organic equisetum arvense (horsetail plant extract)organic pelagonium gravoleons (geranium extract)organic taracum officinaledandelion extractThe product is listed as 98% naturally derived / 72% organic. It bears the stamp that it is certified organic and not tested on animals.Directions given are to apply a small amount with fingertips to freshly cleansed and toned skin. The directions state to allow time for the product to absorb before applying moisturizer. I've found that it absorbs very quickly (fewer than 30 seconds). As mentioned earlier, this serum doesn't leave a slick or oily film, so it doesn't interfere with makeup or make you feel slimy. When I use paper to blot the area of application, there is absolutely no trace of oil on the paper.Since the delivery route is an eyedropper, it's easy to use just a small amount. A little goes a long way, and one bottle lasts a very long time. I not only apply to my face, neck and decollete, but also the back of my hands where I have uneven skin due to sun damage.As stated in the headline, this is the best vitamin C serum I have ever used. I highly recommend it and will be replacing it when it runs out.

I was sent this item for review in exchange for my honest review. You can look at my other reviews to see that receiving a product for free does not always result in a positive review.This is the third body fat scale I've owned. In the house there's a Tanita scale (with metal areas you step on) and a Fitbit Aria scale that syncs with my Fitbit Ultra and this new scale. I'll give you some pros and cons based on my experience with other scales.First, let's talk installation. I was really dreading the setup process because my Fitbit Aria scale was a headache to set up and continues to be a headache whenever I need to change the batteries. I'm happy to say that setup of this scale was a breeze. The scale came with clear instructions (in English, not Chinese, so apparently they fixed the problem the previous reviewer mentioned). There were different instructions based on whether your phone is iPhone or Android, and both sets of instructions looked easy. I was surprised when the scale paired to my phone without a hitch. I was waiting for some code or some error messages or some other headache, and it paired effortlessly. Furthermore, I was happy to find that the scale shipped with batteries since I didn't have enough AA batteries at home.I downloaded the iWellness app that is necessary to use with this scale, and overall, I find the app easy to understand (with a few exceptions mentioned in a moment). When you want to weigh yourself, it's as easy as opening the app and stepping on the scale. The scale then communicates your info to the app, and you're done.This is where I need to stop and mention my experience with the Fitbit Aria scale vs. the Easy@Home scale. First of all, unlike the Aria, the numbers on the Easy@Home scale are huge and easy to read. I also like that I can simply stand on the scale and don't need to wait for stupid messages like "Step off..." and "Thinking...". The Easy@Home is simply step on, step off. You're not left wondering whether your weighing session really "took" or not.Aesthetically, the Easy@Home scale is beautiful. It has the black glass as well as what looks like sterling silver finished accents. If you like to leave your scale out in the open like I do, it'll look great.Options: If you just want to weigh and don't care about the other details, like body fat percentage, you can step on the scale with socks on. I keep my scale near the bathroom so I get the most accurate reading sans clothing right after using the bathroom after I wake up. The app has options for male or female users as well as fine tuning readings based on whether you've input your activity level as ordinary, amateur or professional. The wording choices were a little confusing, but the image showed a progression that made me think that "ordinary" in this app is probably the equivalent of "sedentary" in other apps. Likewise, I wasn't sure what "unit" in the app meant until I tried to do a "pull down" on the entry field in the app and discovered that simply meant pounds, kilograms or stones.The app is extremely simple to use with the scale. What I was pleasantly surprised to see was that it offers SEVERAL readings that aren't included in many other scales like the Aria. The Easy@Home scale gave me a list of readings, including:Body WaterBody FatBoneBMIVisceral FatBMRMuscle MassIn the app, you can click on "Info" which will show a page with charts showing what the recommended readings are based on things like your gender and age. Unfortunately, some areas of the app look like they could have used an English-first-language editor. For example, the information under "Visceral Fat" in one area is "Congratulation,Please Get on with a performance. A well-balanced diet and moderate exercise will keep you fit." In the chart under the section BMI, the headings read: Thin BMI, Healthy BMI, Light Depot BMI, Serious Depot BMI." I have absolutely no idea what "depot" was intended to mean here (overweight? high?), and I really don't want to spend my time guessing. These are easily fixed issues, and hopefully the developers will get a proofreader/editor to correct the English wording in a future update.The main screen of the app also calculates your weight compared with the previous weigh-in, which is a nice feature. In other apps, I find I have to do some clicking to get that information. I can click on my weight for the day, and that takes me to a screen where I can view my results as a graph or a list. The home screen also has a color-coded BMI scale, with overweight being red, fat being yellow, healthy as green, and "thin" as blue. I'm very visual and find it motivating to move my weight, body fat and other readings into a better zone.Regarding accuracy, because I have other scales, belong to a gym and am under frequent medical care after major surgery a few months ago, I'm confident that the readings on the scale are accurate because they are consistent with the readouts that I'm getting on other devices. This goes for both the body fat and the weight. I've never had the other readings (bone, etc.), so I don't have a way to verify those numbers are accurate.The app allows you to export your data as a text file. Unfortunately, currently there is no other option for exporting data as well as no syncing with the popular fitness-geared web sites. If you are only interested in tracking things via iWellness and not sharing that info with other sites, apps and gadgets, then look no further--this one is a winner. If, however, you want your readings to be automatically integrated with the other fitness-tracking apps and gadgets in your life, you're out of luck: You'll either have to manually enter them or write your own software program to transfer the data.Finally, this scale costs less than HALF of what similar scales are selling for on Amazon. If you're like me, a price difference like that can help me hang tight until some issues are fixed.Once the company enables the Easy@Home scale to share info with other programs and does an easy cleanup of the English in its app, this will be a 5-star combination of app and scale.

I was sent this product in exchange for my honest review. If you will look at my other reviews, you will see that receiving a free product does not guarantee a positive review.I received the pink Tangle Teezer and was initially very impressed. First, it looks different than any other hair brush you'll find. I love the ergonomic shape of this brush, from the way it feels in my hand to the way the bristles are curved to the shape of my head. The finish is beautiful and glossy as pictured.If I had given a review after using it for a week or two, I would have rated it 5 stars because that was my initial impression. However, over time I have come to find that the way the tangles are "teezed" out of my hair is through breaking through them rather than detangling. There is more fallout in this brush than there is in any other brush or comb I use.The above experience led me to wonder what audience this product was created for. If your hair is long enough to tangle, then you would probably be looking for something to help get the tangles out. If it's long enough to tangle, then you likely are either wanting to keep it looking healthy at that length or even wanting to grow it longer. So that audience would consist of people like me.Any way that breaks hair or pulls it out of the scalp isn't one that is going to help my hair become longer, be healthier or look healthier. The best method that I've found (and also the one that most long-hair forums online seem to recommend) is a wide-tooth comb and patience: You start at the ends of your hair, and carefully work through a section with the goal of not ripping, stretching or otherwise damaging your hair. If you can do this process dry, that's best since hair is at its weakest when wet. Sometimes I'll add a detangler spray to the process if I need some extra help.I'm sorry to have to give this product a negative review, but I would not recommend this to anyone who has hair of a length that tangles, unless you have long hair and are planning to cut it in the not-too-distant future. If you have short hair and just want a great brush that gets through hair, then this one would be fine.

I was sent this thermometer to review in exchange for my honest opinion. If you take a look at my other reviews, you'll see that receiving products for testing does not always result in a positive review.This is my favorite instant read thermometer I've ever used. The one previous to it didn't fare very well when I left it sticking out of a roast in the oven. If you're familiar with Salvador Dali's work of art entitled "Persistence of Time," then know that this was his work come to life. But I digress.Right away I noticed that this thermometer felt like it was a quality item. I have purchased other Measupro products, and I haven't been disappointed yet. The Measupro thermometer also has a nice large screen, making reading much easier than many other instant read thermometers on the market. The readout screen measures 1.75 inches wide. The rest of the face of the thermometer is the appearance of brushed stainless steel and features the following buttons:MAX/MINPOWERRESETCLEARCALC/FI'm in my mid-40s and finding I often can't read type that was once readable, so I was happy to find that the font is of a generous size that doesn't make me have to hunt down a pair of reading glasses in order to read things.The thermometer came with detailed instructions, which I happened to misplace. However, this provided a great opportunity to see how intuitive the Measupro thermometer is. This came in handy as recently as last night. I had left a tray of uncooked chicken breasts in the fridge long enough that I was feeling very iffy about making them a part of dinner. I decided I would just check the cooked temp on several of them and make sure the biggest pieces were at least 165 degrees. A press of the power button caused the unit to start measuring temperature. Interestingly, it measured the temperature of the room before I even poked it into the meat. At one point I bumped the Celsius button instead of the Fahrenheit button, and it was easy to figure out how to move back to Fahrenheit.The min/max feature I haven't yet needed to use, but I can see the value in wanting to see what the previous reading was. I have never needed to use the CAL (calibration) button, but it's nice to know it's as simple as pressing a button rather than having to wander through various counterintuitive steps.Other features: There is a loop cutout at the button end of the thermometer, and I can see that it would be handy if one wished to hang this around their neck while cooking or hanging it for storage. The loop also has a metal piece that would allow you to hook this over the edge of a pot to test the temperature of a liquid as it changes. I like that the probe end is sufficiently tapered that it won't leave obvious holes in the meat I am cooking. A plastic case that fits around the probe helps prevent damage to the thermometer and damage to hands that are poking around in kitchen drawers, trying to find the thermometer. The plastic cover also has a pen-style clip on it so you can affix it to a pocket.The thermometer is also much better made than my previous ones. I like that the color is very slightly off-white so it doesn't look starkly white, and the stainless steel colored face is attractive. The shape is also very ergonomic to hold. The probe is nice and long and doesn't make you have to get too close to the hot stuff in order to measure its temperature. I was very surprised to read it can be sent through the dishwasher, though I likely won't do so since it just takes a moment to hand wash the thermometer.The only thing that I can think that would improve this item is if the probe cover or the back of the thermometer had a guide as to safe cooking temperatures for various items.This is going to be a permanent staple item in my kitchen. It's given me peace of mind over those items that I used to try to eyeball -- you know, like when you wonder if the juices are truly clear or if you might have noticed they were a little pink? If you're cooking meats, you just can't afford to risk your health or the health of your guests. Highly recommended.

I own two MeasuPro timers and love both of them. The first I purchased with my own money, and the CCT300 was later sent to me in exchange for my honest review. If you read my reviews, you will see that a free product does not always result in a positive review.We have a big house, so I tend to keep timers in different areas of the house. Sometimes I'll use the magnet on the back and attach the timer to the refrigerator, and I'm happy that the magnet is nice and strong, and the unit doesn't rock or fall off the fridge when I press buttons. I can also clip this timer to my clothing (typically, my waistband) as I'm moving about and doing laundry or other tasks.This timer has some unique features I've never run across in a digital timer. If you've ever wanted to time something without disturbing others, this timer is going to be perfect for you. It has a regular beep that is nice and loud, so you can hear it from another room. However--this is where it REALLY shines--it also has an option for the alarm to be a silent flashing red LED light or a vibrator. It does not do a combination of these, so you make your choice by moving a switch on the back. This is so great for things like business meetings, conference calls, phone calls with family, naps and so on. You can feel the timer vibrating in your pocket or just notice it flashing, and you can move on to other tasks without disturbing others.Immediately after the timer goes off, it starts counting UP. I like this feature a lot. A real-world example: I decided to meditate lying down the other day, and I was low on sleep; I decided that if I fell asleep, I must really need the sleep, so I put the timer on vibrate. A while later I awoke to see some 2 hours had passed: I knew exactly how long I had been napping.On the left side of the front of the timer, you'll see there are three options: You can view the timer as a clock, counting up or counting down. The next time you're following directions to beat that cake mix for two minutes, here's your timer.Another thing I really like about the timer is it feels much more solid and well made than other brands I've tried. I like that the color isn't a stark white, but more of a soft white. The gray buttons are solid, and the switches have a nice "click" feel as you adjust them.Other options on the front are MEMORY, HR, MIN, SEC, CLEAR, START/STOP.I am recovering from spinal surgery to my neck, and I find the memory feature extremely helpful. Here's what I do: I try to change positions/activities at least every 30 minutes. So I just put 15 minutes in as my standard, and when the timer goes off, I push the memory button which resets the timer to 15 minutes in one simple push. So if I'm sitting a the computer writing a review like this, I try to complete it within 15 minutes or take a break afterwards. If I reset it to go another 15 minutes, then I absolutely MUST get up and change positions after 30 minutes.This is a really excellent timer if you want a solid timer that doesn't disturb others (or make it obvious that you're timing things). It works very well to keep me on task as well as take necessary breaks to take care of my health. I wouldn't be without it in the kitchen, cleaning and decluttering. Somehow everything is much more doable if it's broken down into timed increments, and I highly recommend this timer, especially if you would benefit from the options to make the alarm a silent LED or a vibrating alarm rather than the standard beep.

I was sent this product to review, and I always give my honest opinion in reviews.First thing I want to mention is that I had to contact the company, and the owner responded quickly; customer service is excellent with this company.My boyfriend is a mechanical engineer and a former plumber, so installation was a breeze. I asked him if he thought someone without his background would have trouble installing it, and he said no. The installation and usage instructions are very thorough, using both full-color photos and written descriptions. We didn't have any trouble understanding the instructions, and, as mentioned, the customer service is wonderful should you need to contact them.Basically, how the device works is by allowing you to customize the amount of water per flush depending on your need (liquid vs. solid) and what type of toilet you have. We did some tweaking of the settings and found our perfect setting, and there have been no problems since. So how it works is if you have just liquid (okay, pee), you would need a smaller flush. So for liquids, you'd tap the top of the Tap-n-Flush, and a green light comes on. During the time the green light is on, you then flush the toilet by the traditional method. This results in a smaller amount of water being used. For solids (poo, chunky barf, etc.), you would just flush traditionally.PROS:--This unit has the potential to save you money, especially if you have many users. The more flushes, the more savings. Whether it would actually save you money will require you to do the math to figure in things like the cost of batteries, your water rates, and the number of people using the toilet.--It's simple to install and use.--It's kinder to the environment than traditional toilet use is.CONS:--It doesn't look great in the bathroom. It's right there on top of the toilet. We are finishing our bathroom right now, and everything looks nice except for the visible Tap-n-Flush. It would be better if there were a way to have it hidden--ideally an attachment to the handle itself or on the side of the toilet.I recommend this product if you have a high-usage bathroom and you do the math to see whether it will save you money. The instructions are clear, the customer service is helpful, and the product appears to be well made.

I was sent this product to review. I'm a geek and love my gadgets -- iPad, iPhone, etc. Sadly, some of my charging cords haven't fared as well as the products themselves. They seem to get weak at the connection points on both ends, and I end up trying to tape or Sugru the things to keep them functioning. I have used this one for a while now, and it seems to be holding up just fine. I've taken the cord and tried bending both ends, and they feel like they're reinforced more than the other charging cords I've been using. So far, so good. It fits easily into the USB ports of my desktop computer as well as my iPhone and syncs and charges effortlessly.

I have used another peel (beta hydroxy) from Skin Laboratory, and I am so impressed with their products. I showed the other to my dermatologist, and she commented that it's just a weaker version of what she uses; she basically gave it her stamp of approval. So I was excited to try this one.As background, I'm in my mid-40s and have some weird brown patches. They occurred months after I went through chemotherapy at 39. Last summer I wasn't as fastidious as I should have been in reapplying SPF in the pool, so those patches sudden became much darker and very noticeable. So I started using this peel with hopes it would fade the brown patches. It worked very well and basically got them back to the pre-summer darkness level (not sure how else to explain it).This spring I've been really determined to eradicate those patches altogether without having to spend money for a doctor's office chemical peel. This is how I use the product: I start off by exfoliating my skin. I would not recommend this first if you haven't already tried the product. Exfoliating first will cause a more dramatic result (i.e., more burning). I then pour the peel liquid into a small glass bowl. I pour just enough so that I can add more if necessary but will not waste any of the product. I use a fan brush to apply it. I avoid the corners of my nose and mouth, because the skin there is too sensitive and will crack and peel terribly (I believe there's even a warning to avoid these areas). I do my whole face and then rinse after a few minutes. There is little to no frosting (if you're not sure what this is, do some googling about frosting with chemical peels). On occasion, I will go back after I've rinsed my entire face and reapply to just those stubborn areas.MORE is not better. I do not do this more often than the bottle recommends because skin needs time to heal and turn over. I follow the peel up with copious amounts of cool water. Then I do use a light moisturizer. I have problem skin (even went on a round of Accutane in my mid-30s for cystic acne) that is oily, especially in the T-zone, so I keep the moisturizer pretty light. I also use a tinted moisturizer for days after the peel since my skin is dry and has some minimal flaking/peeling. I also use a dark spot lightener from Paula's Choice; I do that once or twice a day.The difference with following this routine has been marked. My spots have faded to where they can be covered with a good full-coverage foundation. I expect they will be eradicated entirely if I keep to this routine. It IS the long route compared to a heavy duty peel you might get at a dermatologist's office, but it's oodles cheaper and doesn't result in downtime and missed days from work. I highly recommend this if you're patient and willing to do the rest -- regularly use products that will help fade brown spots, use a good exfoliant (chemical or manual), and use sun protection religiously.

I was sent this charger for testing and review in exchange for my honest opinion. I tell it like it is, good or bad.The car charger I've been using has been big and interferes with my cup holder, so the first thing I noticed when plugging this charger in is how the small size is a real plus. Having two USB ports is really important for me as well as I use an iPhone and my boyfriend uses an Android phone. This charger enables us to have both phones plugged in and charging simultaneously.Another thing I like is that the connection is solid. What I mean is I've had previous car chargers that are flaky and required me to wiggle them to hear that the battery connection was working. This one consistently has a good connection and is reliable. It keeps two phones running on long trips where the GPS is constantly in use. I've noted no issues with overheating, either. This is a great buy, especially if you're a two-phone family.

I was sent this for review in exchange for my honest opinion.I've owned a few different mini speakers and have to say this one has great sound and features that you'll want in a portable speaker. The first thing I like is that you aren't dealing with batteries here; I can't emphasize just how important it is not to deal with batteries you have to add to a speaker. This speaker comes with a charger that's easy to plug into your USB port on your computer.As for form, it's quite attractive. I got the black and red design, and it was a good choice. For travel, you can close the speaker by pushing the top to the bottom and then twisting slightly. The end that plugs into your phone or other device is built right into the speaker and has a place for it to nest in the bottom when not in use. It's portable, which makes it great for using in the car. I like to use it in my car to boost the sound from my phone as well as amplify the sound when using GPS guidance.The sound from this small speaker is amazing. I have had it plugged into my phone and sitting on my table, playing music all week as I create art, and I haven't had to recharge yet. My boyfriend was sitting in an adjacent room and heard the sound and asked if that was the new speaker, and when I said yes, he promptly claimed it as his own. :) It's a nice, full sound. When I maxed out the sound volume on my phone, I was happy to discover that there's also a volume switch on the speaker itself, so you can adjust the volume there as well. To preserve the battery, there's an on/off switch on the speaker.The speaker comes with an instruction guide, charging cables and a soft pouch for storage. But I won't be using the pouch because we're using the speaker every day. This is one you can buy with confidence.

I was finding my necklaces knotted from my previous jewelry organizer, so I did some research and went and saw this in person at a brick and mortar store. It really is perfect. The top part telescopes quite a bit higher than you see in the photo, and you can turn it so the necklaces are staggered rather than hanging on top of each other. There's a "key" that you turn to tighten whatever position you choose for the top portion; I actually use that little key as yet another place to hang my bracelets. I fully extended the top portion, and the result is that even my longest necklaces hang nicely from the top. The bottom portion is great for rings or watches you wear every day. The whole thing feels sturdy and has a nice brushed effect to the metal. I couldn't be more pleased! Take a look at the picture I took above with my necklaces hanging on it. I love it!

I bought this book on May 30 before hearing that the 5-year anniversary of Pat's being let go was coming up in June. It turned out to be great timing because there was a "Let Go Day" event in June with celebration about the anniversary, educational interviews about others who Let Go, giveaways and more.So who is Pat Flynn? Basically, if you're not familiar with Pat Flynn, search the internet for Smart Passive Income. In a nutshell, Pat was let go from his job as an architect five years ago when the big economic downturn occurred. In his search for ways to make income, he monetized a web site he had built for his own study purposes for the LEED exam, wrote an ebook and did a few other things and is now making more in a month than most of us make in a year.But his path hasn't been easy or without days he wasn't tempted to give up. In his book he shares how he let go of some of the constructs he had -- that old idea that working for someone else is the path to success nowadays. One of the things I like about Pat is his transparency, and he shares his methods in the book.A fun thing is at the end of many of the chapters there is video (that you can click on and go see) to give some video background on the subject of the chapter. It just creates a very well-rounded experience. I also loved the quotations and drawings at the front of each chapter of the book.So I highly recommend this book for anybody who's been laid off or anybody who is wanting to build a passive income stream as either security or as your primary income. It's inspirational, educational and real.

I have bought liquid peels (Skin Laboratory on Amazon) before, and the directions recommended using a piece of gauze for application. Not having any gauze on hand, I tried to use one of those cosmetic sponges, only to have a lot of the product end up in the sponge. This is the same issue with cotton balls. Frankly, most peels are pricey, and you don't want to be wasting any product, so a fan brush is a huge help.What I wasn't pleased with was the fact that this brush arrived with some bristles that were longer than others. I had to get out my scissors and do some trimming. Once that was done, however, the brush worked great, and I've been very happy with it. What I do is take a small condiment bowl (like they use on cooking shows for herbs!) and pour a small amount of the product in there. Using the fan brush allows me to work quickly and without wasting any of the product. Having used this one now I would not be without it or another fan brush for applying liquid skin peels. They save money over time as you're not wasting product on the delivery method as you are with cotton balls and sponges.

This attached to our stainless steel dishwasher easily and looks good. I don't like the aesthetics of the two different font types and/or weights as well as the squiggle and underline, but they were probably trying to make it easier to quickly see the difference; having had a different one previously, I find those things unnecessary. I am not really fond of the way the spinner rotates -- it stops at certain points. Not all of these rotating magnets do this, and I prefer the ones that don't have a stopping point so you can just turn them either direction. I also think the design would be better if there were a different style of edge on it, such as a tapered edge. This little magnet is cheap, however, and it does the job.

Rather than forking out money that I don't have right now for a camcorder, I am making do by running a webcam connected to this. I've actually hooked up another 16-foot repeater cable by a different brand and have noticed no issues whatsoever. To make the cord a bit easier to handle, I purchased a cord keeper at the hardware store for a couple of bucks. I'm very pleased with my setup right now and glad that there appears to be no decrease in video quality or speed from using the BlueRigger repeater cable.

Let me start by saying I use about a 2-inch thick piece of self-cut memory foam for a pillow. It's been impossible to make a dent (as the instructions say) and lie with my ear on the speaker without lots of discomfort. I took the advice of other reviewers and removed the cover, only to then find that my mate could hear the audio and found it annoying. I tried the speaker under the pillow as well, but that was a little awkward for want of trying to find where to position my ear so I could actually hear the sound. What I've found works best is to cut out a circle in my foam pillow and let this little speaker sit inside that circle with its cover on. The circle can be under the pillow or on top of the pillow. Actually, I made several so I can sleep on either my right or left side (with my face off the edge of the pillow) and just have to move the speaker to its new "hole" if I flip over. I've also found that using a very thin silk charmeuse pillowcase allows the speaker to slide into the hole in the pillow from the outside without my having to slip it inside the pillowcase. There are many options, and I'm convinced that most people can find a way to make this work for them -- they just might have to get a bit creative.As far as the technical specs go, the sound is excellent for both audiobooks and relaxing music and environment music (frogs croaking, birds chirping, waterfalls flowing...). I like the volume in the cord, but as another reviewer mentioned, it is quite far. You can probably find a way to hack this to your liking as well: I just sleep with my hand loosely cupped around the volume part.So in a nutshell, while I'd like to see some improvements made in the comfort of this product and the volume control placement, it's really quite good and meets the need at a reasonable price. I think most people will be happy. If you're worried about the cord fray issue that some have reported, you can always use a product like Sugru (search Amazon) or good old electrical tape to reinforce it.

I have my Moleskines color coded by topic, and purple is the color of highlighter that's hardest for me to find. I previously used a Sharpie Accent highlighter and wasn't happy with the way it was looking faded and pale on the page compared with the other colors. I ordered this pack online and was very pleased to find the color is nice and bold and most definitely purple rather than a shade that is too close to pink. The pen casing is transparent so you can see how much ink supply is left, and there's also a loop that you could use to attach your highlighter to something if you wanted. I recommend this if you're looking for a nice and bold purple highlighter.

This is a compact Wi-Fi router that plugs directly into a wall socket and has two adjustable antennas. I connected it to my cable modem and plugged it in and had a wireless network connection to my Dell laptop in just a few minutes. To have a secure connection you have to access the mini router through your web browser and select the type of encryption you want and give it a password. The instructions that come with the mini router are pretty good and will guide you through it. The connection I had was fast and didn't have any glitches.The mini router doesn't have much range though. In the next room, about 30 feet away, the bars that show signal strength on my laptop start to drop. In the garage, about 40 feet away, the signal dropped to two bars.I also connected my laptop with the cat five cable and it worked great. I set it up as a repeater with my Netgear router but couldn't see any difference in signal strength on the laptop with the mini router plugged in different parts of the house.NOTE: I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a really cool RC off-road rock crawler truck. It's 1:18 scale, 10.5" x 6.5" x 5". The tires are 2 7/8" in diameter and it has 2 1/4" ground clearance under the body.It has a working suspension front and rear and also the suspension pivots. It's four-wheel-drive and has two drive motors. I made a 3" stack of books on the floor and it would drive right over them.It runs on a 4.8V rechargeable battery and the 2.4 GHz controller uses three AA batteries that are included . The controller has a trigger and a steering wheel. It drives very well and is a lot of fun. It isn't fast but it is quite powerful. This would be a good choice for young kids all the way up to grown-up kids.Not only is it fun to drive but it looks cool too.NOTE: I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a really cool RC off-road rock crawler truck. It's 1:18 scale, 10.5" x 6.5" x 5". The tires are 2 7/8" in diameter and it has 2 1/4" ground clearance under the body.It has a working suspension front and rear and also the suspension pivots. It's four-wheel-drive and has two drive motors. I made a 3" stack of books on the floor and it would drive right over them.It runs on a 4.8V rechargeable battery and the 2.4 GHz controller uses three AA batteries that are included . The controller has a trigger and a steering wheel. It drives very well and is a lot of fun. It isn't fast but it is quite powerful. This would be a good choice for young kids all the way up to grown-up kids.Not only is it fun to drive but it looks cool too.NOTE: I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a really cool RC off-road rock crawler truck. It's 1:18 scale, 10.5" x 6.5" x 5". The tires are 2 7/8" in diameter and it has 2 1/4" ground clearance under the body.It has a working suspension front and rear and also the suspension pivots. It's four-wheel-drive and has two drive motors. I made a 3" stack of books on the floor and it would drive right over them.It runs on a 4.8V rechargeable battery and the 2.4 GHz controller uses three AA batteries that are included . The controller has a trigger and a steering wheel. It drives very well and is a lot of fun. It isn't fast but it is quite powerful. This would be a good choice for young kids all the way up to grown-up kids.Not only is it fun to drive but it looks cool too.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Jane Marcus is a fisheries biologist who has been working in the genetics field. She is in Kansas, out for a drive and trying to forget her grief over her mother's painful death. When a car goes off the road in front of her, she heads to the wreck site to see if she can help - and ends up entangled in a deadly plot that goes into the highest levels of government.I'm not usually one to like political thrillers but this story had quite enough twists and turns to keep me engaged. It felt very current since the presidential debates were on my television in real life as I read the book and the story takes place prior to a presidential election.Part of this book takes place in the Lower 48 but, to me at least, the most interesting part of the book took place in Alaska.Politics, big game hunting, bad guys, more bad guys, a convoluted storyline, scary airplane flights - all come together in a fast moving thriller that changes directions frequently but with all the threads coming together for a satisfying ending.

This is a lightweight trigger capo made of aluminum with semi-hard rubber that contacts the strings and the back of the neck. It's 7/16 inches wide - not as fat as some capos are.The spring is pretty tough and I wasn't too sure how it would work on an electric guitar. I use a medium gauge string on my electric and I tried it out on a few different places on the fretboard. As long as I didn't seat it so it was against the side of the neck, it worked great. The A and low E strings would go pretty sharp.I also put it on my acoustic guitar and could seat it up against the side of the neck without any issues.To use this with an electric you could do a quick check with a tuner and reposition it a little if you're out of tune.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a compact two port smart USB charger. Each port will put out up to 2.4A. It measures 2.25" x 2.25" x 1.25". The plug that goes in the wall socket folds into the charger making it easier to carry with you. It would be great to carry along when traveling. It's made out of a durable plastic and has a matte finish.I have a USB cord with a digital readout that shows the charge rate and I used it with the charger to charge up my Samsung Galaxy phone. The charge rate started out at .82A and went down as the phone charged. The phone is rated to not exceed 1.0A so the charger is working as it should.Manufacturer's Note:  This USB wall charger is not compatible with the iPod Nano, iPod Classic, HP TouchPad, Dell Venue 11 Pro, and Asus tablets.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Cameron Taylor is a slacker graveyard shift security guard at the Mal Loma Nuclear Power Plant on the California coast. He is always late to his shift, goes where he's not supposed to go at the Plant and now has the serious hots for new hire Grace Baker. And he's teaching her his bad habits.Troubles abound when terrorists (both foreign and homegrown) decide to use the Plant as a tool to kill thousands and the only ones fighting these terrorists are Cameron and Grace.This actually was a scary book, full of "what ifs" that sound all too plausible in this story. It also read like a screenplay - for a movie I would like to see.The book was action packed. I really hope that our nuclear plants don't have employees like Cameron and Grace on the payroll, though - that's scary to imagine.There were plenty of unbelievable moments in the book but it is fiction plus you just never know. There's a reason for the old saying that "truth is stranger than fiction."I recommend this book to readers that enjoy thrillers, action-packed fiction or just a good read.The book could use a good going over by a proofreader. I was still able to enjoy the story but the errors were distracting. And I was reading the published book, not an Advanced Reading Copy.NOTE:  I received this book from the author in exchange for my honest review.

My husband is a retired auto mechanic and has gone through a number of multimeters over the years. For automotive or general electrical work this is a very good choice especially for what Amazon is selling them for.He compared it to his Fluke professional multimeter and the accuracy was very good. He did an AC voltage, DC voltage, and a couple of resistance tests. The differences were very minimal and well within the +/-1.5% rating listed in the manual.The test leads from the Fluke will also fit this one so getting different types of leads for it will be easy. The leads that come with it seem pretty good and have caps to cover the lead ends which have sharp points.It will do all the tests that most people would need.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a super high end sounding set of headphones.I plugged them into my Kenwood receiver and the sound quality is excellent. The bass is very good - natural sounding and not booming.I plugged them into my Samsung Galaxy phone and made a call and they worked very well, as the volume and sound quality on both ends of my calls was very good. If you have an iPhone or other Apple product,  you can hang-up, answer, and adjust the volume but the in-line control doesn't work on other brands of  phones.They are very well-made and fully adjustable. The ear pads and the padding on the inside of the stainless steel headband are soft and feel durable. The ear pads cover the ears and dampen noises pretty well. They are very comfortable to wear even for extended periods of time.The cord is 51 inches long and is made of a flat rubber material that is quite tangle free.They come packaged in a nice hardshell zip-up case that is great for carrying the headphones and the cord in. It is attractive and a nice plus to the whole headphone package.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Hannah Ford, NYC still-life photographer, left a party right before Christmas Eve that evoked too many bad memories and drove to the Thousand Islands region of upstate New York. She ends up stranded in a blizzard outside of Creighton Falls and is rescued by Sam Taylor, moody carpenter and sometimes accountant.Both Hannah and Sam are in need of some Christmas cheer and realize that they might fill in some missing pieces in each other as they spend the holiday snowed in.This is a short, fun book. I wish it had been longer. I WAS glad there was an epilogue to the story.This story is the prologue of a new trilogy "Falling for the Freemans" and the first book in the trilogy FALLING HARD is due out in early 2016.NOTE:  I received this book from Tule Publishing through Net Galley in exchange for my honest review.

I have read all of the books in this series and I have to write that I was disappointed with this offering.  There was just too much going on with no focus.Pendergast and his ward, Constance Greene, are hired to solve a wine robbery. Now, while there was a LOT of wine taken, this just seems pretty piddly for an FBI agent to take on.There was more about Constance in this story, which I enjoyed reading. But otherwise there was a hodgepodge of the robbery, a hidden room, a shipwreck...and if that's not enough, there's an undercurrent of witchcraft plus even more.It just didn't seem like Pendergast was in top form in this book. And to top it all off there's a major cliffhanger. And now we have to wait months for the next book, hoping it will be a better story. Disappointing!NOTE:  I received this book from Grand Central Publishing through Net Galley in exchange for my honest review.

I've been reading John Grisham's books for years and some of his earlier books rank highly in my favorites of all time. I was disappointed this time around. ROGUE LAWYER was a less than so-so read.It really felt like a bunch of short stories that the author tied together by using one lawyer to try all the cases noted - which could have worked but ended up feeling just thrown together.Sebastian Rudd is a defense attorney, not liked by the DA's office, by the police, usually by his clients, and definitely not by his ex-wife. He doesn't have a permanent office since someone firebombed his last one so he does business out of a fortified van, driven by a man who is combination chauffeur/bodyguard/consultant and is called Partner - who he rarely talks to.The book looks at a few of Rudd's current cases, usually alternating chapters, with choppy writing and very one-dimensional characters.I was disappointed in the book and was especially disappointed in the ending, which was abrupt and left some of the plotlines dangling.

I used to think it was funny that my Grandmother used a hot water bottle all the time. Hers was red and she had me fill it every night for her when I was staying with her.Well, now I'm a certain age and using a hot water bottle for my aches and pains is a good thing and I understand my Grandmother better.The hot water bottle that I got is a very pretty shade of purple. It measures 14 1/4" x 8 3/4".  I use it on the back of my neck for neck pain and it also helps my migraines.I've also used it on my cold feet as we haven't turned the furnace up too high yet and it keeps my feet toasty warm. Of course I have to fight off our schnauzer puppies who want to cuddle up to it too.It fills easily with its funnel top and the screw stopper hasn't leaked so far. The instructions that came with the bottle were clear on two points:Don't fill with boiling water.Don't fill the bottle more than 2/3 full.This new take on an old remedy works great.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a Velocity Toys Baja off-road truck. It is 1:10 scale, 15.5" x 9.5" x 6.5". The body is lightweight and is removable. The car has a working suspension front and rear. The tires are soft and have a knobby tread and get good traction. It's fun to drive and has good power.It uses a 7.4V battery that's really two 3.7V batteries put together. It uses a USB charger that has an indicator that changes from red to green when it's done charging. The remote has a steering wheel and a trigger and uses four AA batteries (that are not included).The only thing about it that I thought could be better is the steering. It doesn't turn very sharply and sometimes it takes a couple of tries to get around the corner. Now that I'm more practiced I can get it around a sharp corner if I accelerate and spin the rear tires.This would be a good choice for younger kids as it isn't overly fast and could be driven around inside on a rainy day if you have room.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Christmas is coming up, folks, and this case would make a valued gift or even a stocking stuffer. It comes packaged in a handsome black textured presentation box that is lined with satin.The stainless steel case is made of all metal including the hinges and the clasp. The clasp holds securely until pressed. It has a machine etched finish on top that looks Art Deco-ish. It reminds me of antique fancy cigarette cases I've seen in the past.The case is a nice size, smaller than another one I have. It is 3 3/4" x 3" x 5/8". It has an expando-file inside with seven slots for your credit cards and driver's license/ID. It will hold a few more cards than seven but I wouldn't try more than probably ten so you don't strain the clasp on the case.It fits nicely in my purse but might be uncomfortable in a man's back pocket since it is made of metal. It is small enough, though, that I think a man could carry it in a front pocket easily.This is a classy way to protect your credit cards with its RFID blocking capabilities.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Just in time for Christmas...This will make a great stocking stuffer, especially since it comes in so many colors.I got the purple case and it's a lovely shade of purple.  The case is made of brushed aluminum but has plastic latches. Inside is an expando-file with seven slots for your credit cards or driver's license/ID. More than seven cards will fit in the slots, though. You can probably fit in ten, at least, with no problem.The case is bigger than I thought it would be. It fits nicely in my purse but might be rather thick for a man's pockets.  It measures 4 3/8" x 3" x 11/16".You do need to be careful when opening the case. The cards fit loosely in the slots and if the case is held wrong, the cards will fall out.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is an interesting idea. First, it's a tire gauge with a digital readout. Pressing the gauge button changes the reading from psi, bar, kpa, or kg/cm.It's battery operated with two AAA batteries (not included). It does have a CR2032 battery included to run the tire gauge. The AAA batteries are for the light.I checked the reading against a professional mechanical gauge and the readings were the same for the tire gauge.There is a light that can be turned on but it isn't very bright. It also has a hammer end with a sharp point that could be used to break a window in case of emergency. It's pretty lightweight so a person would have to hit a car window pretty hard to break it. In the handle there is a switch that extends a really sharp blade in case you need to cut a seatbelt. There is a rubber plug that has to be removed so the blade doesn't come out accidentally.This would be a good tool to keep in the glove box of your car.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

These are a great addition to outdoor parties, especially pool parties and any outdoor activity where broken glass could be a problem (namely all of them).These silicone "glasses" hold more than I originally thought they would - 12 ounces. And they can be used for all kinds of liquids, not just wine, so they are good for all ages.They are sturdier (not as squishable) as I figured they might be. They do squish - don't get me wrong. So you aren't going to want to give these to younger children to use - or sloppy drunks. But if you hold them at the bottom of the glass, they hold their shape without a problem.I like that they can be thrown in the dishwasher for clean-up and are reusable.When I'm traveling I like to have a glass of water by my bed and I can throw one of these in my suitcase and have it available at the hotel.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a well made lightweight neck wallet that is great for holding your passport, credit cards, cash or other valuables when traveling.It has an adjustable neck strap (I measured as best I could and it measures 50"-51" at its longest). You can wear around your neck under your clothing or crosswise across your body like a shoulder bag. If you wear it crosswise, you can't see the straps from the front and it's much less noticeable under your clothing. And the strap is long enough to wear it like this, at least for most people.The wallet also has two belt loops on the backside of the wallet, one beige and one black, so it can also be worn this way. The wallet has a soft mesh pouch on the back that you can stuff the neck strap into if you are wearing this on your belt. After placing it on your belt you can then rotate it and slide it into your pants to cover it up.The wallet is made very well with strong straight seams. The zippers are strong YKK well made zippers. It is made of strong rip-resistant nylon except for the soft mesh pouch on the back. The strap is 5/16" wide knit material, sewn on one end and running through a metal ring on the other end (rather than a plastic ring).The RFID blocking is for the long vertical compartment that runs down one side of the wallet. It is plenty big enough to hold your passport plus credit cards and ID such as driver's license.The front compartments are big enough for your phone, cash or other valuables.This is a well made, useful neck wallet - perfect for frequent travelers.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This was quite a departure from author Gerritsen's normal fare. This standalone story tells the tale of a lost waltz "The Incendio" - The Fire.The tale is told in two voices - that of Julia Ansdell in modern days who discovered the waltz in an old book of Gypsy music in an antique shop in Venice, Italy; and in the voice of Jewish Lorenzo Todesco, the violin virtuoso during the death camp days of World War II who wrote the waltz.I was intrigued by both Julia and Lorenzo's stories. The author did a super job of intertwining their stories and letting the reader feel the horror during both times depicted in the book."Beware the ignorant, Lorenzo. They're the most dangerous enemy of all, because they are everywhere."NOTE:  I received this book from Ballantine Books through Net Galley in exchange for my honest review.

Tony Vincenzo is a television executive in NYC. He's just moved to New York and his wife and son, left behind in Los Angeles, are supposed to follow him after the school year ends.On June 7, a massive electromagnetic pulse hits Earth and suddenly everyone's way of life goes back in time a couple hundred years - no electricity, no running water, no phone service, most cars, planes and other vehicles don't work plus much more and it will be months and maybe years before things get back to normal.Vincent has to get back to L.A. and the only way to get there is to walk. So he starts off cross-country and finds that most people are willing to kill to stay alive including himself.This is a super post-apocalyptic story, the first book in a series. I liked the detail that author Knight went into in the story, telling about Vincenzo's travels - from New York across New Jersey to Pennsylvania, West Virginia and Ohio.Along the way he has run-ins with gangs, a husband with a pregnant wife, two small children that need his help, and a serial killer.I'm not sure when the next book in the series is due out but I hope it's soon.One small negative: the author seemed rather obsessed with everyone's bowel habits in the story.

This is a great wig - for Halloween or cosplay or any role-playing you might do. The color is a very attractive deep red. It is 14" long so it is past shoulder length.The wig comes with a separate mesh wig cap which really helps if your own hair is long. The wig cap keeps my hair up and out of the way, under the wig while I'm wearing it.The wig also comes with a wide-toothed comb to comb out the wig when it's mussed.For the price, this deal can't be beat. I've seen wigs of a much lesser quality costing quite a bit more in costume shops.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

There's been an explosion in central Asia, releasing a virus that turns people into zombies (vitality challenged is the PC term).Then werewolves have been discovered in the Everglades.And you know those vampires - they've been hiding in plain sight for centuries all over the world.Dr. Vincent Conrad has convinced seven different countries, including the U.S., to house these monsters in giant theme parks called Monsterland.Wyatt Baldwin (no relation to Alex) and his best friends get invited to the grand opening of the U.S. park in Copper Valley, California and then the blood and guts hit the fan.This was a quick monster tale released just in time for Halloween. Even though it has teenagers in it, I wouldn't necessarily recommend it to younger teens. There is some strong language and, as I mentioned, some blood and guts.This was a fun read with family dynamics, horror, and political commentary in it.NOTE: I received this book in exchange for my honest review.

This is a small 12V mini air compressor that can be plugged into a cigarette lighter or auxiliary port in a car or truck. The compressor itself works okay. This would be good for bicycles, balls, or to keep in your trunk in case you had a low tire.  But it wouldn't be suitable to use for car tires regularly or for anything large.The cord is 7 1/2 feet long and not long enough to reach the back tires on my Toyota pickup. The air gauge is a good idea but the one on this one is defective. I connected it to a tire that had 32 psi and the gauge showed 80 psi. With the short cord and bad gauge, I give it a three out of five stars.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a 1:14 scale sand truggy. It is 13.5" x 8". It has a 2.4 GHz remote control that MUST be paired to the car before you can run it. Turn on the switch on the car and then hold down the trigger on the remote before switching it on.The car weighs 1 lb.12 oz. and seems well-built. It has a working suspension that has good spring to it and soft rubber tires.It uses a 6.4V rechargeable battery in the car and a 9V battery in the remote. Batteries are included.The car is fun to drive but isn't overly fast. It would be suitable to run in the house on a rainy day if you have the space and would be a good choice for kids as young as eight years old.The only negative thing I found is that the battery charger is noisy when it's charging the battery. The noise does go away as the battery charges up.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a really fun RC racing buggy. It is 1:10 scale, which isn't exactly small. It measures 17.5" x 10". The rubber tires are 3.25" in diameter. It has a working suspension. The car itself weighs 2 lbs. 7 oz.It runs on a rechargeable 9.6V battery and it's pretty fast, up to 15 mph. The remote control uses a 9V battery and that is included. The range is up to 131 feet.The remote MUST be paired to the car before it will work. With the car switched on you hold the trigger down on the remote and then turn the remote switch on.This car has a brake function in addition to forward, reverse, and turning.I tried the car out in the street in front of our house and it's a blast to drive. It's fast and the steering works well. I ran it close to 100 feet down the street and back without losing signal. It seems pretty tough also. I ran it over a bump that put it in the air and it didn't hurt anything on the buggy.It comes with everything that is needed to run it.NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

The space station Outer Earth is a ring, divided into six sectors, 18 miles around and sitting 300 miles above Earth. The last million humans are what's left from Earth, evacuated in 2234, and have been living on the station for over a century.Riley Hale is a tracer - a courier on the space station, getting packages to their destination while dodging gangs, and taking items in barter that will help her group of tracers, the Devil Dancers.This is one fast moving story, full of action and intrigue.
