Rachel also strikes up an unlikely relationship with Jake, a creative 12 year old boy, who loves to sew, read woman's fashion magazines and hates his mother's lazy and boorish boyfriend.Multiple story lines make up the parts of the whole, featuring an array of characters who march to their own drummer.  Each character is dealing with their own challenges and sorrows. This debut novelist also tackled some pressing topics.  For me, personally, some parts were a little over the top as the book lost some of the plausibility by the end of the story.  I imagine it would be tailor made for fans of John Irving.  Very different and inventive, just not my writing style.

If you have cats or dogs, you need this handy little flashlight.  Luckily my current two dogs are well trained and has not had an "accident" since we adopted them 3 years ago.  I can't say the same for my past puppies, as one of them was naughty on our rugs.  This would have been perfect.  I have followed one of my dogs out to the lawn at night to check out the Zookki.  I works great on urine, shining brightly in the grass.If I regularly stayed in hotels for business travel, this inexpensive little light would be the first thing I would pack.  Even when I go on my vacations, I always have that creepy feeling about the blankets and sheets on the beds.  This would tell if I'm paranoid or there really is a problem.I was offered the Zookki LED Blacklight flashlight in exchange for an honest review.  I feel at the price offered on Amazon with free Prime shipping, this item offers excellent value and indispensable if a frequent traveler.

The Song of Hartgrove Hall is a beautifully written book that has a mixture of family dynamics, music and a realistic love triangle.  The core of the story, however, is also about Hartgrove Hall, a once grand house in the English countryside, that has become dilapidated due to the war and mismanagement  of money.  The youngest of the three Fox-Talbot brothers, Harry, who is nicknamed Fox, uses his memories of the past 70 years in order to tell his engrossing story of his passion for collecting old songs, composing music and for his older brother's wife, Edie.  I loved The House of Tyneford, a previous book by this author, however, I felt this novel was far superior.The book alternates between the past and the present, using lingering flashbacks to 1946, the end of the war and their country estate. The three Fox brothers are elated to finally have Hartgrove Hall back after the war and  “a parade of British regiments followed by the Americans”.  Their father, the General, has little interest in running the properties when their estate manager retires.  The three brother together make a pact  to choose the life of farming, in order to keep the estate from being destroyed and the lands sold.  For Harry Fox, his passion for music and Edie, who is his kindred spirit and  called “The Little Nightingale” for her beautiful voice, this is a pact he is eventually unable to keep.In the year 2000, Harry Fox is reeling from the death of his beloved wife Edie after many blissful years of marriage.  Harry has achieved many of his aspirations and “a jolly decent footnote in British musical history”.  Life, however, no longer has any meaning without his wife and Fox finds that his days are both tedious and endless now that he no longer hears the music in his head, “for the first time in my life, silence taunted me” It is his discovery that his four year old, demanding  grandson, is a piano prodigy, that slowly breathes importance into his daily existence.This author knows how to draw the readers into the world of old English gentry with accomplished character development,  evocative settings and a plot full of passion and betrayal. The novel provides  interesting accounts of Fox's song collecting and the eclectic characters who provides the songs.  Highly recommended for those who appreciate Kate Morton,  music in its many forms , a convincing love story,  and a redemptive tale about how families survive and endure and what it tales to heal after loss.

I had a need to enhance my wireless connection performance in my living room.  I have tried other wi-fi extenders with mediocre success.  This Motoraux Wireless-N Range Extender was fairly easy to set-up as a "repeater".  Most users will choose the repeater mode of the four modes offered. They are Router, AP, Repeater and WISP.  The included instructions are in plain English and well written for someone familiar with networking or computers.I have some experience with computers and network language, so for me, it was fairly easy to connect this to my wireless network.  If you find computer "stuff" difficult, this will be Greek to you, so you will probably need help from someone.As far as performance goes, I normally get over 50 mbps on download wirelessly when close to my router.  When I am in the living room, I would get about 25 mbps wirelessly.  When I connected through the Motoraux extender in the living room, I actually was getting only 20 mbps which was less than I was getting wirelessly from my main router.  So, for my purposes, the Motoraux did not increase my performance in my living room, however other people will have different needs than I have and this extender might work just fine.  I also,am not 100% positive that I am using it correctly, and it did setup up properly. I will update this review if I find that I set it up incorrectly. Like i said before, I haven't had any extenders that offered exceptional reception and this is no different.This Motoraux range extender is offered at a reasonable price.  I was offered this product for an honest review and I think the Motoraux extender offers good value for the functionality offered.

I love this thermal water.  As others have said, it is very refreshing.  I'm not sure if it is the very fine mist or the ingredients, but it seems to cool your face and add a softness to your skin.  I normally spray it on my face in the morning, let it sit for a minute, gently pat it off, then apply my makeup.I wasn't familiar with exactly what "thermal spring water" was, so I did an online search and found that thermal water comes from deep underground, is rich in minerals, is very pure, free of bacteria and pollutants.  Thermal water has anti-inflammatory properties which could aid in skin conditions like psoriasis or eczema.  It has been used for thousands of years to relieve arthritis and joint pain.The only ingredient on the bottle listed is "water".  The label states that the average concentration of minerals per liter are as follows:Bicarbonate 396 mgCalcium  140 mgSilicates  30 mgSelenium  60 mgZinc  20 micro gramsCopper  5 micro gramsResidu sec a 180 degrees C  440 micro gramsThis La Roche-Posay Thermal spring water is reasonably priced for such a refreshing addition to my facial regimen.  Highly recommended.

I drink decaf green tea every morning with breakfast for it's antioxidant benefits. When I was offered this supplement for an honest review, I was excited to try it.  Firstly, the capsule is not too big, about medium sized (see pic).  As a benefit, there is also Vitamin C at 60mg.  I had no problem with digestion after taking the supplement.  What I really like is that it is GMO free - made in the USA and Decaffeinated.  You can read online the many benefits of Green Tea as an antioxidant and if you don't have a liking for liquid Green Tea, this is a great substitute.The Amazon price with free Prime shipping is very cost effective for the quality and benefit offered by this supplement.

I have been taking a Probiotic for years to aid in digestion and it has worked for me.  This formula is a mixture of enzymes and probiotics to aid in digestion, gas removal, and bloating.  I have taken this Zenwise product for about 2 weeks daily and it doesn't upset my stomach.  It's is a bit on the large capsule size, but I manage.  I really like the purity of the product and that is made in the USA without GMO's.The pricing for this enzyme/probiotic product is very cost effective at the price offered by Amazon with free Prime shipping.  I was offered a sample for an honest review and I feel this Zenwise supplement offers excellent value for the quality and price.

Warning: If you are going to buy this or any Jawbone Tracker go to the Jawbone website and check whether your smartphone is compatible before purchasing.  There are a limited number of devices which can pair with this UP2.  Fortunately, my daughter has a Samsung S5, but my older IPhone 4 could not pair. I did get my Acer A4-810FHD tablet to pair as it has Bluetooth 4.0.  I called Jawbone support and apparently they can only work with Bluetooth 4.0 or higher, which cuts out many older phones and tablets.Once I downloaded the app for the Samsung S5, the paring was fast and simple. You have to charge the band before use and that took about 2 hours on my laptop 3.0 USB.  The proprietary charge cable is only about 3" long and stiff, and doesn't plug into the UP2, but is connected with magnets.  Pretty cool tech.  While charging 3 small LED's light on the band intermittently. When only one stays lit, you know the band is fuilly charged.  I love the thickness and lightweight of the UP2, as it is very comfortable on your wrist. The band is adjustable for different size writs by simply adjusting the clasp.The software is pretty straightforward and simple with a friendly user interface.  After entering your stats and submitting an email address and password, then verifying the email, you are ready to go count your steps and monitor your sleep.  Goals are easily set, as are alerts.Jawbone, at one time, made the best single ear bluetooth headsets, and the quality was second to none.  I expect no less from this fitness band.

I never heard of Gua Sha massage so I did a brief Internet search and discovered it to be an ancient Chinese skin scraping treatment.  The traditional treatment can cause bruising, but of course, I will use this as a massage tool.  My husband has been into Chinese medicine, massage and exercise (Tai Chi and Chi Gung) for many years and has always been interested in meridians, reflexology and accupressure. He's always poking or massaging me, my daughter or himself.  The feet have many reflexology points relating to every part of your body and this Leosense Jade Massage Tool is perfect for getting into those sore points or for broad strokes just about anywhere on your body.  It improves circulation anywhere you use it, which is very healthy and if done regularly can improve your health.This Jade tool is the perfect size in your hand.  It reminds me of a stone "feely" from my youth. It is perfectly smooth and the different grooves and corners fit anywhere you need it, and you can adjust the perfect pressure for your own preference.  This would make a perfect gift for anyone but most importantly yourself.

After living through Hurricane Sandy without power for two weeks, I take my flashlights very seriously.  This Soonfire CREE Flashlight is built to last. It is industrial grade, tactical quality flashlight, made of black anodized aluminum.  It has only one Cree LED bulb and comes with a single 18650 lithium ion battery with a 2600 mah rating.  Amazon sells replacement batteries if needed and they are very reasonably priced.  A charger built specifically for this battery is included and plugs into a regular wall 110v outlet. It took a few hours for the initial charge.  There is a 8" lanyard included which attaches to the body for easy hanging or for safety wrapped around your wrist.  The body has a sturdy belt or pocket clip. There is an on/off button at the end of the battery cap.  There is another button on the body with which you can activate the strobe, lower the light intensity, or turn off the light. The flashlight feels very solid in your hand and is the perfect size, easily fitting in a pocket.  The light itself has a bright spot in the center which occupies the center of the light and is about 1/10 of the beam.At night, I easily lit up my trees in my backyard at a distance of about 50 feet.  After doing a search on Amazon for CREE tactical flashlights, this Soonfire offers very good value for the price and the quality offered.  Flashlights are one item you never have enough of.  I was provided a sample in exchange for an honest review.

I have never eaten a mulberry, in fact I have never seen one or been offered one until now.  These Immortalitea Sun Dried Mulberries are a product of Turkey, as they only grow in that region of the world.  They are an ancient fruit with many health benefits. They are a small fruit, about twice the size of a raisin or dried cranberry. These are unsweetened as the only ingredient on the package is organic mulberries. They are somewhat sweet, not tart with no discernible aftertaste.  I have tried them on oatmeal, oat cereal, and in yogurt.  They enhance the taste of all and certainly add to the health benefit.  I am also adding them to my homemade "trail mix" which is a stable in our household.  The 10oz bag offers good value at this price point for an organic, non-GMO, no gluten, extremely healthy fruit.  An interesting fact is that mulberry trees are the only trees which host silk worms.After some research online, here are some findings:  They compose of health promoting phyto-nutrient compounds like polyphenol pigment antioxidants, minerals, and vitamins that are essential for  optimum health.  The berries contain resveratrol, the antioxidant found in grapes that aids in heart and blood vessel health  Mulberries are a good source of potassium, iron, manganese and magnesium.  They are rich in B vitamins, including niacin, B6, vitamin K, and folic acid.  High in vitamin C, also known as a very potent antioxidant.All in all, they are a superfruit, delicious, reasonably priced and will be a permanent addition to our diet.  A sample was provided for an honest review, and I am glad I accepted the offer.

The Good Goodbye is reminiscent of another novel with a similar premise, Afterwards by Rosumund Lupton.  This author's comparisons to Jody Picoult are also apropos, without the many metaphors.  This is certainly one of those novels that you are unable to put down until you know how things will turn out for the three central characters.  It is in equal parts a family drama, a coming of age-story, a mystery and a psychological thriller.  While there is a lot to grapple with and initially the plot can be confusing, all the parts come meticulously together, as the mystery surrounding these families' tragedies unravel slowly and suspensefully.Natalie has a loving family and has realized a dream when she opened a restaurant six years ago with her brother-in-law Vince. At the beginning of the novel, Vince, has made a very poor investment, which has put both families in financial peril and compromised their once tight knit relationships.  The impact of Vince's actions has far reaching repercussions, as it trickles down into the lives of their 18 year old daughters, Rory and Arden.  Arden, is Natalie and Theo's daughter, she aspires to be an artist and is reticent and sensitive. She lives in the shadow of her more outgoing cousin.  Rory, Vince and Gabrielle's  daughter is popular and outwardly confident with both sexes.  The two cousins look alike and have been inseparable growing up, almost like sisters.  They share a complex relationship, however, for the first time in their relationship, welcome a change. Rory is looking forward to attending Harvard and Arden an art school 3,000 miles away on the west coast.  For different reasons, both cousins are upset, when due to these financial problems, their plans are waylaid and  they have to attend a community college, as roommates.  Six weeks into their freshman year, they both remain in critical condition in intensive care, after a fire in their dorm room has also left a mutual male friend dead.  Soon after the police start asking the hard questions, arousing suspicions, and leaving both sets of  parents wondering how well they really knew their children. The novel is told in alternating chapters, shifting from the past to the present, from Natalie, Arden and Rory's perspective, as secret upon secret is slowly revealed and we learn what really happened and who is responsible.A psychologically nuanced and heartbreaking novel that immerses you into the lives of these characters and holds you captive until the final page.  Yes, there is also a perfunctory twist, which felt believable and a resolution that made sense.

I've been taking Jarrow Astaxanthin for about a year.  I take it in conjunction with my Fish Oil.  I also used to take Krill Oil but I found out that the active component in Krill Oil is Astraxanthin and it is missing in Fish Oil. Like all supplements and vitamins, it's nearly impossible to quantify how effective it is in your overall health.  Krill Oil is very expensive so this supplement rounds out my necessary Fish Oil daily requirement for much lower cost.I have used Jarrow brand supplements for many years and find them to be very high quality at reasonable cost. Highly recommended.

I have very dry, cracked heals and have tried Urea based heal creams which work very well, but are very strong chemically.  This Dead Sea Foot Cream is mild in comparison but does an excellent job in healing cracked skin on your feet.  I am a big fan of Tea Tree oil, as I add it to my wash for it's disinfecting properties.  I also love the smell of Tea Tree oil, but I don't smell it in this cream.  Actually, I would prefer if it did smell a bit more like the oil, but the smell is very pleasant anyway.  The cream does not have a strong floral smell, but a rather pleasant, clean odor.  The cream is not greasy and rubs into the cream very well, not leaving any film or residue.  I bet this cream would also work on your hands when the winter brings those severe painful cuticle cuts.  The 5.1 oz. tube should last a good while as very little is needed for each application. I find products from Israel to be of exceptional quality and this Dead Sea Foot Cream is no exception. Highly recommended.

As far as I'm concerned French lavender is the only lavender.  Having been lucky enough to see the gorgeous fields of lavender while driving through France in my youth, this Sabai Wellness Pure Undiluted lavender oil transports me back with it's beautiful aroma.  The smell is very gentle, refined, not at all cosmetic smelling.  If you already don't have a aroma diffuser, I suggest you get one, but it is equally luxurious when a few drops are placed in simmering water on the stove.If you haven't smelled lavender, the aroma is soft, gentle, not too flowery and tends to relax you.  I have allergies which include some flowers, but the lavender does not bring on any allergic reaction. As you only need a few drops , the 15ml bottle should last a long time.  I was offered a sample of this lavender oil for an honest review and I feel at this price for this quality French lavender oil, it makes a perfect gift to yourself or someone you care about.  Highly recommended.

The challenges of  writing historical fiction are probably daunting, especially how to imagine a person who really lived and capture the essence to a bygone era.  Adriana  Trigiani is able to transport the reader to the 1930 golden age of Hollywood and the star making studio system, which made and then controlled the lives of some of Hollywood greatest actors and actress.This is the story of film star Loretta Young, her family and the two great loves of her life, Spencer Tracy and Clark Gable.  Both of these men were married and came with their own set of baggage.  While the book was centered around  Loretta and her career, loves and loss, she is not the only star, as we are also drawn into the world of her secretary Alda.  Alda is originally a novice, at the home of unmarried pregnant women at the Convent of St. Elizabeth.  When the convent is no longer deemed to be Alda's future vocation, she  is sent by her superiors to be a secretary to Miss Young.  Alda is immediately welcomed into the colorful and supportive Young family of predominately women, while she learns her trade. Alda also eventually finds herself at the center of her own romantic awakening. The two woman quickly bond and their friendship and continued loyalty to each other was for me the best part of the book.Adriana Trigiani certainly did her research as she weaves together a cinematic cache of film royalty.  The problem is that these famous men and women do not always come alive on the pages.  I found myself asking would Spencer Tracy really act and talk this way? The events and situations in which the characters were placed should have surprised me, however, felt artificial and redundant.  It was difficult to really invest in any of these supposedly larger then life movie icons, as they could have been anyone.  4 stars for the depiction of the time and place, 2 stars for characterizations rounded up to a 3.

My husband has very tired, flat feet with an occasional bout of plantar fascitis, so when offered the TheraFlow Dual foot wooden massage roller for review, I jumped at the opportunity.First, let me say the company, TheraFlow, communicates with the buyer exceptionally well. I received a thank you email, and a followup email on the use of the roller.  I buy and test many products from Amazon, but TheraFlow is a step above routine.Now to the roller, second hand from my husband, although I did give it a try and really enjoyed it.  The roller is made out of wood and the assembly, finish, functionality are perfect.  The instructions say that it takes awhile to get used to the feeling, as it tickles when first used, but after several uses, that sensation diminishes and any amount of pressure you wish can be applied.  The four rollers with small bumps feel very relaxing and therapeutic.  The fifth roller with the larger knobs can be used to get those specific spots you want to work on.  By the way, TheraFlow's website offers a two page PDF of all the foot's reflexology pressure points and their associated body structures, like shoulders, heart, liver, sinuses, etc.If you have any foot ailments, this is great addition to make your feet feel better and make your whole system feel better.  Since, I am a firm believer in Acupressure, Acupuncture, meridians, Eastern medicine, reflexology, Chi, etc. , I know, without any doubt, this foot massage is helping my well being.  Although, I received this TheraFlow foot massager in exchange for an honest review, I will definitely be buying a few for gifts as I'm certain anyone will appreciate the health benefits and the quality of the product.

I have had a few of these multi spray hose nozzles in metal and plastic.  This Amir nozzle is of very good quality and functions exceptionally well. The 8 patterns are pretty standard, but I mostly use the shower and the jet.  The shower is perfect for watering plants as it's a gentle stream but delivers a lot of water.  The jet stream is very strong, not quite a power washer, but it really gets the job done.  The jet spray can reach about 25 feet, so it's perfect for the plants my hose can't reach or for cleaning spots that are too high to reach.What makes this much better than any other multi-spray nozzles is that you can adjust the volume of any of the 8 sprays with the knob on the top of the nozzle, from full force to a dribble.  The package comes with 2 additional rubber gaskets should you lose the one already inserted into the nozzle.I was offered a sample of the Amir Nozzle for an honest review and I feel although more expensive than cheaper models at the local Wallymart, this nozzle offers good value for the price. It should last longer also because the frame is metal not plastic.

My shoulder length hair was dry and brittle after two months of fun in the sun. I also have a lot of grey under my colored hair, which tends to kink up if not conditioned properly. Emergencee is an excellent product in every way. It comes in a sleek and easy to use bottle with a flip cap. It has a wonderful smell, a little like a pina colada, with coconut prevalent. I would not have minded, however, my hair was odorless after rinsing thoroughly in the shower. I let my hair dry in the sun and I could immediately see the difference. My hair looked shiny and felt soft and manageable, with no frizz. The conditioner appeared to make the colored streaks in my hair more vibrant. My hair stayed in this excellent condition until I washed it again. I was pleased that I felt the exact same way the second and third time I used this product. It appears that all of the high end conditioners cost approximately the same amount of money. Emergencee marine collagen was worth every penny.

I was skeptical at first to try this "necklace" type bluetooth headset. I thought perhaps it would be uncomfortable around my neck, but I was wrong. In fact, they are very comfortable both around my neck and in my ears. The earbuds are rather small and fit very well, and there are two additional rubber sets should you lose or would like to try a different size.After charging for about 1/2 hour with the standard USB to micro-USB cable provided (no wall plug), the paring with my laptop and phone for testing went smoothly and were recognized immediately. The sound was very clear with good treble and mid range, but commonly with earbuds in this price range the bass is limited, but the sound experience was much more than acceptable.The earbuds are magnetic and store at the end of the "necklace". The magnet is not very strong, so the earbuds frequently detach, but due to the design they don't go far. Wearing the headset hiking yielded a pleasant experience as they are very light and you hardly feel the headset on your neck or in your ears. Phone calls were answered easily and both the reception and transmission of voice was clear. The placement of the buttons on the "necklace" are very easy to use, in fact, much easier than the wired type bluetooth headsets I have tested.I was offered a sample for an honest review and I feel these Soundpeats Wireless Bluetooth Headphones are good value for the price. I have used other Soundpeats products and they are good quality, well made electronics for the price offered.

My grandmother asked me to tell you she's sorry covers many different genres, however, never feels as though there were two many to reach a perfect balance.  Part coming of age story, part a sophisticated fairy tale and part family dynamics all three parts make a perfect whole.Elsa is seven years old and different. She does not yet realize what a gift she has and is bullied by the children at school. In addition her parents are separated and her mother is expecting a new baby with her boyfriend. Elsa is not alone, she has a wonderfully eccentric grandmother with a compelling history who takes care of her while her mother works. Elsa's grandmother speaks to Elsa is a secret language and tells her amazing stories about the imaginary Land- of-Almost- Awake.  When Granny dies of cancer, she leaves Elsa with the daunting task of delivering a series of letters apologizing for her array of slights that  may  have hurt other. While taking up the quest for granny, Elsa realizes that what you learn in fairy tales transcends to real life and those around her.  A unique one of a kind book.

Many, many years ago one of my closest friends had prostate cancer. After his operation he went to a specialist who was in expert in prostate cancer and the recovery.  He put my friend on massive (20,000) units of D-3 daily to get his D-3 level up to a minimum of 50.  This was new science at the time, in fact, it was the first time I even heard of Vitamin D-3.  Since that time, I have been taking about 4000 to 5000 units per day and my D-3 level has gone from the high teens to over 50.  I have used several brands of D-3 and PCNL D-3 is the only one I have used which offers 5,000 units in one pill.  That makes my supplement routine simpler, just one capsule per day.  PCNL capsules are clear gelcaps and very small, so they shouldn't present anyone a problem with swallowing them.  There is no aftertaste, not that it is common with D-3.  I was offered a sample of PCNL D-3 for an honest review.  At this price point, you get a year's supply for $20 with shipping. That's very good value.

My husband and I have been taking CoQ10 for about 15 years daily.  It is very difficult to rate supplements, as I am not a chemist, and their effectiveness is also very difficult to quantify. PCNL products are made in the USA and contain no preservatives.  My husband is on a low dose of Crestor and his cardiologist suggested he take CoQ10 with the statin because the statin can lower your natural CoQ10 levels.  He has never had any muscle cramping, which I hear is fairly common with statin drugs. The beige colored gelcap is oval shaped, easy to swallow and about the size of your fingernail.  I was provided a sample for testing and an honest review.

Phyto 5 pigmentation cream is an excellent product. I have also used  Phyto Peel and have been pleased with the results from both products.  The ingredients are from organic farming and the product is certified organic.  Phyto-Bio ceutical products are made in Switzerland.  Phyto 5 pigmentation cream has the antioxidant Eldelweiss, which of course I know from the movie The Sound of Music. Edelweiss is derived from Edelweiss flowers grown at high altitudes in the Swiss alps. The edelweiss plant contains phytochemicals such a chlorogenic acid (present in coffee) and luteolin which is reported to demonstrate antioxidant activity twice as much as you get from Vitamin C.You apply this light weight and fresh smelling cream to affected areas twice a day after cleaning your face. I started using only once at night on two sunspots on both my cheek and neck with valid results, in a short amount of time. The sunspot on my neck was the size of a pinkie nail and it has lightened considerably. I do not feel that my skin is either red or irritated after using.  I will wait until the fall to use over my entire face as I assume you need to be careful with this product if you are going to be in the sun, even using sunscreen. Keep in mind that Phyto 5 pigmentation cream is not inexpensive, however, you are purchasing a superior product that delivers and will probably not need to be purchased again.

If you ever wondered about what really goes on behind the closed doors of the rich and famous, look no further.  Author Hilary Liftin really appears to have the inside scoop about a very famous Hollywood breakup, which involves an action fiction hero, his down to earth wife and a cult-like religious group.  Even without this similarity, Movie Star by Lizzie Pepper is a realistic and well written book about the pitfalls behind the fairy tale marriages we read about.  The characters are well developed and sympathetic. I think it drives home the point that even with all the fame, prestige and money you will ever need, it is often not enough to make us happy. This book has everything you need for a  perfect beach read  that will divert you with its enjoyable plot.

There have been numerous excellent technical reviews about this Bose QuietComfort 20 headphones, so I won't go there.  What I will talk about is the quality of the equipment and the quality of the sound.  Bose is probably the foremost innovative sound engineering company out there and it was started in the US by an MIT professor. These QuietComfort headphones are no exception to the Bose line. They are very comfortable and secure in your ear with the highest quality. I assume, proprietary silicon ear stabilizers and plugs. They are lightweight, even feeling weightless in your ear because of that stability, feeling like they were custom fit.  Although these are meant for Apple products, of which I only have an IPhone, they can be used on any equipment with a 3.5mm plug.  I tested them on a Kindle, an Acer tablet, my Dell desktop, and a portable AM/FM radio.  All performed flawlessly with the fullest, clearest, bass, mid range, and treble sounds I've ever experienced with a headset or earphones.  Simply incredible sound, particularly the bass.  They produce a sound which rivals speakers which have bass speakers. The noise cancelling feature worked well, by just flipping the switch on the control module.These are very expensive for earphones, but in this case, they are worth every penny. If you are an audiophile with some extra bucks, I would highly recommend these Bose earphones.  For those with a more plebeian ear, perhaps a less expensive set might suffice.

For those getting a bit older and having difficulty seeing see small print, this magnifier is a Godsend.  Not only is the magnifier large and clear, but it has 2 LED lights to brighten your reading, crafting, or any close work you may need.  The flexible neck and the stand are very secure and steady, yet you can easily adjust the glass to finely focus on your task.  In addition, there is a quarter sized super-magnifier when you really need extra magnification.Routinely, I have issues trying to read instructions, part numbers on appliances or electronic equipment and the older I get the smaller the print seems to be, so this magnifier is perfect for all those little tasks.  A sample was provided for an honest review.  Highly recommended.

I have taken longer to write this review than any other book since I have become a Vine Member.  What a complex book to read, what a complex book to review.I happen to have gone to college in New York city during the years of 1975-1979 when a good portion of the book takes place.  This author has been able to evoke the time and  place so well that I felt as though I was 18 and living in NYC again.  .  There is no doubt that this debut author took a huge risk and made mistakes along the way.  City on Fire is a complex, sweeping novel full of carefully researched detail.  The characters that the story revolves around are eclectic, realistic and for the most part engaging. It is unfortunately overlong and it is over plotted.  At 550 pages this may have been the masterpiece that critics are hailing, at 913 pages there was much too much padding and tangled histories of the characters to dredge through.  At times some of the chapters felt forced, as though the author was grappling for themes and content that were not  necessary.  I believe that this author was unable to part with a single story line or word, and that he poured his heart and soul into these pages, so someone at Knopf should have tried harder during the editing process. A shooting in Central Park on New Year's Eve becomes the mystery that all the individuals' stories revolve around and which are eventually linked together by.  We share this journey with a wide array of characters of all ages, from all walks of life, who are in love with the city. While deserving of  a 5 star review for creativity, beautiful writing and compelling characters, the unnecessarily long and inconsequential tangents unfortunately make it a 3 star read.

This is a well crafted Pleather bag with modern, yet classic styling.  I would consider this to be a large bag, which would hold a lot of daily gear from makeup to a Kindle.  It has a dull black finish which is mottled to resemble a tight patterned leather and the metal appears as a antiqued nickel finish.  There are two side pockets perfect for keys or your phone, large enough for even a new Samsung 6.  The interior is cloth lined with a small zippered compartment. There are no dividers, so it is just a large, cavernous open bag.  There is no zipper closure, but a single magnetic buckle to keep the top closed.  The bottom is flat and much wider than the top of the bag. As others have mentioned, the strap is a bit short to comfortably wear on your shoulder, as it would be tight under your armpit, unless you are a very petite woman.I was provided a sample for an honest review.  Except for the limitations I expressed, this is a nice looking, quality bag.  4 stars.

I have been an avid fan of Elizabeth George and the (Lynley series) from the beginning.  Playing for the Ashes and Deception on his Mind are in my humble opinion two of the finest psychological mysteries I have ever read.  Many others in the long running series were almost as good. Unfortunately, in the past few years the caliber of writing has declined.  George's last two books were a struggle to get through and if not for Amazon Vine I may not have purchased  A Banquet of Consequences.  Happily, I can give an enthusiastic two thumbs up for her latest.A Banquet of Consequences is flawless, as Elizabeth George has gone back to her roots and written a complex, and nuanced character driven book that is both plausible and heartfelt.  This time around, George takes her time developing her characters.  There is the psychological undercurrent of a highly dysfunctional family, however, nothing is over-the-top and there is a plethora of clues and intelligent plotting.The story alternates between London and Dorset and begins 39 months before a murder, then 2 months before, 6 weeks before and finally in the here and now.  William Goldacre, is trying to win back the affections of his girlfriend Lily Foster after another one of his emotional breakdowns has waylaid their 10 month relationship.  This will not happen, as William in despair commits suicide by jumping from a cliff. William has an older brother Charlie, who is a psychologist and is devastated by his brother’s death.  His inability to help his brother has caused a fissure within his own marriage to his wife India and they are now estranged.  The brother’s mother, Caroline, has a strong and domineering personality and does not play well with others, causing strife wherever she goes.  Caroline has secured a position as an assistant for a well-respected feminist lecturer/writer, Clare.  Caroline is jealous of the relationship Clare has with her friend and editor, Rory.  Caroline's second husband is having an affair with one of his employees.  As the story unfolds all of their dark secrets and motivations come to light after Clare is found poisoned.  One of Elizabeth George’s greatest strengths is her spot-on observation of people and their psychological states.  All the pieces come together and the ending made perfect sense with the story staying taut and surprising.Detective Inspector Thomas Lynely is on the case in London.  Lynely appeared to be going through the motions after the murder of his beloved wife Helen and perhaps his inertia and erratic behavior will remain a thing from the past.  His partner, the incomparable Barbara Havers is trying to strike a compromise with her true self and the role that Detective Superintendent Isabelle Arderly is insisting she play.  While Havers has always had flashes of brilliance as a homicide detective, her inability to follow the rules has her in jeopardy of being transferred to Berwick-upon-Tweed if she steps out of line again.  Thomas Lynley once again pleads Havers’ case to their superior and she is partnered with Detective Sergeant Nkata Winston to handle the Dorset investigation.  The dynamics between Lynley and Havers has always been only of the stronger aspects of the series and their banter includes some delightful moments of needed levity.  Lynley is courting Daidre the veterinarian and their relationship is reminiscent of his earlier relationship with his departed wife Helen.  Daidre is not ready to make a full commitment to the aristocratic Thomas Lynley.Like the best of Elizabeth George, these character are fated by their past mistakes, temperament and character flaws.  All is forgiven, A Banquet of Consequences is a keeper

Up until about 3 years ago, oils like Tamanu, Tea Tree, Oregano were hardly used and little known.  Well, things have changed and you see them all over and I've had  the opportunity to try all of them on my skin or my families'.This Tamanu oil is 100% organic, which is something I look for and appreciate. It comes in a dark amber bottle with a pump.  The oil itself is somewhat thick with the color and consistency of Olive Oil.  It has an earthy smell, which is rather pleasant and not strong at all like Oregano Oil.It goes on your skin smoothly and is absorbed readily.  It can be washed off easily with soap and water or shampoo.My husband has had psoriasis for years which comes and goes.  He has been using the Tamanu Oil for about 4 weeks now once a day.  It has cleared up his psoriasis, but I must say his psoriasis is a mild case.  Sometimes it just goes away on its own, sometimes he uses a cortisone cream.  The Tamanu Oil worked, but since this is not a scientific study, it's hard to proclaim it's effectiveness, but more an incidental conclusion.The next time his psoriasis flares up, he will definitely try this oil again.The 1 oz bottle should last a very long time even with daily use, as very little is needed as the oil covers a lot of skin area. It doesn't feel "heavy" on your skin and makes your skin feel very smooth.  If like my husband, you have psoriasis, I would highly recommend giving this Organic Tamanu Oil a try.  I received a sample for an honest review.

I have always loved reading sprawling family sagas, with a touch of historical detail, written by Susan Howatch and Penny Vincenzi. The Rocheforts is a worthy addition to add to this list.  The setting is France and the time frame the late 1800's to the 1930's.  The ambitious but never redundant story focuses on the lives and loves of two families the Rocheforts and the Rouvieres.  The Rocheforts are a wealthy manufacturing family and the Rouvieres prosperous farmers.  Marriage and business as usual will unite the two families, however, there is plenty of ensuing drama to tear them apart.  The  Rocheforts will most certainly appeal to readers who enjoy family sagas which takes place in an atmospheric setting.

2:48 MinsI've been using my Echo for about 2 months now and it has become a "can't live without" piece of technology.  The first thing I do in the morning is ask Alexa "what's the weather today?", followed by "what's the weather for the week?"  Time for breakfast and the Echo serenades me with one of playlists, previously setup with my Echo app on my Kindle. Before leaving for work, I ask "how is the traffic?"  When I finally sit down after a day at work and turn on the TV, I'm constantly asking Echo questions about TV shows, actors, movies, etc like Alexa, "Who won the Oscar for best picture this year?" The applications for Echo are endless and I love that Amazon continuously updates the software directly through the always connected wi-fi.  Each time a new function is added, I get an email from Amazon explaining the new application, like when they added being able to re-order items from your past Amazon orders, just by telling Alexa the item.  Amazing technology!The Echo was very simple to setup by using the Echo app for Android on my Kindle and on my Acer tablet.  When on Amazon's Prime Music pages, you can setup playlists of your favorite artists or use the already assembled playlists, like 50 Great Classic Rock Songs or Country Hits.  Then when you wish just tell Echo to play them.Echo itself has a stunning design with a black, matte finish.  It takes up very little space with a 3" diameter and about 9" tall.  There is a power connection on the bottom with the supplied power adapter with cord.  On the top is a microphone mute button and a "action" button which allows you to ask for something without saying Alexa.  The blue LED ring around the top where the microphones are located brightens when it finds the direction of your voice (very robot like and a bit startling at first)The speakers are located on the sides behind the grill which goes completely around the circumference.  The volume can be adjust by telling Alexa a number from 1 to 10 or just saying louder or softer.  The sound is really clear and can be very loud, easily filling a room.  The only thing I can relate the sound quality to,  is a Bose speaker.  Alexa's voice is very pleasant with no discernible accent.  She can't answer all questions you ask, but she can answer a very good percentage of them, if you know how to ask.  Anything found in Wikipedia, which covers a lot of information, is within Echo's capabilities.Anybody who I show my Echo to, wants one. I think Amazon has a real winner with this technology.  Kindle revolutionized how we read books, Echo does the same for interacting with a computer.  I am certain that Amazon will continue Echo's evolution and I truly can't wait to see what's next.  In my experience, Echo is the closest I have come to interacting with a robot. Simply amazing. Highly recommended.

I was lucky enough to be offered this ZhiZhu Bluetooth Visor speakerphone for an honest review.  I recently bought a Honda CRV which has bluetooth for phone calls and realized that his was a technology which makes driving so much safer and talking in your car so convenient.  My husband drives a 2011 Jeep Grand Cherokee, which does not have bluetooth installed, so I thought this Visor Speakerphone would be great, and it certainly is.The unit itself is simple to operate and install. It is only 5" long and less than 2" wide and about 1/2" thick finished in a black matte with a glossy black center oval which contains the multifunction button.  There is also a mini-USB charging post on the rear as well as large sized volume controls, an on/off switch and a language button.  Pairing took only a few seconds with my two phones recognizing the unit immediately.A car charger with detachable USB to mini-USB cable included and an easy to understand instruction booklet.  There is a metal clip which you place on your visor and a magnetic disc on the rear of the speakerphone.  The magnet attaches to the clip very securely, but can be removed easily for storage or charging.  You can leave the charger plugged in but I prefer to not have the charger wire hanging in my car, so I remove it to charge it.When you receive a  phone call, there is a voice announcement and a touch of the multifunction button answers.  The sound on both ends is very clear and well loud enough even in the car.  You can adjust the volume to your comfort level.  To dial, you open you phone, press a speed dial number or dial and the unit announces "phone 1 dialing".If you have an older car, like mine, without bluetooth, this is a wonderful safety item to utilize.  Aside from the safety and no-ticket aspect, it is so much more convenient than speaking while holding your cellphone.  This would make a great gift.  I have used several ZhiZhu electronic products and they offer excellent value and are quality made.  Highly recommended.

The Tria Beauty Age-Defying Laser is expensive. Or is it? I have relatives and friends who regularly get treatments including lasers, Botox, and collagen treatments from their Dermatologist at a cost of a minimum of $600 per visit.  So maybe this laser is not so expensive.The laser has three settings. The first setting is for training so you can get used to the sensation the laser creates on your skin.  The second two higher settings are to be increased with time.  I tested it with level one on my clean forearm first.  While you are slowly drawing it across your skin, the laser lights up.  When removed from your skin, the light goes off.  There is a definite tingling sensation which when stopped feels a bit like your skin is burning and the sensation lasts a minute or two. Since it wasn’t too uncomfortable, I started with the training level one on my forehead, chin, cheeks and the side of my eyes (not too close).  It takes some practice to smoothly draw the laser over your skin.  Make sure you clean your face before using the laser and completely dry before use.I have only been using it for about a week and have not really seen any improvement and although after the treatment, my face does still feel a bit burned, but the sensation does go away.  My skin does redden slightly but returns to normal after about 5-10 minutes.There is a detailed instruction booklet, which I would suggest reading in its entirety before use.  It is fairly simple to understand and use of the laser is also pretty simple.The equipment itself seems very well designed and manufactured with style and elegance including the packaging.  If you spend a lot of money at the Dermatologist, this laser may be worth the investment, but I am certain the results will vary based on your skin condition and your sensitivity to the laser.

Like any addiction, Evelyn Beegan is completely seduced by her desperate bid to become part of the New York upper class scene. Like any addict, she needs to hit rock bottom, literally and figuratively, before she can attempt to rise again. I was unable to put this book down, even though it is not hard to guess where this social climber and her story is heading. The author’s skill is evident even when Evelyn's poor, poor choices become pathological, we still sympathize with her.Initially, Evelyn seemed not to care that she was on the fringes of the old money that her social climbing mother longed for and her prep school friends had. The year is 2006, when Evelyn moves to New York, reconnects with some of these friends from her prestigious prep school and accepts a job at an elite website called People Like Us. Evelyn is hired to “get the right sort of people to seed the site”. Initially, things go smoothly for Evelyn. Old friends Charlotte, Preston and Nick have access to the right parties and social events and take Evelyn with them to their Adirondacks compounds and stately mansions. Evelyn is only too happy to sleep in a smaller bedroom or clean up after parties in order to figuratively pay her way and sign up new members for the site. When Evelyn meets and eventually befriends heiress Camilla Rutherford, “the clear center of young New York”, she becomes obsessed with the trust fund millionaire and her way of life. What Evelyn won't do to sustain her climb to the top is what makes this book so compulsively readable. Evelyn will lie, cheat and discard old friends to keep her new ones. She will run up enormous fees on her charge cards to look the part and eventually begins to act the part. Like any addict, Evelyn rationalizes her behavior and every success she achieves validates her efforts.From start to finish I was as absorbed as Evelyn. Highly recommended.

I love my dogs very much and I watch what I feed them for snacks and food.  They currently eat a top quality dry food from Wellness mixed with either chicken or beef daily.  I also buy at Costco their chicken tenders, which are made in the USA with chicken from the USA and are natural also. .  In fact, I think they are from Tyson, the largest chicken company in the US.  Those tenders are $20.00 for 3 pounds as compared to these Prairie Dog Smokehouse Jerky treats which cost $22.00 with shipping for only 15 oz.  To compare these are $1.46 per ounce versus the Costco brand for $.42 per ounce or less than 1/3 the price.Yes, I realize these are special, all natural from the US, but with two 50 lb dogs, they are very costly even if I limit them to one piece per day. My husband loves beef jerky and is hesitant to spend the $20.00-$30.00 per lb, so I find it difficult to justify the cost of this chicken jerky for my pups.Of course, my dogs love these all natural treats and if you have small dogs and you want to indulge your pups, try them.

The Skyin Soy Peppermint Candle would make a great gift or a gift for yourself.  The non-toxic tin container has flowers and birds colored with soft green and pink tones on a pale yellow background.  The candle is 6oz and measures 3.5" tall and 2.5" diameter.  The candle is 100% soy wax, not an animal byproduct or petroleum based wax.  The peppermint scent is not overpowering but rather soothing and pleasant, perfect for a bedroom or bathroom.According to my short web research, the peppermint scent is cooling, mood elevating and can increase mental acuity and alertness.  Peppermint offers stress relief and the odor can help reduce the effects of colds and muscular aches.The Skyin soy candle offers 30 hours of burn time, which is about the same as a Yankee candle of the same size.  It is priced comparable to Yankee candles, yet I believe offers the extra benefit of natural soy and very nice packaging and is available with free shipping with Prime.These candles would make excellent stocking stuffers at the holdiays and I'm certain would be well received.I was provided a sample in exchange for an honest review.

Guess what? The barkOutfitters Cat Slicker Brush works on dogs too!  I have an Australian Cattle Dog who has the thickest mane of any dog I've owned and typically in May in NJ she starts to shed and I mean shed.  There are hair balls all over my wooden floors.  I have used a Furminator which work really well but I was surprised when I tried this Cat brush.  It holds double or triple the amount of hair than the Furminator and then releases the hair with the push of a button. Great design and easy to use.  I am careful to not be aggressive on her coat but she seams to like it.I was offered a sample for an honest review and I find the barkOutfitters Cat Slicker Brush offers good value for the quality and functionality.

Absolutely love this treat bag.  I've had others in the past, but most just had a belt loop.  That's a pain, and useless if you're not wearing a belt.  This clip is perfect for shorts without a belt or to clip on a pocket.  I have two 50lb dogs, who go hiking with my husband daily and this bag is just perfect.  They have been treat trained since puppies three years ago, so they know if they listen the get treats.  Additionally on the trails we hike, they have made many other canine buddies, who also love treats.  This bag can hold several days worth of dry cookies or wet ones (I put them in a plastic bag to keep the pouch clean).  The net pouch on the front  is perfect for a roll of poop bags and the drawstring keep everything secure.If you have a puppy, and I've had about 15 over the years, treats are the easiest way to train them and a treat pouch like this works wonders.I was given a sample for an honest review, and I feel this barkOutfitters Treat Pouch is designed with dogs in mind and offers great value.Highly recommended.

When it comes to management of yourself and others, the basic principles are thousands of years old. But since we are all born with zero knowledge and learn as we go along, what is kknown is unknown to us until we learn it – and that’s what this book does: teaches an understanding of how individuals and teams (which includes entire institutions) work. It’s good advice told in a no-nonsense way that should appeal to those starting off in a business career to those with decades behind them. While this book may not be a “classic”, the subject is and it’s well-stated here.Jerry

When I was young, I played board games like Diplomacy that could take hours and hours to finish. Homeland follows a classic form for this kind of game with shifting alliances and betrayals. It is  a fun game, if you have the patience for this kind of thing. There is a lengthy set of rules, the interpretation of which will undoubtedly cause arguments between people who take it seriously. It’s well done, well-constructed, but just not my kind of thing any more. Too many other things to do. My grandson took only a few seconds to decide tha his online video games were more interesting. I think a lot of people looking for highly social games will enjoy this for a  while, at least. But it is no longer my kind of game.Jerry

This is a book for Excel beginners, thought can also serve as a refresher for those who have experience with Excel but don’t use it often. Excel is very powerful and very complex. It is easy to forget some of the things you can accomplish with Excel. This is most certainly not a definitive reference on Excel 2016. I found nothing on using VBA to program Excel and only two pages on Pivot tables, one of Excel’s most powerful and complex features. Each subject is laid out on two well-illustrated and clearly written pages. As noted, if you’re new to excel, this is a great way to learn it – and it is also good as a refresher.Jerry

Microsoft Excel is incredibly powerful. I have been using it since its first incarnation. It was mind-blowing then and it is mind-blowing now. I am constantly finding new ways I can use Excel and I don’t think I’ve really scratched the surface. Since I don’t routinely deal with vast quantities of quantitative information, I don’t have much of a problem with visualizing it for myself and others. But if I have to learn how to build Excel dashboards in a hurry – that is, learn ways to make Excel data more accessible to lay usera – this is a book I would turn to. It’s a series of step-by-step lessons on how to use Excel’s capabilities to display data. Written ini simple language and amply illustrated, it walks the reader through dashboard philosophy and design principles to formulas, controls charts and other visualization tools to advanced modeling concepts and the use of PowerPivot and Power Query. The last two are not for amateurs, but are extremely powerful tools. This is an excellent reference and tutorial on using dashboards within excel. Kind of makes me wish I had lots of data and an audience for visualizing it.Jerry

I have never been and never will be an optimist. That doesn’t mean I am perpetually gloomy: I just don’t believe that happy endings are inevitable. As a child born during WWII, a Hobbesian attitude that the normal state of humankind was “continual fear, and danger of violent death: and the life of man, solitary, poor, nasty, brutish and short” except for those with the good fortune to be born in Western democracies. The Jacobs brothers, Bert and John, are definitely optimists and they propagate their philosophy in this book. In fact, they do a pretty good job of it. They write of ten “Superpowers” which, they claim, if implemented, will hlp guide you to a happy life. Not a trouble-free life, but a happy one. As inspirational books go, it’s quite a good one, though it failed to make me into an optimist.Jerry

The knowledgeable reader will find “1946” something of a feast. Author Victor Sebestyen has done an admirable, indeed excellent, job of reciting the history of year pivotal to contemporary history. It was in 1946 that the always tenuous wartime alliance of the United States, the British Empire and the Soviet Union entered an accelerated unraveling, that “people’s movements” initially probed their power, that old empires, like the French, refused to recognize their death and so much more. Throughout there is a slight hint of Sebestyn’s own biases, but it is relatively  minor and not disturbing. For many Americans, particularly those educated in the past few decades during the decline of American public education, much of what Sebestyn says will be news and, perhaps, unbelievable. Cannibalism in Poland? Yes. Rare, but it happened and was ignored in the American media – after all, all of Europe was going hungry. (In the 1930s millions of Ukrainians were deliberately starved to death, but America’s mass media were silent, mostly due to the efforts of The New York Times and its reporter Walter Duranty, but that is a different story.) The world was in a mess in 1946 after more than a decade of conflict and tens of millions dead, including millions deliberately murdered by the Germans and Japanese. Many thought the world was about to slide into a New Dark Age. That it did not was due to the vision and goodness (though often selfishly motivated) of a few good people, many of them Americans. With winter coming, this is an excellent history to read and reread, especially for those to whom all of this will be news. Well done, Mr. Sebestyn, well done.Jerry

I’ve taken a number of online college courses and quite liked most of them. One curse in particular on a programming language is taught by a literally renowned professor. His teaching technique doesn’t really seem any different than what you would encounter in a classroom. The gentleman knows his subject well and is totally at ease in front of a camera. The last time I took the course, my understanding is that it had more than 400,000 registrants. Obviously not all online teachers are effective. This is an admittedly academic attempt to analyze the elements – “best practices” – that lead to effective online teaching. It’s kind of like reading an instruction manual on how to fish. You can read it over and over, but you still may never catch a fish. I really found it kind of boring and felt like they were beating a dead horse. But I don’t teach or administer online teaching, so someone in the field might find it very helpful.Jerry

Michael Fullan is a prolific author and a professor emeritus of education at the University of Toronto. I am not a fan of public education or public educators. It seems like there is a new fad every year and despite the expenditure of hundreds of billions of taxpayer dollars annually, the children seem to be less educated with each passing year. “Freedom To Change” is, at its heart, a self-help book intended to help school principals principally (pun irresistible) discover true freedom. Public education in Canada appears to be the same as it is in the United States: an endless turf battle between competing bureaucracies where actually educating  the student ranks dead last in priorities. Amusingly, Fullan honors the Ontario [Canada] Principal’s Council by reprinting its mission statement. It has five points, such as “represent its membership”, “promote the professional interests of its members”, “support and protect its members”, but only a brief reference to students. In other words, it focuses on the so-called educators, not their students. Anyway, Fallon has attempted to repackage Erich Fromm’s classic “Escape From Freedom” with contributions from other others, such as Jeff Kluger who invented the term “simplexity” to describe the process of “finding workable solutions to problems when situations appear too complex”. In other words, break down a project or a problem into  its smallest parts and start accomplishing them one by one. Nothing revolutionary her. But Fullan is an interesting writer and presents his thesis in entertaining and interesting ways making this a reasonably interesting book, even if its actual goal is comforting school administrators who feel put upon by other bureaucrats further up the food chain.Jerry

This book has the style of something written for people with limited reading skills. Perhaps it is intended for high school students. The simplistic writing style becomes somewhat wearing. But that doesn’t detract from the purpose of the book which is to impart the basic – very basic –knowledge needed to use SketchUp as a tool for creating designs for 3D printing and rudimentary CNC machining. As she explains “our use of SketchUp’s tools and functions will be to those relevant to 3D projects”. I’m no expert with SketchUp, but I can tell you that Ms. Cline is true to her word and barely scratches the surface of what SketchUp is capable of. Again, that is a benefit since presenting SketchUp all at once can be frightening to the new user. She spends a bit over 80 pages illustrating how to use SketchUp – and the book is profusely illustrated, though the illustrations would be better if they were higher quality – and then spends 42 pages on the expensive SketchUp Pro features. The remaining 80 or so pages of the book are devoted to 3D print prep, 3D printing and CNC fabrication. Overall, this is a pretty decent introduction to the basics of three pretty complex disciplines: SketchUp, 3D printing and CNC routing. Even though I felt like I was reading something intended for folks with limited reading comprehension ability, I still found the book informative, again on a very basic level.Jerry

Microsoft Access (and Apple’s FileMaker Pro) are two programs I always buy one or more third-party references for. Usually more than one. The reason for this is simple: these are enormously powerful programs and are understandably complex and difficult to master. I’ve been using Access since its Day One and I don’t consider myself a “master” and never will. I don’t use it every day, so when I do I need a convenient, deep resource. And the Access Bible is generally one of the best. Yes, you can find every bit of information between its covers on the web. But think of the time you’ll save by being able to look it up in a pretty well done table of contents or index. Before purchasing this book, use the “Look Inside” feature on Amazon. Closely review the Table Of Contents and Index. Then carefully read the parts of the first two chapters that are included. If you have trouble understanding them, you want a different book, one specifically targeted at newcomers to Access. Access 2016 Bible is clearly written and profusely illustrated, though many of the illustrations are difficult to understand. One day the publishers will wake up and understand that illustrations need to be legible. But with more than a thousand pages to deal with, they face a problem. It would be nice if the publishers optimized the layout for electronic versions. This book is heavy. In any event, if you are beyond the absolute novice level, this contends for must-have status.Jerry

If the devices you would use this with have wall wart adapters, you’re going to be out of outlets very quickly as there is little room between the sckets on this device. The two-foot cord is also, in my opinion, a liability. Build quality is on the lower end, which makes me wary. I suppose this unit would do where there are no wall warts or you are using short extensions made for the purpose – which dramatically increase the cost of this unit. For light duty with plugs that fit and with the unit located near an outlet, I suppose it will do the job. But, frankly, I’d rather spend the money and get a high quality unit that would accommodate wall warts.Jerry

The Advantage Traveler is larger and heavier than expected. Yes it will fit in a suitcase – if it is a fairly large suitcase. At about 8 pounds, it may make your suitcase overweight which can cost you added fees in today’s airline world. For automobile travel, though, it is fine. The Advantage Travel is extremely easy to set up, particularly if you have two able people. If you’re doing it yourself, be patient and just work the strap up between the mattress and inner spring. In use, the product is stable and sturdy enough for the purpose. This is my second Stander product, the first being their regular bedrail. The company turns out a quality product.Jerry

The first edition of this book helped me learn Minecraft well enough to keep up with my grandson . . . for a little while, at least. He moved through his Minecraft phase and on to online First Person Shooters all too fast. So now Minecraft in Creative mode is where I spend my time and that, incidentally, is my only criticism of this otherwise excellent guide: it is focused primarily on Survival mode, which I don’t find to be fun. But kids love the kill-or-be-killed aspect of Survival mode and kids are who this book is written for. Fortunately nearly all the information is applicable to all Minecraft modes. (By the way, you can set the mayhem to low in Survival mode, but I just don’t care for the competitive aspect. I’d rather spend all my time creating new worlds.) The Third Edition is about 40 pages longer than the First Edition and covers the progressive additions and changes to the Minecraft program itself. The key question: can you learn Minecraft well from this single book? Yes. Part of that is due to the brilliant design of Minecraft. But this is a well-written, amply illustrated, step-by-step guide to Minecraft and it does the job well. Read the text, study the illustrations, keep Minecraft running on your computer and you’ll learn how to play the game. You can also supplement this with online tips and recipes at the author’s website. In addition, if more is needed, there are tons of tutorials on the web.` Overall, while I don’t think the “Ultimate” label in the title is entirely justified, this is certainly among the best of the Minecraft playing guides.Jerry

According to her, the small size is a bit too small. She likes the style, fabric and construction. Because they were small for her, she really has no comments on the fit. In short, it was my error for not being more familiar with sizes in this product, so it turned out to be a bit of a fizzle. Asked whether she would purchase these on her own, she replied in the negative. Just not her style, she said.Jerry

I love Livescribe. I’ve used a Livescribe Pulse 2GB, on and off, for several years. The technology of the Livescribe 3 Smartpen is simply fantastic. A tiny infrared camera of sorts in the tip reads a pattern of microdots to track your motions. This is transcribed into an image of what you write, draw, doodle, whatever. With the Livescribe 3, the Smartpen connects via Bluetooth with your Android or iOS device. My testing was done with an Android LG Gpad V-510. Installation of the two required applications from the Google Play store was without problem. One application, Livescribe + is what you see and manage your work in. Livescribe Link manages your connection with the Smartpen. Livescibe provides only a brief introductory instruction manual. Too brief. I couldn’t get the device to pair, so I used Livescribe’s online chat support facility. I had a rep in no time, but it was clear that the rep was working from a script and while not unhelpful, wasn’t overly so. I any event, I discovered that I had to use the Livescribe Link application first to imitate the connection, then I could use the Livescribe+ app. I think Livescribe should consider making their guide somewhat more explicit. Once paired, the process was flawless. I write in the supplied special Moleskin book and watch as my jottings, whatever they may be, appear on the screen of my connected device. If the subject matter is text, I can attempt to have the Livescribe software convert it from essentially drawing to text. My normal handwriting is abysmal and, as with its ancestor, the Livescribe 3 did not cope well. When I exercised some care, the results of the conversion were outstandingly good. You can also record audio on the device you are connected to while you are making your notes. Accessing the “pencast” (the audio recording is a bit tricky the first time around) allows you to listen to the audio with the notes in front of you on the page. The idea is that while you are recording, if you jot down a note, you will be able to touch the note on your page and the audio will play. It does work, but I think I need to experiment more in using this: the control seems imprecise, but that could also just be me not knowing how do it right. My biggest concern for most people is with the quality of audio recording on their devices. Most of the iOS and Android devices I’ve used have not been outstanding performers in terms of recording audio. I use an inexpensive Olympus stereo microphone on my phone and tablets and it makes a world of difference. If you are going this route, I strongly urge you to do some research on external microphones. I haven’t had the opportujnity to try this Livescribe in a meeting or lecture setting. It will be interesting when I do. The pen itself is satisfying bulky. The barrel feels good in my hand. You turn the pen on and off by rotating a ring which also retracts or extends the writing tip.. The microUSB port for charging is on the non-writing end of the pen. A cap can be used which allows the Smartpen to be used as a capacitive stylus, albeit a very husky stylus. I am afraid the stylus cap may be prone to falling off: Livescribe sells replacements in packs of three. So do I like it? Indeed I do. The Livescribe 3 is a phenomenal piece of technology and performs as its manufacturer promises. I used my original Livescribe heavily for concept development and note taking. But that task has now been largely relegated to my smartphone and tablets. I am also uncertain about separating the audio recording from the Livescribe pen itself as it was on the previous models. I remain an enthusiastic supporter of the Livescribe technology: it’s great stuff. I know that for the next several weeks, I’ll be using it heavily, but I am not so certain in the long term for myself. For lawyers, doctors, many others in different fields, though, I think the Livescribe is a valuable tool.Jerry
Appears to be a genuine Seagate part. I used mine with a Seagate Wireless Plus external drive and it fit perfectly. The vendor for this product is also excellent.Jerry

Adobe Premiere Elements is the scaled-down sibling of Adobe Premiere, one of the best featured and most difficult to learn video editing programs available. Premiere Elements, for those brand new to video editing, still has a learning curve, but nothing like its big relative. It is also smack dab in the middle of  a very competitive market, up against contenders like Cyberlink PowerDirector. There is a beginner’s mode in Adobe Premiere Elements that can be learned quickly, but there are also free programs like Windows MovieMaker that offer virtually identical functionality at that  level. Once you move beyond the baby steps, you will have to learn what Premiere Elements can do – a lot – and how to make the program do those things. Rather than detail all of what Adobe Premier Elements can do, I’ll refer you to the Amazon web page, the Adobe website and the downloadable manual and the numerous websites explaining how to do this, that and lots more in Premiere Elements. This is a very powerful program, but you’ll find any who will argue that it is not the best entry level video editor. My suggestion is that if you have the time and inclination, at least check out Cyberlink PowerDirector, Magix Video Editor and Corel VideoStudio Pro before making a decision. Adobe PhotoShop Elements 14 leaves out some major features found in Adobe Photoshop, but quite honestly, Photoshop Elements is mere than enough to meet the needs of most hobbyist photographers. Again, rather than repeat the very long list of this program’s features, I’d suggest you check out the Amazon web page, the Adobe web page and the many third-party sites ha provide coverage of this product. Be forewarned, there are a lot of them. When it comes to less sophisticated photo editing programs, there are only two I recommend: Adobe Photoshop Elements and some versions of Corel PaintShop Pro, the latter of which by the way, has improved tremendously over the last two or three releases. I would strongly urge you to consider both carefully. For the money, this is a very attractive pairing. Both Premiere Elements ad Photoshop Elements are at the top of their respective classes, though not without shortcomings. As you might anticipate with programs like this, one size does not fit all. Best to do a thorough comparison before you choose.Jerry

This is a slightly hagiographic biography of David Lynch containing a lot of analysis of his work. The writing tends toward the academic style, which makes this book a somewhat tiring read. In the end, if you are not already a fan of Lynch and his work, I don’t think this biography will pique your interest in his work. On the other hand, Lynch aficionados may find a tidbit or two. Personally, I realized that I am not an enthusiastic Lynch fan as I read this.Jerry

This is a solid solution for the iOS device user seeking a relatively  inexpensive, easy to use and flexible external device.  The major feature here is an Apple Lightning connector on one end and a USB 3.0 on the other end. Both connectors are on a slide so only one is visible at any time.  Lexar offers a free iOS app intended to make file transfers and syncing quick and easy.  You can use the M20i to hold music and movies for playback on your iOS device o transfer files to and from your iOS device.  With the USB 3.0 connector, you can connect the M20i to your Mac or Windows computer.  I didn’t even bother measuring read and write speeds on this flash drive. Since I am not using it for live recording of photos or video, the write speed is fairly meaningless. Read speeds are also immaterial, in my opinion, because you are not going to be transferring vast amounts of data here.  My only objection is on the size: it covers two USB ports on my Windows machine. I have to use it with a short USB cable, otherwise I lose access to a USB port.  Since Apple doesn’t offer a microSD slot, you’ve had to rely on wireless transfers or hook your iOS device to a computer. The M20i gives you a way to write to and reads from external storage. And that is cool.Jerry

This is an utterly fascinating book. It looks at the nature of work primarily in the United States in the 21st Century. Its premises – that most people will be working independently and even outside of traditional workspaces – will disturb many people. This is not a quick read. I found it challenging because I and have been the “detached worker of the future” for almost three decades and didn’t know I was the wave of the future. I just thought I was self-employed, a freelancer. In fact, according to the authors, the workforce at large will soon be composed of independent workers bound to those who pay them by a variety of mechanisms, including contracts, work-for-hire arrangements and so on. The concept of “employee” will dramatically change, if not disappear altogether. Business enterprises will be composed of an ever-shifting sea of people hired for specific purposes for varying durations under differing terms. While written primary for Human Resource managers, this book is worth reading for employees with specialist skills and managers for the future the authors speak of here may very well be their future. I will be coming back to this book for a second reading: it depicts a new world of relationships that I think will affect nearly all who “work” for a living.Jerry

These headphones have both a USB connector and a 3.5mm plug. Use the USB connector when you want the 7.1 virtual surround sound. With the 3.5mm plug, it’s plain old stereo which happens to be pretty good. Lenovo also provides their own software that has equalization and other personalization features. I haven’t tested it yet.  Though simulated, the surround sound isn’t bad. In the simple games I have or play, you can differentiate direction to a certain degree. The acid test will be when my grandson visits: he is an avid First Person Shooter player and will give me the expert perspective on these headphones.  The all-plastic construction does not feel particularly sturdy, but that is a comment I could make about my Turtle Beach headphones that I have been using (and abusing) for about three years now. The fit on my old and grey head is on the tight side, but that may (hopefully) change over time. The deeply padded headband should help in long sessions.  I like the full over-the-ear cups and they do help block out ambient sound.  The microphone is detachable, a feature I am not particularly fond of since I have found that leads ultimately to misplaced microphones or worse. Audio quality from the mic in my limkited testing ia okay, but not spectacular. It does somewhat reduce extraneous noise.
