The Edges of Both Front and Rear Leather Panels are round and smooth.The Stitching is straight and sturdy throughout.The Sides of the Case are constructed of White Cloth Fabric attached to a Durable Zipper, which features a 1" Metal Zipper Pull.The Zipper opens and closes smoothly.The Inside of the case features 3/8" wide Elastic Bands which are attached to the case and hold each of the Sewing Notions in Place.The contents of one side of the Sewing Kit include (12) 1" Spools of Sewing Thread (1 each of White, Light Pink, Black, Beige, Blue, Green, Brown, Yellow, Burgundy, Red, Orange and Light Blue), along with (1) Metal Thimble;  (1) Sharp Seam Ripper with Plastic Cap and (1) Flexible Plastic Measuring Tape featuring Inch Markings on one side and Centimeter Markings on the reverse.Measuring Tape Length is 60 in. /150 cm.The Reverse Side of this Sewing Kit offers (30) Quality Sewing Needles which feature Easy to See Gold Eyes with Silver, Sharp Pointed Tips.The Needles are packaged inside of an Simple to Use, Round Plastic  "One Needle at a Time"  Dispenser/Storage Case.Also found on this side of the Sewing Kit are (2) 1 1/2" Pearl Head Straight Pins; (1) 1 1/2" Metal Safety Pin, (3) 1/2" 4-hole Plastic White Buttons; (2) Foil Needle Threaders and a 3 1/2" long Pair of Stainless Steel Scissors which feature a 3/4" Slightly Curved, Sharp Cutting Edge.Aside from it's cuteness, I love that this Compact Sewing Kit will fit in my purse so it's handy for any emergency repairs which might present themselves. It would also make a great gift for a Pre-Teen, Teenager or College Student to carry in their backpack.I received mine in exchange for testing and offering my Honest and Unbiased opinion and will be purchasing another at the reasonable asking price to gift to my 14 yr old niece for Christmas this year.A+++ Recommendation!

This Strapless Top Vest Sports Bra is Well Constructed and Fit as Expected. (I am 5'3" and wear a 36  b or c cup depending on style)When Laid Flat on the table it measures 12" Across and 5 1/2" Deep *Before Stretching*.The Top and Bottom 3/4" wide Spandex Elastic Bands offer a good amount of stretch and stayed in place fairly well.The Front of this Spandex/Lycra Bra features Thin Ribbing around the Smooth Cup areas.There is a 1 3/4" x 1/4" section of Gathering in the Center of the Front, Between the Cups for separation.The Backside of the Bra features a Spandex/Lycra Mesh material between the Top and Bottom Spandex Elastic Bands.Seams are Well Stitched throughout.On the downside, as the material over the Cup Sections is Not Very Thick, this Bra offers Minimum Breast Support and Shaping Qualities.It also does Not hide the nipple area very well, so if you have larger nipples, they will most likely be noticeable if worn under a thinner fabric top or shirt.As far as comfort, for the most part it performed well.  I did, however,  find if I was very active while wearing it, I was having to adjust it often.For these reasons, it does not, in my opinion, qualify as a "sports" bra, as most sports bras are designed for support as well as comfort when active.Great for everyday wear, just not what I would consider to be a "sports" bra.

Very pleased with the overall results after using this Silver Jewelry Polishing Cloth from Only Cool Products!I own a Sterling Silver pendant that I have had for over 30 years and just recently found in a box in my storage locker.As it has been in that box for almost 2 years, it had accumulated some tarnish and needed to be cleaned before I could wear it again.In spite of the fact that there are several carved indentations in the pendant, with just a little bit of effort, I was able to clean it up nicely.There are Two Different Cloths involved in the process.The Beige Inner Layer is used to Loosen and Remove the Dirt and Tarnish build up.The Grey Outer Layer is used to Polish and Shine the Silver once the tarnish is removed.Both Gray and Beige Cloths are Folded to create 4 separate sections of cloth and for each section, both front and back of the cloths are usable.Each section of the Grey Polishing Cloth measures 5 3/4" x 4", while each section of the Beige Cleaning Cloth Measures 5" x 3 1/2".Both Cloths are Securely Stitched together at the fold, which allowed for me to get a bit aggressive when cleaning and polishing my pendant without worry of separation.Only Cool Products includes a Cleaning Instruction Sheet and ships the cloth in recyclable plastic.As noted on the Instruction Sheet, this product is Not Intended for use with 24K Gold, Ivory, Pearls, Opals, Coral, Lapis, Malachite or any other Soft Porous Stones.It Does, However, Do a Marvelous Job of Cleaning Sterling Silver!!I received mine in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion and am pleased to give this Silver Jewelry Polishing Cloth  from Only Cool Products an A+++ Recommendation.Note: Photos show Actual Results. Only the image size has been edited for the purpose of uploading to Amazon.

My grandson will be so pleased that I received such a Colorful Variety of Lures with my order!No two were the same and each Well Constructed Lure features Two Sharp Treble Hooks which are attached to the lures with very sturdy coiled jump rings. Each lure also features a sturdy coiled jump ring on the tongue to secure it to the line.My 15 yr old grandson goes fishing several times a week and he is always looking to replenish his supply of fishing lures.As  grandmother who lives on a very tight budget, I am always open to receiving  fishing related items at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion because I know that he will be more than happy to help with the testing process.Each 3 1/2" Lure features nicely detailed markings and the 3-D eyes really add to the overall realistic appearance.We live in Florida, so my grandson will be using these lures for both brackish and fresh water fishing. I will update my review as to their performance as soon as I get his feedback.A Great Deal for the asking price! A+++ Recommendation.

These Guitar Pick Holders will work fine for most average sized guitar picks, but are not suitable for Bass Guitar  or other larger guitar picks.The color selection that I received was fine, however I received  2 Red cases instead of a yellow, so you may not get one of each color as pictured in the product description.They feature paper covered adhesive backs. The adhesive which will stick to most flat surfaces, although I did not want to stick one on my guitar because I wasn't certain if it would mar the surface if I tried to remove it.Each case measures 1 1/2" long x 1 1/4" wide across the top of the case.I was able to fit Four 1.14 mm picks into a case and remove them one at a time without issue, however if I put more than 4 in the case I found it was difficult to remove the top pick.As you get 7 Pick Holders in the package for the under $3 asking price including the shipping, they are  worth ordering if you have use for them.I received mine about 10 days sooner than the earliest estimated delivery date.

This Universal Cable Lock by Kinetiplex is Extremely Well Constructed and Super Heavy Duty!The Grade A Steel 5 Digit Combination Code Lock features 1/8" Easy to Read Numbers on Each of the 5 Rings.All 5 Rings offer a smooth rotation and are simple to manipulate.The Lock is securely attached to a 3 ft long Heavy Duty Twisted Steel Spring Cable which measures 1/2" in Diameter including the Thick Silicone Sleeve in which the Steel Cable is encased.The Portion which attaches to the Bicycle Frame comes with both 3" and 3 1/2"  x 1 1/2" Silicone Liners.It secures to the frame with Two 3/4" long screws and features a Slot with a Button Release by which the Cable and Lock can be easily detached from the Bicycle when not in use.I especially appreciate that  Kinetiplex packages this Extremely Secure Cable Lock inside a box made of recycled materials.Instructions for resetting the code are included in the box.I received mine in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion and am giving it a Well Deserved 5 Star recommendation!

Extremely Versatile 13 Gallon Office Trash Bags that can be Color Coordinated with every room in your house!When laid flat and unopened,  these trash bags measure 28 1/2" Long by 25" Wide.I chose the White bags and while they are a bit thinner than more expensive trash bags, they are more than adequate for most uses.Keep in mind they are sold as Office Trash Bags, meant for paper and lighter trash items.If you intend to use them for wet food trash in the kitchen, I would suggest doubling them up as they might split if overfilled.I have used them in 3 different sized trash cans. In my Tall Kitchen Trashcan they would have reached to the bottom, but as the opening of the bag is much wider than the can, I would Not have been able to secure the bag to the can by tying the excess.The Box contains 4 Rolls of 20 bags each. They are well Perforated between each bag, so they tear apart easily.First-for-Office also includes Eighty 3 1/4" x 1/8"  Plastic Twist Ties.Each Twist Tie has a thin piece of metal running through it to keep it tightly wrapped.The design of the box allows for easy removal of the bags.I received mine in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion and will be purchasing more in different colors when my supply of white bags runs out.Note: As stated on the box, these Trash Bags are Not Intended for food Storage. They could be doubled for wet  food Disposal.

The Bamboo/ Polyester Blend Material used for the Pillow Case on this Shredded Memory Foam Pillow  is one of the Softest Pillow CASES I have ever owned.  The actual pillow offers a medium to firm support once it is completely fluffed up.The Queen Sized Pillow I purchased measures 20" x 30".It's a nice sized pillow that will fit into a Standard Sized Pillowcase. however, the Hypoallergenic Pillowcase it comes with features a Pretty Bamboo Plant Design, so an additional case is not required.RelaxHomeLIfe.com compresses the pillow to pack it for shipping, which causes the Polyurethane Foam inside the secondary cloth covering to arrive in a very condensed form.I didn't want to pay to put it in the dryer where I live, so I spent a little time kneading the foam and breaking it up until I got the lumps out, but it was time well spent.The Bamboo Pillowcase had a bit of an odor, which dissipated with the initial run through the washing machine.  I appreciate that the pillowcase can be put in the dryer, however, I chose to air dry it and after it dried it actually felt softer than before I put it in the washer!Once fluffed, the Memory Foam does a nice job of conforming to my head and neck, while offering enough support to allow for a very comfortable night's sleep.I received mine at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion.

Never having tasted Quinoa before, I had a bit of reservation when offered the opportunity to received this Nutria Organic Royal White Quinoa in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion.I had heard good things about how nutritious it is and that it was a great substitute for rice, but I didn't even know how to say the word, so I did a bit of research.I now know  to pronounce it "keen-wah".I decided the best way to find out if I liked it was to accept the offer and cook some up and am I ever glad I did!I was glad to see you cook it pretty much the same as you cook rice. 1 part Quinoa to 2 parts water, bring it to a boil, then cover and simmer till the water is absorbed.When cooked and eaten out of the pot, it  has a bit of a nutty flavor.  The texture is a mix between creamy and crunchy.I am making the transition to a gluten free diet and this Nutria Organic Royal White Quinoa is so versatile that I am certain I will be using it in many different recipes.There are several delicious sounding recipes available on the internet and I look forward to trying them out.Low in calories (155 per  1/4 cup serving, only 12 fat calories), a great source of fiber, carbohydrates and protein, plus it even adds a bit of calcium and iron to my daily intake.It comes in a Resealable Pouch and the 16 oz size is plenty enough for me to prepare several meals.Truth is it tastes pretty good and I am so glad I decided to try something new!Giving it my highest recommendation!

This Laptop Cleaning Kit by ColorWay is a Quick and Easy way to keep my laptop and cell phone screens sparkling clean!The Kit features a 4 1/2" x 1 3/4"  Oval Shaped, Hand Held Tool which offers a 3 1/2" x 1" Finger Opening, so it's comfortable to grip and simple to manipulate.The Bottom 1/4" of the Cleaning Tool is covered in a  Soft and Durable Microfiber type Fabric which is well secured to the base.ColorWay includes a Plastic Cover to protect the Fabric during storage.Also included is a 12 ml Bottle of Cleaning Solution which fits into the finger opening of the cleaning tool for convenient storage.The Bottle features a Pump Type Spray Nozzle and Plastic Cap.The Ingredients of the Cleaning Solution as stated on the Packaging are HOLOF LF-1 surfactant, Octanol, Polydilactide glycol, Ethoxylate, Polyethylene glycol, Secondary lauryl myristyl alcohol, Biocide based on methyl-isothiasoline and distilled water.While I was unable to get my camera lens (which I also cleaned with this kit) to focus on the smudges on my laptop screen due to light reflections from inside my office, I found the combination of the Cleaning Solution and the Oval Hand Held Cleaning Tool did a fabulous  job of removing dirt from the screen's square corners and along the outer edges, as well as cleaning of the center of the screen without leaving streaks.I also used it to clean my cell phone screen and as shown in my photos, it worked equally as well to remove fingerprints and makeup smudges.The Compact Size of the Cleaning Tool allows me to easily fit it in my Laptop Carry Case.I received my Laptop Cleaning Kit at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion and would highly recommend purchasing it.

If you are looking for a way to keep your child Active while building their Manual Dexterity and improving their Coordination, this Adjustable Jump Rope by Veluxio is a Must Have item!The Durable 10 1/2 ft Soft Plastic Hollow Tubing is Lightweight and Easy to See when at your child's feet.It attaches to the 6" Plastic Handles by way of Rotating Circular Clips.These Rotating Clips are Also Used to Easily Adjust the Length of the Plastic Tubing so that it's the perfect amount of "rope" to accommodate the child's height.The Handles feature several rows of 1/4" thick Foam Padding which cover 4 1/2" of the overall length of the handle, allowing for a Firm and Comfortable Grip.One of the handles features a Counter.  The number on the counter increases by 1 each time the rotating clip on that handle makes a full revolution.This counter also offers a Push Button Reset Feature, so it can be set back to 0 for the next set of jumps.In this day and age of electronic toys, it's nice to see that Veluxio offers a Colorful, Interactive, Fun way for a child to get their much needed exercise. They also offer fast shipping and excellent customer service!I received mine in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion and I am highly recommending it to anyone looking to put a smile on a child's face.

These Super Colorful and Functional Silicone Spatulas by Confident Kitchen do a thorough job of scraping the sides of a mixing bowl!The Flexible Edges of these  3 3/8" x 2" Silicone Spatula Tops sat perfectly flush against the sides of  my mixing bowl, making it easy to blend ingredients while mixing my batter, as well as scrape the bowl clean so that all of the batter found it's way into my muffin pan.The 6 5/8" Crystal Clear Plastic Handles felt comfortable in the palm of my hand and I love that Confident Kitchen offers a 1/2" hole at the end of the handle to give me the choice of hanging them on a hook rather than storing them in a drawer.The choice is a nice feature, however, as the Colorful Teal and Pink with White Chevron Stripes, Patterned Silicone Spatula portions make them easy to spot in a utensil drawer, I will most likely store mine in the drawer.Although the Handles fits snug inside the Spatula portions, I appreciate that I can remove the Silicone Portions for a thorough cleaning.I do not own a dishwasher so I have to wash them by hand and I feel better knowing that I have cleaned every crack and crevice before I put them away.I received my Set of 2 Silicone Spatulas at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and offering my Honest and Unbiased opinion and based on their colorful appearance, comfortable handles and excellent performance, I am giving them a Well Deserved 5 Star Rating.

What a marvelous way to serve Freshly Ground Salt and Pepper these Stainless Steel Salt and Pepper Grinders from Modernist Home Goods are!These 5" x 3" Stainless Steel and Glass Grinders remind me of snow globes when filled.Filling them is easy, simply unscrew the Stainless Steel Portion from the Glass Globe and insert your favorite course salt and peppercorns.Re-screw the Silver Stainless Steel portion onto the filled glass container and they are ready to go!To Serve, Remove the Cap from the Top of the Stainless Steel portion, Adjust the Wheel found under the cap to your Desired Coarseness, turn the Shaker over and Twist the Widest Section of the Stainless Steel.Once you have finished seasoning your food, simply snap the cap back into place to seal out moisture.I especially appreciate that these Salt and Pepper Grinders are designed so you can set them down on either end and they will sit flat on the table or counter top.Modernist Home Goods shipped my order quickly and even included a very sharp and easy to manipulate Ceramic Vegetable Peeler in the box!I received my Stainless Steel Salt and Pepper Grinders at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion and based on my personal experience using them, I am pleased to give them a 5 Star Recommendation!

These Waterfly Men's Waterproof Winter Gloves offer so many Excellent Features!While they do not contain a tag telling me what materials they are made out of, these gloves feature a super soft lining from the top of the cuff to the tips of the fingers.The Underside of each glove features a textured material over the palm and fingers, as well as a 4" wide gathering of elastic at the wrist.The Top of these gloves feature raised padded areas over the finger joints and are double stitched across the knuckle area.There is a 3/4" wide Adjustable Nylon Strap on the top side of the glove which allows the wearer to pull them tight around the wrist to prevent moisture and cold air from reaching the interior.They measure 12" long from the top of the 3 1/2" cuff to the tip of the middle finger and Waterfly has even thought to provide a well attached clip by which they can be secured together for storage when not in use.I received mine at a discounted cost in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion and while I cannot speak to how warm the really are at this point in time, I will come back and update my review this winter when my step dad has had an opportunity to wear them in Wisconsin's sub zero temperatures.At this time, I am giving them a 4 Star Recommendation based on their Quality Construction and Features.

I must admit that when I first received my Keliwa 12 Cup Silicone Muffin & Cupcake Pan from EJM I was a little apprehensive because the Silicone was thinner than I expected it would be, however, after using it to bake some Sweet Potato Muffins, my concerns have been proven unfounded.Not only did this 13" x 9 1/2" Silicone Cupcake and Muffin Pan allow my muffins to bake evenly, it also allowed me to remove each and every muffin in one piece!For testing purposes, I had used a cooking oil soaked paper towel and greased half of the 3" wide x 1 1/4" deep Cups before adding the batter, only to discover that greasing them beforehand was unnecessary, as both sides of the pan released my muffins with their golden brown bottoms equally well. The thinness of the Silicone allows the pan enough flexibility to simplify removing the muffins from the center.Clean up was a breeze with some soapy water and a hot water rinse.I will note that it's best to place the pan on a cookie sheet for added support before filling the cups.Also, the silicone gets pretty hot, so be careful to protect your fingers if removing the contents right out of the oven.I received mine at a discount in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion, and I can honestly say that this Keliwa 12 cup Silicone Muffin and Cupcake pan performed above and beyond my expectations.A+++ Recommendation!

I found these Black and White Chevron Pattern Printed Harem Pants by G2 Chic to be very Soft and Comfortable!The 92% Polyester / 8% Spandex Lightweight Material is perfect for year round wear in warmer climates such as where I live in Florida.They feature a Flat Pocket on either side of the pant, the opening of which is positioned diagonally for easy access.I ordered these Harem Pants in a size Sm/Med and laid them on the table so I could offer a few basic measurements with my review.The 2" wide Stretch Cotton Waist Band graduates to 3" in the front of the pant and measures 13" across (26" total circumference) and offers a nice amount of stretch due to the 1 1/2" wide elastic band concealed within the outer fabric.The Inseam measures 27 1/2" from crotch area to the bottom of the hem on the pant leg, with an additional 12" of fabric from the waist band to the crotch area. (waist band not included)While flat on the table, they measure 21" across the buttocks, 11" across the thigh, 8" across the calf and 5 1/2" at the hemline of the leg opening.G2Chic was careful to match the pattern well creating a nicely balanced overall design.I am 5'3", 120 lbs and I found the fit to be appropriate.The combination of the elastic waist band and the pleating on the front of the pant caused my hips to look wider than they really are when the waist band was exposed, however, I found that if i covered the waist band with a longer top, it balanced out the overall appearance.If you are fortunate to have the right body proportions, you could wear them with crop tops without issue.The seams are 1/4" wide and feature Locked Stitching throughout the garment, which I expect will hold up well over time.According to the Care Instruction Tag, these Harem Pants require Hand Washing and should be Hung to Air Dry, so if you are looking for pants you can throw in the washer and dryer, these will not meet your requirements.In my opinion, the seller should have given these and the other similar straight cuff styles their own listing and not coupled them with the elastic hemmed jogger style pants, as they are not what most would consider to be "joggers".I would recommend them to anyone looking to purchase a pair of comfortable, lightweight Harem pants that are appropriate for both Casual and Dress attire.I received mine at a discounted cost in exchange for testing and offering my Honest and Unbiased opinion

I am very impressed with how well this LEABAGS Avocado Lotion restored my favorite leather booties!Although they are outdated in style, they are still the most comfortable pair of booties I own and I had refrained from wearing them because they were looking so worn.The 7.5 ml Can of Avocado Lotion features a Sponge Tip that makes using this product so very simple.All I did was turn the can over and run the sponge over the surface of the boot.Almost immediately I could see the dried out leather regain it's original soft, supple and shiny texture!I really appreciate that there was no need to dirty a rag to wipe off my boots after applying the Avocado Lotion, as I have needed to do with other leather conditioners I have previously used.While LEABAGS Designed this Avocado Lotion to maintain the Genuine Leather Bags they offer for sale, this Odorless Avocado Lotion can be applied to both smooth and/or oiled leathers, so it's great for Cleaning and Conditioning ALL leather purses, shoes, boots, belts, wallets or any other leather item you might own.I received mine at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and offering my Honest and Unbiased opinion and I will be purchasing more at the reasonable asking price when this can runs out.A+++ Recommendation!

As I can no longer drive a car due to peripheral vision issues. I thought this Self Balancing Scooter might be a great alternative to walking a mile and a half to the local shopping center.Before placing my order, I went to YouTube to check out some demonstration videos of similar Self Balancing Scooters and decided it was worth giving it a try, especially as I have a 15 year old grandson who would be happy to take it off my hands if it didn't work out for me.Once I removed it from the box and discarded the Styrofoam inserts which were used to secure it during transit, I started out by reading the Well Written Instruction Manual included in the box.Although I had learned a lot watching the videos, I really appreciate that Warrear took a lot of care in specifying the do's and don'ts of operating this Two Wheel Self Balancing Scooter and put them in a written form that I could refer back to as needed.For those who like specifics, I can tell you that the Scooter measures 22" across and is about 3" thick.The Exterior of the Scooter is composed of Two Sections of Heavy Duty, Well Polished Molded Plastic.Each Section features a Top and Bottom cover which encase the 1000w Motor, as well as the LG Lithium Battery and are held together by Deeply Recessed Screws.This Warrear Self Balancing Scooter features 7" Rubber Wheels which offer a Good Amount of Textured Tire Tread, allowing the Scooter to be used on Different Types of Terrain.The End Caps on the wheels are Silver and Black and have a very cool appearance.The Wheel Wells are Molded to the Body and cover the Upper Half of the Wheels.The Top of the Scooter features Two 5" x 5 1/2"  Non Slip, Textured Silicone Control Pads which Respond to Changes in Weight Distribution and Body Position to Direct the Movement and Speed of the Scooter while standing on them.Also located on the Top of the unit is a Battery Indicator Light which glows Green when the battery has power and turns Red when the power is getting low, as well as a Function Light.The On/Off Button and Battery Charger Input Jack are positioned next to each other on the Rear of the Unit.Warrear Includes the Charging Port and Adapter Cord in the box, however, I was pleased to find that my scooter arrived with the battery Fully Charged and Ready for Use out of the box.The Front of this Well Constructed Scooter features a Set of Super Bright LED Lights on Either Side of the unit. The 2 1/2" x 1"  Heavy Duty Light Casings house 8 Well Marked LED Bulbs Each. These LED Lights stay on when riding the Scooter and Flash when making turns.They are much brighter than I expected them to be and did a great job of lighting a considerable amount of area in front of the scooter when the sun started to go down.This approx 27 lb Two Wheel Scooter has a Speed Capacity of about 10 miles per hour and will Beep when you are approaching maximum speed.Charging time is about an Hour and you can travel approx.10 miles on a flat terrain before needing to recharge the battery.Having read the entire instruction manual, I took care to wear shoes and put on some protective gear before attempting to ride my newly acquired method of transportation.At 62 yrs of age, I was a bit apprehensive about my ability to operate this Self Balancing Scooter, so I started out by holding onto the door frame to get the feel of standing upright and remaining relaxed.As the Response of the Control Panel to my body movement was pretty much Immediate, I had a few fails before I could travel more than a foot or two, but once I got the hang of how to position my body and coordinate my ankle movement to achieve turns, riding this scooter was actually quite fun!I still need more practice before I will feel confident enough to make my way to the shopping mall, but I am happy to say thatI can travel within my development without injury.So pleased to have been given the opportunity to receive mine at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and offering my honest and unbiased opinion. I am looking forward to my grandson's next visit so he can show me the full extent of what this Warrear Two Wheel Self Balancing Scooter is capable of.In the meanwhile I will continue to take it slow and steady while I build up my leg muscles and confidence.I honestly feel that since I am able to operate and enjoy riding it in spite of my age and lack of coordination, others would enjoy it as much as I do if not more and I am giving it a Well Deserved 5 Star Recommendation!

These Adhesive Bandages by Thrive Health Products offer All of the features I look for in a Quality bandage!The Cotton and Spandex Blend allows the bandages to move with my body without pulling or coming loose.They feature Easy to Open Pull Tab Style Wrappers and 2 Piece Paper Covers over the Non Stick Soft, Sterile Gauze Center Pads.The Fleshtone Color of the Bandages doesn't look too obtrusive against my pale white skin and each bandage features a good amount of adhesive to hold them firmly in place, even when I am washing the dishes or taking a shower.Best of all when it's time to remove them, they are truly "ouchless"!They arrived in a Very Handy Nylon Storage Pouch with a Double Zipper Closure.There are 4 Different Sizes of Bandages inside the pouch, 100 - 2 3/4" x 3/4" Oblong, 75 - 2 1/2" x 3/4" Oblong, 65 - 1 1/2" x 3/8" Oblong and 65- 7/8" Round for a total of 305 Bandages.Thrive Health Products sorts them in strips, according to size and offers Serrations Between Each Wrapper, making it easy to remove one bandage at a time.I received mine at a discounted cost in exchange for testing and offering my Honest and Unbiased opinion and I am extremely pleased to give them a Well Deserved 5 Star Recommendation!

This 8" x 4" Genuine Denim Wallet by J.S.N.Y is too cute and it's functional as well!For months I have been walking around stuffing my ID, credit cards and various other necessary business cards along with my cash into the pockets of my check book cover.Problem was that every time I went shopping, most of the items would end up on the floor while I searched for the credit card I needed to pay for my purchase.When offered the opportunity to receive this this Denim Wallet in exchange for my Honest and Unbiased opinion I didn't hesitate to say yes, especially as it matches the denim purse I carry around with me during the day!The entire Wallet is constructed of Distressed Denim.On the outside of the front of the wallet is an open belt loop that I am using to secure my pen,On the back side is a functional blue jean pocket into which I can fit my 3 3/4" x 2 1/4" cell phone.The inner compartment on one side features a 4" long x  2 3/4" wide Clear Window compartment which now houses my ID Card.Above that are 3 other compartments in which I now carry my credit and store cards for easy access.Under these compartments is a 7" x 3" opening which I am using for my coupons and medical ID cards.The other side of the wallet interior features a 6 1/2" x 3" Zippered coin pocket with a Pleated 7" x 3" open compartment on either side.These pleated compartments are great for keeping folding money or any other important items you may need to locate in a hurry like a receipt for a product you are returning to the store.The stitching is straight and solid throughout and the edges are hemmed in a Black Vinyl-like material.The wallet stays tightly closed thanks to a 1/2" Silver Metal Snap which is well secured to the wallet.Overall a very well constructed Genuine Denim Wallet for the reasonable asking price!

I found these listed under the “home and kitchen,” so one thing to note right away is that these aren’t for food storage. I don’t think that point is necessarily obvious unless you read the details of the product description.With that out of the way, this is an interesting set. You get twelve small, round containers with lids that lock into each other. They’re good for storing small items like rubber bands or thumb tacks or whatever you might think to place in them.They’re sturdy, but not too terribly heavy. They’ll withstand normal use, although if you were hoping to organize things in the garage or workshop, they might not hold up as well.I was somewhat annoyed that there are two stickers on each of these, as they were a pain to remove. The top stickers are supposed to come off easily, but that wasn’t always the case. Whatever - it’s not a huge deal, but it was a bit frustrating initially.

Foam rollers have been gaining popularity for loosening muscles either pre- or post-workout, and while I can see some benefits, the rigidity and uniformity of the foam makes it less than ideal. Moreover, it requires a certain level of coordination to use - more than some people may possess, especially if one has flexibility or mobility problems.The Merrithew Flex Massage Stick has a number of benefits. I think it is actually more effective than a foam roller because the flexible massage wheels conform to the contour of your target area in a way that is natural. I use this in situations where I would normally use a foam roller. For instance, I used to have trouble with my tibialis anterior when I was first starting to run. I’ve largely overcome this problem, but I always like to stretch and massage them before running more than a mile because they still have a tendency to tighten up on me. This pre-run massage forestalls shin pain, and I’m finding the Flex Massage Stick even more effective than the roller I had been using.It’s great for self-massaging your legs, although if you want to hit your back, it’s best to have a partner use it on you. It’s awkward without having someone help you because rolling something along your back just isn’t natural. If you’re reasonably flexible, you might be fine. It still feels kind of good when I use it on my lower back, but hey - it’s way nicer if I don’t have to reach behind me.Overall, it’s a good product with some obvious benefits over a foam roller. I particularly recommend it for runners, as it helps keep your legs feeling great before and after runs.

I own some pairs of Brainwavz headphones, and I continue to be impressed with them. I thought these would be interesting to try and then give them to friends who have a small child who is *almost* ready for them. As you probably know, you can get into a lot of trouble with headphones. The audio transducers are so close to your ear that you can easily play them loud enough to sustain hearing damage. Since kids aren’t great judges of things like this, it’s not necessarily a great idea to trust them with headphones. Well, Brainwavz has you cover. These are limited to 85 dB, which is a pretty safe volume level. Typically, 85 decibels is safe enough to listen to for eight continuous hours without hearing damage.They are constructed pretty well, and the KV-100s can get tossed around a bit without breaking. Sure, if you abuse them, they will break, but unless your child is a terror, these should be fine.

I own many pairs of in-ear monitors (IEMs) ranging from some inexpensive pairs in the $20 range to a pair of Etymotic Research IEMs that cost hundreds. My Etymotic pair has an unrivaled amount of sonic detail, but they sound terrible without a headphone amplifier. If I use them with my iPod, I get an anemic sound that is totally unsatisfying. This is where the Brainwavz S3s come into play. They produce a rich, full sound with plenty of bass (but not too much!) and great sonic clarity. AND, they do all this even with a low voltage source like a smartphone or iPod.The S3s come with some nice accessories. You get a rigid carrying case that protects the headphones, even if they make their way to the bottom of your bag and get crushed by heavy books (or whatever). It’s a surprisingly nice case. So many IEMs come with a soft case or a pouch, and these are really more for keeping everything together than offering protection. You also get a range of earpieces so that you can get a comfortable fit.The flat cable is surprisingly nice. You would really have to work to tangle these. All I have to do to tangle my Apple earbuds is give them a dirty look. The S3s also come out of their case as I left them. I also like the thickness of the cable. It offers more protection than the thin cables you usually find with this sort of thing.Overall, I am extremely pleased with the S3s. I love the sound. It’s balanced in a way that is rare. So many of today’s headphones are way too bass-heavy (thank you Beats by Dr. Dre…), and it’s nice to find a pair with a nice, full bass register than don’t overpower the rest of the frequency spectrum. The highs are clear, and the all-important midrange is way smoother than you would expect from something in this price range. These are now my go-to pair when traveling. Highly recommended.

This is the largest portable power bank that I’ve ever tested. With 16000mah available, you can charge any phone multiple times, and you can even charge a large tablet at least twice. The surprising thing is that the unit isn’t all that big. It’s pretty heavy, but it’s not too big to toss in whatever sort of bag you use. You could watch multiple movies on a long flight and power your tablet off of this thing. It’s amazing.The unit itself is well designed and aesthetically pleasing. I intended to test this really thoroughly and see how many times I could charge my iPhone 5s, but I got so many charges out of it that I lost track. Suffice it to say that this will last you a week, unless you have some sort of massive, power-hungry phone like an iPhone 6+. Heck - even if you have a Galaxy Note 4, you can still charge it 4.5 times.Overall, I’m extremely pleased with the Lumsing power bank. It is now my go-to for traveling.

Since Amazon has combined the listings for multiple products, I am specifying that I’m reviewing the Lenox Holiday Glass Bowl.At 20 ounces, this is a pretty small bowl. It’s about the size of something you would use for cereal. It would be appropriate for something like candy or some sort of roasted nut mixture. With its traditional Christmas decoration, it will work well with most home decors. I do think it’s kind of disingenuous of Lenox to call this a “holiday” bowl since it’s decorated in a classic Christmas style.One of the things that should be noted is that the bowl is made in China. Lenox prides itself on being an American company that still produces things in the USA. *Some* of their current line of products are made in the USA, but not this. If you’re hoping to support domestic production, look elsewhere.In terms of functionality, it’s fine. There’s not much to say. It’s elegant and small. If you are looking for accessories for a traditional Christmas, this is an elegant solution.

Thus far, I’ve not had a use for a circuit analyzer, but hey - you never know what might come up. I tested this in a couple gfci receptacles in my house, and the device seemed to be working well. Fortunately, everything checked out. I suppose I would need to find a faulty outlet before I could really determine the full functionality of the Shock II.It’s easily to figure out how to use this, and the LED readout is clear. Maybe my favorite feature is that this carries a 250-pound crush rating. I suppose that if you’re a professional, there’s always the possibility that your tools could get crushed, and it’s nice to know that the Shock II is rugged enough to withstand that sort of pressure.

These are some seriously forgettable headphones. They look kind of cool, but in terms of sonics, they’re severely lacking. Yes, I am judging these in relative terms. Of course $10 headphones aren’t going to give one an amazing audiophile experience, but I would expect that these would at least be better than the stock earbuds that came with my iPhone. Sadly, they are not.

Having recently gotten back into swimming, it was time to find a good pair of goggles. These Cressi Flash goggles ended up being the nicest pair of goggles I’ve ever owned. The suction is excellent without placing an undue amount of pressure on my face. The anti-fog treatment worked well for me, although I understand others have had problems with it. These come with a nice carrying case. I’ve had a few that came with a cheap plastic case, but this Cressi case ought to last quite a while. Highly recommended.

I’ll state right upfront that I’m no expert in this sort of surveillance and security equipment. I’m a regular guy with a solid amount of tech savvy, but again, no specific expertise in things like this. I’m writing this review for others like me who are considering some sort of security installation project but don’t really have a background in this sort of thing. I’m happy to report that it’s surprisingly easy to get this up and running.I imagine most people who buy this own some sort of small business, and if so, having 16 cameras makes a lot of sense. Even if you just want to surveil your home, the wealth of cameras allows you to get certain areas from multiple angles. I recommend making a list of vulnerable spots and assigning some cameras to them as an initial step. Check the angles, and ensure that there are no blind spots. If you can’t get total coverage of an area, use the rest of the cameras to assist with these areas.Installation of the cameras is simple, but running cable is not. Because I needed to test this system to create my review within a short time frame, I simply connected the cameras, set them in various places in my house, and powered the system on. I have spots picked out, but running sixteen cables through the walls isn’t going to happen overnight. That’s really the trickiest part.The software is easy enough to use. It’s not exactly elegant, but it’s good. The setup wizard is great. It handles most everything for you. I wouldn’t say this is an idiot-proof product, but the software aspect is definitely within the grasp of most adults who possess at least basic computer skills. Don’t worry; you don’t need to be a computer engineer to figure this out.The video quality is just great. Gone are the days of grainy, black and white footage where the pixels are as big as the intruders’ faces. With 1080p, you don’t have to worry about getting a good image of whomever you’re recording. Of course, you may want to lower the video resolution to get more recording time. Three terabytes is well and good, but when you’re recording 16 HD video streams, the data disappears fast. Even if you lower the resolution to 720p, the quality is still amazing.Two awesome things: first, the remote monitoring is awesome. I accessed the cameras through my iPhone and iPad with no trouble. I assume the Android integration is just as good. I also love the PTZ camera. It’s just really cool.I don’t have previous experience with surveillance systems like this, but I cannot imagine anything that I would improve here, other than making the software even more user-friendly that it already is. I’m really nitpicking with that comment. It’s quite easy to use. Overall, I couldn’t be happier.

Since Amazon has seen fit to combine reviews of TONS of different DII products under one listing, I’ll specify that I’m reviewing the DII 100% Cotton Machine Washable Oversized Dishtowels.I have a number of kitchen towels by DII. They’re all pretty adequate. Nothing special, but reasonable quality at a very low price. At 18x28” they’re fairly large, which is nice. The pattern looks good, and the colors have held up well after a few washings. I recommend washing them in cold water first, just in case the colors bleed. I didn’t have any problems with it, but then again, I usually do cold water with new things.If you’re trying to outfit your first apartment with some cheap, but decent kitchen towels, these will fit the bill. You could buy something similar at Target for a similar price, or you can buy them online. It really makes little difference.

At first, I thought this product was a solution in search of a problem. After all, it’s not hard to ignite charcoal. If you use enough lighter fluid, you get flames easily. What I hadn’t realized is that lighter fluid colors the flavor of the food a lot more than I realized. To my surprise, the Fire UP is actually a pretty cool product.The thing to realize is that it’s not really a tiny flamethrower. It’s not like spraying huge flames over your charcoal and setting an instant fire. It takes a bit of time, and you’ll end up using the wand for a few minutes in the process. It’s pretty easy to use, and the instructions are clear.Ultimately, this isn’t a totally necessary grilling accessory, but it’s kind of nice if you want to avoid lighter fluid. It’s also a cool gift idea for the guy (or girl) who has everything.

Calvin Klein’s Eternity is a fairly old fragrance, and the fact that you can still find it everywhere must be a testament to its popularity. Here we have “Eternity Now” as a body spray. I’ve smelled this fragrance in its original cologne form, and it was a nice, masculine scent. As an aerosol body spray, it smells like something cooked up by chemists in an industrial lab. The subtlety of the original is gone and the most obvious features are blown up to nose-piercing proportions. It’s really, really strong, so would recommend using it sparingly.Basically, it smells cheap. If you’re looking for an inexpensive cologne substitute, this will do just fine, and it will last a long time. If you want a nice fragrance though, you’ll need to spend a bit more or at least try a different brand.

I’m a huge fan of beef jerky (more than I should be, really). I could probably live off of Tabasco Slim Jims for about a week, if I needed to. The thing is, jerky is super, super salty no matter how lean the meat is (yeah, turkey jerky doesn’t really translate into a meaningful health boost). If I’m going to ingest this much sodium, it had better be worth it. The taste needs to be outstanding in order for me to justify the calorie and sodium penalty. Unfortunately, Old Wisconsin jerky just isn’t good enough.The flavor is very average. I wish there was something distinctive about it, but I’m having a tough time describing it because it’s just such a standard jerky flavor, which is to say, it tastes like salt with a little pepper and some other mild spices. The texture is a bit different from a Slim Jim, which is more fibrous. The Old Wisconsin jerky is more like a long, skinny summer sausage. When you bite it, it’s somewhat crisp. I didn’t like or dislike this, so I’m mostly just pointing out the difference here.12 grams of protein is a nice boost, but 580mg of sodium is a LOT for a 90-calorie stick of jerky that will leave you hungry an hour later. The whole idea that this is a healthy on-the-go snack is ludicrous. You don’t eat jerky because it’s healthy; you eat it because it tastes great. It’s a treat.My rule is, “if it’s bad for me, it had better taste amazing or it’s not worth the calories.” This stuff just isn’t good enough. It’s way too generic for me to consider buying it again. I don’t care how good the ingredients are. If the taste isn’t there, what’s the point?

This is a great paint sprayer for small jobs. The reservoir isn’t huge, so it’s not really appropriate for painting something like the walls of a large room (unless you like refilling things continuously). It’s amazing for staining, varnishing, or lacquering smaller items. I suppose it would be fine to seal your deck with something like this. You’ll just need to plan on refilling a few times if you’ve got a large space to cover.I didn’t have a ton of experience with paint sprayers previously, but the PW25150 was really straightforward to use. Read the manual and you’ll be fine. Cleaning is simple. Take the things apart, wash them, and put them back together. It’s a great design, so it’s simple to figure out how everything fits together.If you’ve not used a paint sprayer before, this is a fine one to start with. Recommended.

I’ve not used a paint sprayer previously, but after this experience, it’ll be my go-to for most future paint jobs. I wasn’t sure what to expect. The idea of spraying paint seemed a little intimidating, mostly because I’m used to rollers and brushes, which offer a lot of control. I’m one of those people that likes be very slow and methodical. Well, the PaintWIZ PW25000 (25000!!) was actually really easy to use, and I felt good about the experience.Definitely read the instructions, if you’re new to paint sprayers. It’s easy enough to use, but there are a few things that didn’t seem overly obvious at first.One complaint I have is that you have to refill often. This would be great for a small job, but if I wanted to use it on an entire house, it would probably become tiresome to keep refilling it. On the other hand, it makes the painting job super fast. It’s a toss up. Another issue is the fact that the paint sprays really far. I recommend covering everything in the vicinity. It’s not like a little can of spray paint that sprays a couple feet. The PaintWIZ goes a lot further.On the plus side, it’s really easy to clean. Pull everything apart, wash it, and put it back together. It’s a fairly painless process. I’m sure there sprayers that are way nicer and offer more control, but as a starter unit, the PW25000 is great. Based on this experience, I’ll probably replace it with something nicer when it stops working. For now, I’m very pleased!

I don’t have a baby or anything, but I thought I would try these anyway. After all, couldn’t we all use washcloths that are better for our skin? I’d never heard of bamboo washcloths, but now that I’ve tried them, I’m a huge fan.These specific washcloths are huge at 10”x10”. They’re super soft, and even after washing them a few times, they still feel great. I primarily use these when washing my face, so it’s nice to have something this luxurious. The only downside is that they’re pretty thin. If these were thick, they would be perfect; however, when you factor in the price, I can’t be too disappointed.It’s a really nice set, and I’m sure your baby will appreciate them. Or, if you’re a random guy like me, your face will appreciate the softness. Highly recommended!

These work great for running. I used to have a lot of lower leg pain, but these seem to work some how. It's an odd sensation because it's so tight, but it feels great while you're working out (and it feels even better when you take them off). I've used them now for a few months, they've been through the wash a bunch, and they're holding up just fine. Recommended.

It seems that the science is still out on whether muscle rollers like this actually do much of anything. Chiropractors recommend them, but lets not forget that a chiropractor is not a medical doctor. Having read various studies, it seems that if you think this helps, go ahead and do it. Otherwise, you’re not missing out on much. For me, it feels kind of good sometimes, but it certainly doesn’t do anything that has a lasting effect. Tight, sore, or injured muscles go back to being tight, sore, or injured by the next day.How does this Gaiam massage roller compare? First of all, it’s not foam. Because it’s inflatable, you can adjust the firmness to whatever you want. This is kind of cool because some foam rollers are just painful to use. The fact that you can put this in the freezer is also unique, in my experience. It’s an odd sensation.It’s quite small - smaller than any foam roller I’ve ever seen. As such, it’s not great for larger muscle groups, like glutes or your back in general. It takes more work to position it, which some may find annoying.As with all Gaiam products, it’s aesthetically pleasing. Their design team is top notch. It doesn’t really help relieve muscle pain, but it does look nice.Overall, I’m ambivalent about it. It’s fine, I suppose. I wish the roller was longer.

This thing is rock solid. When I looked at the pictures in the product listing, it seemed like it would be kind of a light weight shelf, and I couldn’t believe that each shelf could hold up to 750 pounds. Well, handling it person was a totally different experience. It’s not incredibly heavy, but it’s really solidly constructed. I don’t have to think twice about putting things on it, no matter how heavy.Building the shelf was a pain. There are a bunch of nuts and bolts that you have to screw in. It’s not necessarily hard, but it takes a while. I recommend putting on some music and settling in for a long construction period. Thankfully I had some quality college football to keep me distracted. As per the directions, I can attest to the value of having an extra person to help assemble this. It’s just kind of heavy and awkward by yourself.Most people can probably get by with something weaker than this. Who really has that much super heavy stuff for a shelf like this? You could load each level up with a really heavy tool chest and you wouldn’t come close to reaching the weight capacity. However, when you consider the reasonable price, why not get something that will last forever?

As a pry bar, the DB16 works just fine. It’s shaft is weighted such that you get a powerful mechanical advantage over whatever you’re prying apart. The handle is a nice bonus, although I’m not sure how necessary it is. In terms of the nail puller function, I have to agree with one of the previous reviewers who complained that the metal is too soft for extensive use. I too noticed some wear after pulling a series of nails (just for a test to verify his experience). If you’re a weekend project kind of guy (or girl), perhaps this is just the gadget you’re looking for. If you’re a contractor, this isn’t going to cut it.One thing I will note though is that the release button on my unit is indeed metal, not plastic. I’m not sure if that reviewer has a slightly different model or what, but my pry bar has a metal button. There’s that at least.I’m not sure how it won an editor’s choice award from Popular Mechanics (as the product listing claims). The idea of an adjustable nail puller is great, but the execution isn’t amazing. I don’t know if it’s because this was made in Taiwan or simply because Apex Tool Group (whoever that is) cut corners. The best I can do is three stars, and I think that’s being a bit too generous.

While the benefits of compression gear are controversial, the massive increase in sales over the last few years shows that people want them. Unless you’re an olympic athlete, you probably won’t see much of a tangible benefit. That, however, isn’t entire the point. If we’re being honest, high tech workout gear is as much about fashion as it is about performance. With people spending more and more time at the gym, I can understand how the way you look affects the way you feel about yourself, which subsequently affects your performance. Maybe the effect is mostly psychological, but it’s still meaningful.Thus, I do not intend to argue that there is no point in compression gear. It serves a purpose for some people, and if you’re one of those people, this shirt is amazing. I have some Zensah socks that I love, and now I have this compression shirt. I don’t like to strut around in skin-tight clothing, personally, so I often wear this under a t-shirt or something. For me, it’s sort of like the world’s fanciest long underwear. It’s like a sort of undershirt that fits perfectly, keeps me warm when the temperature dips below a certain threshold, and offers a high level of comfort.There are some pretty nice features built in here. For instance, the seams are mostly flat. The arm holes do have seams, but it’s not in a place that sees much movement, so the chances of irritation are really low. The moisture wicking properties of the material work surprisingly well. It’s so weird how fast this thing dries. Basically, every part of this shirt is well thought-out and well designed.If you have virtually no body fat, and you want to show off, by all means - just wear this. If you feel like being a little more modest, this works just fine under a t-shirt. It’s incredibly comfortable and adds just enough warmth to help you out on cool-weather outdoor workouts. Highly recommended.

If you do yoga, you know how critical it is to have clothing that doesn’t restrict you. So many men’s athletic shorts now have such a long inseam that they go slightly over your knees, which is incredibly annoying when doing yoga (or squats, for that matter). These yoga shorts are a perfect solution. They’re stretchy, they don’t hinder your knee movement, and they’re just quite comfortable.Perhaps they’re a little shorter than I would wear for lifting at the gym, but I’d be okay wearing these in public for a yoga class. I can’t say that about all yoga gear that I’ve tried. They’re not skin tight, and that’s important to me. I think YogaAddict has struck a nice balance here.Overall, I’m very satisfied with them. In my experience, the size I bought fit exactly as I expected. Consult the sizing reference and order with confidence.

Having tested about ten different pairs of bluetooth gym headphones, I would rank these somewhere in the middle of the pack. The sound quality isn’t amazing, but it’s not the worst I’ve heard. The fit is a bit better than some models, which actually counts for a lot.One problem I have with a lot of models is that the earpieces are so heavy that they fall out of your ears easily. Nothing bugs me when I’m trying to break my 5k time like having to devote mental energy toward shoving earbuds back into my ear. The way these wrap around the top of your ear holds them in place quite securely.The downside is that this design doesn’t really allow them to make a good seal in your ear canal. In-ear monitors (IEMs) depend on the seal for generating bass response. This means that the Soundpeats Q2s will always sound shallow when you’re wearing them simply because you can’t get them to stay sealed. I’m actually okay with this because I’ll take a secure fit over sound quality any day. It’s not like any of these gym IEMs sound that great anyway.The bottom line is that these sound kind of mediocre, but I can forgive that because they stay in place while I’m running.

I own six different shower speakers and this is the worst by far in terms of sound quality. It’s certainly rugged, but that’s about all I can say. Of course I’m not expecting a transcendent audiophile experience, but this is so far below the shower speaker standard that I need to note a few things. First, the bass is the weakest of any shower speaker I tested. Its highs are also really dull. It kind of sounds like your ears are clogged up, and you can’t quite hear the high frequencies clearly.This model uses a generic design that different companies put their label on. If you search for bluetooth shower speakers, you’ll find at least ten that look exactly like this. I’ve reviewed three of them, and they’re all equally bad in the exact same way.In terms of functionality, it does make sounds, and it does connect fairly easily. I like that there is a dedicated power button because I hate having to hold down a multi-function button for long periods of time.If you want something that sounds decent, try the Mpow Armor. Or, there is another good, generic model made by a few different companies including iFox Creations and Superior Sounds. Once you see what they look like, you can pick any brand you want. I’ve got two of them, and they’re all the same, but they’re good.Avoid this one. The only logic I can find behind all the rave reviews is that these customers haven't heard any other bluetooth shower speakers. I suppose if you don't know what you're missing, you might be more accepting.

This is such an interesting idea. I’ve never been satisfied with any of the car air fresheners that I’ve used, as they all smell like cheap fragrance chemicals to me. Since I already have essential oils on hand, this is a great solution. You have a lot of flexibility in terms of positioning, so you can position the sink however you need it. I feel fairly good about its safety, although I’m an adult without kids or rowdy friends. If you have kids who occasionally go crazy, this might not be for you. It’s not like it’s filled with a lot of liquid or anything, but you still don’t want to knock it over.It takes a few minutes for it to heat up, but after that, it does a good job of filling your car with a pleasing aroma. Since you’re only using a couple drops, it’s pretty cost-effective. My only complaint is that it’s kind of big and clunky. I’d like something much smaller that doesn’t look like a cheap plastic device. If I’m going to leave it in my car all the time, I want it to look good. Other than that, no complaints.

It seems like everyone has a ton of microUSB devices these days from Bluetooth speakers to non-Apple smartphones to portable power banks to just about anything with a rechargeable battery. It’s always a good idea to have some of these cables on hand, because you never know when you’ll need to charge something. Having used a variety of Sabrent products for the last three years, I can attest to their quality. I have a couple Sabrent hubs, a bluetooth speaker, and some miscellaneous adapters that are in my permanent rotation. They’ve held up really well, so I would expect nothing less of these cables. Highly recommended.

Apple adapters are pretty expensive, and since Apple seems to continually change the style of their ports, it becomes annoying to continually upgrade your adapters. Why not save some money and go with a generic version? I’ve used a whole slew of Sabrent products over the last three years, and they always work well for me. Based on that experience, I decided to try their Mini Display Port adapter, and happily, it works great. Normally I don’t recommend going with a product that isn’t at least “Apple Certified,” because I’ve gotten into trouble with non-functional cables before. Fortunately, this works great.Recommended to anyone tired of paying for new Apple adapters every few years.

I’ve reviewed maybe 20 portable power banks in the last year, but none were like this. As a 9000 mAh power bank, it’s unexceptional and extremely expensive; BUT, as a portable jump starter, it’s pretty amazing, and it totally justifies its price. It’s so weird to me that something this small can jumpstart my car, but it works. I’m not sure what the results would be for a larger vehicle, but it handles my Honda Fit just fine.It comes with a nice array of accessories including an AC adaptor, a tri-tip adapter terminating in MicrosUSB, 30-pin, and lightning connectors, a cigarette adaptor, and most importantly, the battery terminal clips. everything can be stored together in the pouch that comes with it. All-in-all, it’s a very handy set.I do recommend reading the manual carefully. Make sure you know what you’re doing in terms of the basic order of operations. It’s always possible to get into trouble if you don’t put safety first. The good news is that this unit is well built and won’t overheat like something made out of cheap plastic might.Hopefully you’ll never need to use it, but it sure is nice to know that it’s available. Recommended!

I highly recommend using a protein supplement if you’re trying to either lose weight or add muscle because it’s a very efficient way to get a lot of protein without a lot of cholesterol or fat. However, I have to warn you about EAS products. The FDA does not regulate protein supplements, and some brands have higher levels of heavy metals (arsenic, lead, cadmium, bismuth, antimony, silver) that you would ideally ingest. In a recent study, EAS products ranked anywhere from a B+ to a D in terms of toxicity. I didn’t find this exact product amongst those tested, but it seems to indicate that EAS products are held to a lower standard of quality in terms of the amount of heavy metals they find acceptable.In small quantities, they won’t harm you too much, but if you drink multiple scoops of this daily, it can add up and cause problems. I would highly recommend doing a bit of research and finding a brand that is a bit less toxic, if you’re going to consume a lot of this regularly. Garden of Life, NOW Foods, Integrated Supplements, and the easily obtainable Optimum Gold Standard brands all have a lower toxicity, and those are just a few that I could remember off the top of my head.I’ve been using protein supplements for years, and they really did help me lose a lot of weight and add a lot of muscle (in conjunction with a drastic lifestyle and dietary change). They can be useful, but brands matter quite a lot, and EAS isn’t meeting the standard.

This product is the same as the DBPOWER version I recently reviewed, just branded differently.  Also note, the DBPOWER version I reviewed has since changed models but kept same reviews. They all appear to be manufactured in the same place. I deducted 1 star when compared to my review because the IOS application provided with this brand is a little slower than the DB Application.  However, you can still use the DBPOWER IOS application (and likely the android version).I did not expect this product to work frankly, especially after reading the instructions. However, I was incredibly surprised.  Just keep in mind you MUST HAVE a smartphone to use this device.The camera comes packaged very well. As I said, instructions were weak. However, the camera is so simple to use, the instructions are more than good enough. Setup took about 10 minutes! !0 minutes after opening the box, I was viewing the camera on my Iphone via the "DB Cam" Iphone app, which performs flawlessly. Key installation points are: 1) make sure your phone is connected to home wifi. 2)make sure you plug in the camera and wait for the blue LED light to slowly flash before playing the configuration sound from the phone. That's pretty much the only possible glitches you can run into.Now, whether on my home or cellular network, I can easily access the camera AND REALTIME AUDIO. There is even a talk feature- that doe snot work too well however! I was impressed when I was able to very easily access the camera while my phone was on my home network. However, the app and camera really shine when I am away from home. The picture is great, you can zoom in on part of the video, listen to audio, and switch between multiple cameras with a click on the screen. When away from home, I access the camera via my cellular LTE network (ATT) in less than 3-5 seconds (connection time).The only issue with the camera is that it is not suitable for low light (as most are not). Not an issue for me really but might be for some. Also, it is not intended for outdoor use. Note- I received a sample for evaluation and no obligation review.

This product simply does what it is supposed to do.  This product replaced my older version.  It can be used with an extension pole (not included).  When combined with the pole, the usefulness of the product is significant compared to without the pole, which of course limits reach.  Nevertheless, the kit is good and the included handle versatile for reaching behind areas.  The Swiffer product also collects, and for the most part, traps dust particularly when compared to traditional feather dusters that just seem to move dust around.  To extend the life of the dusters, we shake them out outside (do so gently).

These washcloths worked out to be excellent for everything.  Though targeted for maternity use, they work extremely well as a washcloth for anyone, especially of you prefer a soft washcloth.  They are very absorbent.  Even better, despite a few washings, they have not shrunk at all.

What's not to like?  Hershey's has never disappointed me with any product and I have been enjoying them for over 40 years.  This product comes in a time and contains a mix of both milk and dark chocolate covered caramel's.  The product arrived on my front doorstep intact and no chocolate melted even in the heat (shaded front step however).  If the product was delivered in my mailbox, and stored there all day, I am not sure how that would have worked out to be honest.  As a side note, the tin does make a classic holiday presentation.

We tried these types of tanning solution in the past.  In nearly every case, we dealt with a lingering chemical smell.  This is not the case with this product.We are light complexioned and found the product blended very well.  Essentially, it is a mousse form product that provides and even non obtrusive color, that does not look fake (i.e. orange).  Probably best described as a "glow."  On body parts with hair, we found best results are produced after shaving and exfoliation.  There was no greasy feeling and the tan will last a little less than a week in our usage.  I would apply the product in strong natural light if at all possible.  This will help you avoid streaking. I also strongly recommend use of a mitt in application to avoid the discoloring of the palm of tour hand.As a side note for comparison, we all thought this product was better than the Sephora.

We have a freshman in High School and thought this would be a good first introduction.  From that perspective, it likely is as it provides 1,600 practice questions with online access to 1,100 more and 20 online quizzes.  Therefore, my daughter will have a good sampling of questions.  However, where the book lacks, unless I am missing something, is in test taking strategy you often seek with other publications.  For us, this is no big deal at this stage.  However, for those preparing to take the test soon, it could be.The book is divided into same four elements as the ACT; English, Math, Reading, and Science. Each section has a list of questions and possible answers with answers are listed at the end of the chapter.  The font and layout is clear, which is critical to good review and study.  But, once again, there is no strategy guidance on test taking techniques, which is critical in all college entrance exams.  Therefore, you will need to go elsewhere to cover that aspect.

I did not expect this product to work frankly, especially after reading the instructions.  However, I was incredibly surprised.The camera comes packaged very well.  As I said, instructions were weak.  However, the camera is so simple to use, the instructions are more than good enough.  Setup took about 10 minutes!  !0 minutes after opening the box, I was viewing the camera on my Iphone via the "DB Cam" Iphone app, which performs flawlessly.  Key installation points are:  1) make sure your phone is connected to home wifi.  2)make sure you plug in the camera and wait for the blue LED light to slowly flash before playing the configuration sound from the phone.  That's pretty much the only possible glitches you can run into.Now, whether on my home or cellular network, I can easily access the camera AND REALTIME AUDIO.  There is even a talk feature!  I was impressed when I was able to very easily access the camera while my phone was on my home network.  However, the app and camera really shine when I am away from home.  The picture is great, you can zoom in on part of the video, listen to audio, and switch between multiple cameras with a click on the screen.  When away from home, I access the camera via my cellular LTE network (ATT) in less than 3-5 seconds (connection time).The only issue with the camera is that it is not suitable for low light (as most are not).  Not an issue for me really but might be for some.  Also, it is not intended for outdoor use.  Note- I received a sample for evaluation and no obligation review.  However, I just ordered two more!

Putting aside the practicality of using this product, when used, I found the product worked exceedingly well.In my case, my feet are in bad shape from very hard years in the military and then what can be best described as extreme law enforcement.  My right foot also continues to suffer the effects of full blown frostbite from a winter survival course.  These prior conditions result in dry and cracked feet, sometimes painful.  Therefore, I was particularly interested in this product and its application.  Application is as you would expect for a mud type product.  The scent is not an issue and better than what you could reasonably expect.  I really have to put time aside to use the product however.  I first use a pumice stone after cleaning my feet.  After drying my feet, I apply the mud cream.  I let the cream dry for about 10 minutes and then wash it off.The first application showed immediate, though not miraculous, improvements.  Results from repeated use after nine days impressed me.  My dry skin is nearly no longer an issue.  Period.  The bottom of my right heal, which typically developed layers of dead skin and formed one large callous pad, is nearly gone.  I find myself no longer dreading showing my feet in public.Bottom line, even at the high cost, I highly recommend this product if needed.

Ultra tough is a good way to describe these earphones.  The phones are built great and fit perfectly.  In fact, the build quality is clearly rugged. The phones come with additional sets of ear covers in different sizes.  At this price point, these are a great deal.Sound on the phones takes about 1 week to really break in.  The sound is great without overuse of bass.  Audio is crisp and clear without question.  Volume is very good for those who really prefer their music loud.  Note- I received a sample product from evaluation and a no obligation review.

These glasses are OK.  I found my sample to be well designed, but the build quality was not great; it was good.  While I stopped buying $150 sunglasses, I found that I can typically get very good, well built, and stylish sunglasses in the $15-$20 range at any local gas station or Walmart. In my opinion, these glasses are not as good as those, though not bad.The glass frames fit my large face profile very well. I found the lenses to be clear, though not as clear as I am accustomed to.  I mainly use the glasses around the house when doing yardwork.  Note- I received a sample for evaluation and a no obligation review.

This is a simple product that is just excellent all the way around.  The bottle easily disassembles to place fruit in the infuser.  My 8 year old can easily handle this aspect herself.  The bottle is constructed well, though I suspect the hinge on top will be first part to go.  Other than that, it is a great easily transportable bottle.  Note- I receive a sample for evaluation and a no obligation review.

I have been using regular screen protectors for a while and considered moving to glass.  While the product is perfectly designed for size, cutouts, and application, it ultimately did not work for me after two days (see below).The product comes very well packaged.  Included are items for cleaning your screen prior to application.  Unlike traditional non-glass screen protectors, glass screen protectors apply very easily with just some minor adjustments for alignment.  If you properly cleaned the screen, you should have absolutely no issues with bubbles.  Also, repositioning a glass screen protector is far easier than non-glass.I love that the screen protector protects the screen and in fact, it works well.  Touch is as easy on the iPhone as without a screen protector.  However, the issue I has was that after three days, the left side of the screen protector would no longer adhere to the screen.  The screen protector still remains on the screen and everything remained functional, but the air gap is annoying visually and I cannot get over it.  This issue may be limited to my product sample as the anomalies do happen.Overall, I would love the product if only it did not start separating from the screen.  Note- I receive a sample for evaluation and a no obligation review.

Despite our sensitive skin, neither of us experienced any issues using this product.  While expensive compared to many other face mask types, this product clearly works and works very well.  The smell is not bad at all and in fact what you should probably expect.  There is also no peeling or scrubbing required after application; it simply rinses off.  I would equate this mask to a purifying product more than anything.I will note the product had a drying effect on our skin that needed to be balanced with a moisturizer afterwards.  But our skin not only felt very good, it actually felt slightly firmer (for both of us).

Disposable razor performance has never impressed me and when you factor in the environmental waste, I steered away from them.  Although this product does not eliminate the environmental waste issue, it seems to solve the performance issue.  Economically, the blades are a win at less than $10 (current price) for razors.The razor is a solid product all around.  It feels good in the hand.  The blades are set at a great angle for shaving your face or your head.  The blades are impressively sharp and seem to last for quite a few head and face shaves (about a week for me) if you properly care for them (dry the blades after use and keep them dry, for example, do not store them in the shower).

The Plush Moose was larger than expected and constructed incredibly well.  My dog took to the plush toy right away, similar to how a cat is usually attracted to catnip toys right away.  I was actually surprised by this attraction to the toy.  The toy squeaks when bitted in the center.  The leg's, arms, and other extensions off the body are sewn together very well with very sturdy fabric and stitching.  I would imagine this toy will be around for a very long time.

This is a great lamp.  The LED lamp is bright and easily adjustable.  The build quality is slightly better than I expected.  The LED intensity is adjustable and combined with the clamp, make this lamp versatile.  In my case, I use it in the garage over my workbench.  The ability to adjust intensity also reduces eye strain when used near a computer screen.  In the box you get 1 clip on lamp and 1 AC power cord. This power cord plugs into the port on the inside of the clip area. Only downside is that if you use the clip, you will need about 1 3/4 inch thick surface for stability.Overall a great product.  Note, I received this lamp in exchange for an honest no obligation review.

Our dog loved this food.  However, I would not characterize this dog food as a "super food" in that these same ingredients are found in many other brands of food, often less costly.  This food is clearly on the expensive side in  my opinion.  We experienced no noticeable side affects subsequent to use of this food.  But sometimes it can take awhile for affects to become noticed.  The kibble in food is dense and compact.  Clearly, the ingredients list is well balanced.  Nevertheless, in comparison to cost, just not sure it is worth it.

First, the unit is packed very well and arrived undamaged.  I was impressed in that assembly was an absolute minimum.  Essentially, you insert racks and smoker box.  The unit itself seems very well constructed throughout.  Also, it's nice that the unit is on wheels (already installed), making movement easy, even when hot. Though I actually prefer analog controls and indicators, the digital readouts and controls did an overall good job for us.
